Reviews.Title: “Location is the key with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cobler
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel by any stretch but it is perfect for exploring Mid Town Manhattan economically. It is located in the Theatre District and the subway line along 8th Avenue is steps away. Also, Penn Station is about a 10 to 15 minute walk south. Finally, you are within easy walking of Times Square and Restaurant Row. We stayed here in 2007 but many of the rooms have been renovated so make sure you get one of these.

Reviews.Title: “Value near Bway & Time Sq”
Reviews.Author: metalmaiden
Reviews.Content: Now using the nickname "The Milford" this hotel is undergoing huge renovations turning it into a Euro-modern value hotel. Sort of a minimalist, urban functional feel. The lobby is not finished yet but check in was swift. Interesting elevators have you punch in your floor number rather than the up/down button and, with almost no waiting, you get your own elevator that opens and goes right to your floor! The rooms are small & decorated all in white. We found our room too be clean and the beds were very comfortable. There's a flat screen TV and docking station alarm clock which my drained phone was happy to see. Basic amenities in the bathroom. There is a small bar area off the lobby but no restaurant in the hotel. But who needs one when there are dozens of choices just outside the door. There is no fitness center. Again, who needs one when you have spent the day trekking all over the city! There is a gift shop in the building that has snacks and whatnots incase you may need something. If you are looking for a clean, comfy bed in the theater district or Time Square area that's a New York value the M maybe right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: BTravelin47
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at The Milford Plaza in March. Knew the property was being renovated and were prepared for some inconvenience. However, we encountered none. Very positive experience. LOCATION: The Milford Plaza is at 8th and 44th - in the middle of the theatre district, a block from Times Square and short walk to Restaurant Row. After checking in, we wandered over to Fifth Avenue, then down to Bryant Park, and over to Macy's. It really is a super location! ROOM: Nicely renovated corner room with queen bed on the 7th floor. Contemporary furnishings. View of Planet Hollywood at Times Square and several theaters. Noise was not an issue. The room and bath were bright and squeaky clean. Plenty of room for two. Only a slight problem with where to lay out our second suitcase. Solved this by using the desk chair. Not an issue that would prevent us from staying here again. STAFF: The ladies at the front desk were very professional, but could have been a bit more cheerful. The bartender was excellent. Yes, it was a temporary bar setup, but there were votive candles on the tables and even small bowls of snacks. Actually, better than we expected given the renovations. As I said above, housekeeping provided us with a very clean room and bath. VALET PARKING: I think we paid $45. Very prompt and courteous service. NEARBY RESTAURANTS: Shake Shack is across the street -- very good Chicago dogs, hamburgers looked good too. Playwrights Celtic Pub is a small neighborhood-type bar a block north of the Milford. Several deli's both north and south on 8th. Enjoyed our dinner at Becco on Restaurant Row. OVERALL EXPERIENCE: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We would definitely like to return. Although after the renovations are complete, we may not be able to afford it. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Rick J
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel...the location is amazing, the staff was really nice and helpful. My only issue was that the room wasn't exactly clean. We found some "artifacts" from a previous occupant in the room...enough said. Overall, I would definitely go back to the Milford.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be put off by other reviews! Hotel is good.”
Reviews.Author: Emma M
Reviews.Content: Ok so let's not get over excited... You're not going to be overwhelmed with grandeur here. HOWEVER, this hotel is ideally located (8th and 44th) - 2 mins from Times Square, 5 mins walk from the Bus Authority and more than sufficient for NYC. I paid $620 for 4 nights, the room was small but clean (and had an all important iPod docking station!), and staff were attentive and polite. Once checked in I realised my room did not have a safe, reception staff quickly changed me to a room with a safe and the duty manager offered me 50% off my room for that night due to the inconvenience. Can't say fairer than that I think! Maid service once per day; new towels, bedding, toiletries etc. only criticism is the elevators are a pretty arduous affair - you have to wait a good 4 or 5 mins for a lift, and then stopping at various floors on the way down at busy periods means that a trip from the 25th floor to ground level can take over 10 mins! If a bit of chipped paint on the wall is going to offend you then find somewhere else to stay. However, if like me, you are looking for somewhere clean, well located, and reasonably priced, then stay at Milford Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Old Accomodation in the Heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: dgdinternational
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here with views over the Hudson River and close to Time square. Was being renovated while we were there so a little noisy at times and a lot of scaffolding around the hotel also. The room was small but my wife and I and two children fitted OK.

Reviews.Title: “New York February 2012”
Reviews.Author: momtravelfool
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times before it closed for renovation. I was concerned because the reviews were only so so but thought I would take a chance. The rooms are small but that is expected in NYC. I loved the new bathroom and the dark grey carpet. Did not love the bright orange wall with a restaurant sign. I would have thought a NYC scape would have been more appropriate. Room was clean and had everything I needed. In the past they had a concierge level and that had not been reopened. Computers were available in the lobby but expensive so it was worthwhile to walk down to the Starbucks. I thought security was a bit lax this time compared to other times I had been there. In addition I tried to call the front desk/operator a couple of times with no answer. However I was allowed to check in early when I arrived which was extremely helpful to me. I will stay there again if I travel to NYC,

Reviews.Title: “Glad I stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Brigadoonlass
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews of this hotel before my trip last week to New York and Im glad I stayed there!So many reviews were very negative but I went with ear plugs just in case it was loud . All I can say about that is ..... what else to you expect when you are at the centre of one of the worlds best tourist attraction! The staff were more than friendly especially those at the concierge desk who were so helpful and their recommendations of where to eat were priceless. Rooms were modern ,clean and very comfortable. I will definatley be staying there on my next trip to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Under renovation, small rooms, great price, nice location for the theater”
Reviews.Author: JhonB
Reviews.Content: Great location for the theater district and other attractions. Walking distance for everything we wanted to do during the weekend. We got a great deal for a Friday and Saturday night stay in the city through a travelzoo discount. The rooms were $115 a night plus tax. They website said all the rooms were newly renovated. Our room was on I think the 25th floor. The room was small, but that’s OK. The room had been renovated, but a lot of the detail was not taken.. The doors were old and our safety lock was broken off. They had a safe and a refer as well as a flat screen TV with a lot of channels. The bathroom was small, ok for one person, not for two. There was plenty of hot water and good water pressure. Lots of toiletries and more than enough large soft bath towels. This was a good place to hang our hat for the weekend. There is no free internet, but did not need it this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay/ Bad Stay....”
Reviews.Author: cdtraveljournal
Reviews.Content: Location, check-in were great, however my partner and I open the door to our room and the smell was terrible, it almost smelled like the room was located next to sewage dump..... We did ask for air freshener which we received but it was inevitable that the smell would appear again.... Not all rooms have that problem as my partner and I had stayed there 2 weeks prior.... Spoke with the manager upon departure, and she did apologize for the inconvenience and said she would contact me....

Reviews.Title: “Rude / lazy staff”
Reviews.Author: Sac19700
Reviews.Content: Rooms ok. Rude staff. Concierge was at desk,but about to finish,wouldn't answer simple question,said come tomorrow, our query wouldve taken one minute..we asked to borrow corkscrew for our wine bottle,went to talk to Robert at front desk who greeted me with a lazy "yup" and didn't even look up from computer screen,told me that they don't even have one unless bar open.. Then just ignored me...Rang desk later and another guy said "we havent bought enough corkscrews"...cant even provide simple service,and are so rude about it

Reviews.Title: “Rooms the size of a Shoe Box”
Reviews.Author: 1608dylan1608
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been recently updated, making them very appealing, my only problem is they are tiny! I suppose if you are looking for a hotel in this location, most of the hotel rooms are going to be small, but with 2 double beds in our room, you had no floor space, and no where to put you suitcase etc. Bathroom was modern and very clean, but again Tiny!

Reviews.Title: “over rated!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: Over all not impressed, staff seemed like they wanted to do a good job but Im going to say that place is poorly managed!! The lobby area was just plain dirty. Rooms were okay at best, housekeeping did not do much day to day but again probably short staffed. We were on the 22 floor in a "updated room", eeek. You could tell they cut corners where they should not have and the lack of in room coffee just did it for me. I will not be returning to the Milford and suggest you save your money and upgrade your hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: CathyMtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights (Tues-Fri) in March. Cost averaged out to about $145 a night, which was amazing compared to some of the many other more expensive places we looked at before booking the Milford. We asked for a room with a view and got a newly renovated corner room with King bed on the 11th floor (#1108), even though the booking said it was only supposed to be a Queen. Check-in was quick and the receptionist was very nice. The room was a good size and not small at all, very modern and clean, including the bathroom. It still smelled like it had been freshly renovated. Flat-screen tv, iron, in-room safe, hair dryer, nothing was missing. Bed was very comfortable, lots of pillows and sheets were clean. We had two adjacent windows with excellent views along 8th ave and 44th. I don't think the windows have been replaced so you do hear street noise but with the a/c turned on (it was a warm week) we barely heard the traffic. We spent most of our days out and about so didn't spend much time in the room. If I had to find minor complaints I'd say that house-keeping didn't come around on one day and on our last morning there was some jack-hammering/construction noise somewhere close by. But since we were checking out that morning, we weren't too bothered. Also wireless internet is something like $14/day (which we didn't opt for). The PCs in the lobby take a minimum $5 for access. Valet parking is steep at this hotel. We chose to park at a nearby Icon for $25/day. Location is excellent. This hotel is right in the thick of it all. Step out right onto 8th avenue. Time Square is around the corner. Had a great stay and was very happy with the price paid and the quality of the (renovated) rooms. Will the hotel raise its prices once the renos are complete? If so, get out there now and stay here while the rates are so reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “NOT BAD”
Reviews.Author: Criches
Reviews.Content: The Milford for the price is not bad the rooms are small and even on the 22nd floor the street noise was pretty loud ;However the location is great and within easy walking distance to Times Square and Subways. Stayed March 3rd thru March 6th and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “IDEALLY LOCATED”
Reviews.Author: mariemiami33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place for spending a good weekend in New York City. At the heart of Manhattan, you have easily access to all main attractions of New York from the hotel by foot, taxi or subway. Freshly renovated, the rooms are clean and enough comfortable. If possible, don't hesitate to request a room in a high level to avoid the noise of the street, especially the evening and the night. The only negative point of this hotel is that it doesn't offer a restaurant, even for the breakfast. However, there are a lot of restaurants in the area. The service is good; we have had a good welcome at the check in and the hotel concierge is really helpful for everything you want. At last, the price is very competitive for an hotel in New York and the location of the hotel. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, sleek new rooms, great value”
Reviews.Author: bdalolly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights Mar 19-22 and although the hotel is under renovation I have to say our stay was great. For starters we got a $125 per night rate, were given a newly renovated room on the 17th floor and every hotel employee we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and beds very comfortable. Phone didn't work but maintenance guy appeared within 10 mins after reporting it. Bathrooms are small but efficient. We did ask the concierge desk a few questions and got great advice and we were able to check out and leave our luggage downstairs until our late afternoon flight. The lobby gift shop had all the necessities and Starbucks coffee in the mornings. The only gripe would be that there was no free wireless even in the hotel lobby. Would definitely stay here again as the location is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel. The customer service was very courteous and helpful. The room was very nice. We enjoyed a king size bed on the 14th floor which was a really nice room. The hotel is in the heart of Time Square which was awesome. I had Broadway tickets that night and the hotel was a half a block from Times Square. Overall really great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Doubt”
Reviews.Author: Fran R
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel few years ago, and I'm going to be there in April. I can see the hotel is under renovation. Are all the rooms already renovated ? How can I know if I'm going to be given an old or a renovated room? Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: Boopy_10
Reviews.Content: we are going to New York for my special Birthday and a member of my family have not long came back from this hotel (which we were thinking of booking), however, he said fantastic location right in the heart of NY, clean and basic BUT no coffee facilitie in your room which i find really rare!? i've never stayed at a hotle that DOESNT have tea/coffee makign facilitie in the room for when you first wake up. especially as this was room only and no breakfast..you certainly need a drink when you wake up before shower and going out for breakfast...don't you!? i would suggest to this hotel to definitly change this as it would make it a much better option to book., i won't be staying there for this reason...i do love my coffee in the monring!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A little rough around the edges, but still a great value”
Reviews.Author: NeptunesSon4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milford Plaza (in the process of becoming known as The Milford) on the recently reopened 4th floor on on the 44th Street side of the building from March 21-26, and had a fine stay. Some rather loud construction work was going on during the day times on weekdays in the room next door, but other than that, my stay was quiet. Staff was helpful and friendly. Yes, the rooms are small, but I did not expect to be in my room all that much. My bathroom had a traditional door, and it looked like the door trims were original and just painted over. There was still some odor of new paint and carpet adhesive and one drawer in one of the bedside modules was out of alignment. The only real drawback was a near total absence of electrical outlets; there was just an old one in a corner - nothing near the desk/work area. The LED desk lamp would not turn off; it is either on low or high. The bathroom, though compact, was very clean. As with all of the rooms since the renovation, the furniture is rather euro, basically white laminate modules.. One wall sports a bright graphic (mine was the green 'Open 24 Hours' version). The HVAC system worked just fine and there was always plenty of hot water. The lobby is cramped and dated, but that is also going to be renovated soon. As a have a minor mobility issue, the fact that only one elevator goes to the ground floor was a little inconvenient. As others have noted, the elevator system is a bit unusual, but I never had to wait long. By planning ahead, I got a very reasonable rate. As I was there primarily to see several shows, the location was unbeatable, and the easy subway access gave made it easy for me to get lust about anywhere I wanted to go. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Has Come A Long Way...”
Reviews.Author: weezy75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2011 and was not impressed. The hotel was seriously run down and really there was not much good to say other than the great location. BUT I have just returned from New York with my daughter and I choose the Milford Plaza again hoping that it really had been renovated since my previous stay. It had. Complete turn around. I loved our room, new carpet,bed,sheets, paint, everything was fresh and new. The staff seemed happier, they are probably finally proud of where they work. We had a few minor issues that were resolved (hopefully the phone is fixed in #1952) promptly. I never heard any renovations going on at any time and we were there for 8 nights. Yes street noise can be heard on the 19th floor but it is New York City, I think every hotel has the same issue. Turn on a fan, drowns out a lot! From the looks of things and from talking to the staff, it is only going to get better.... I would highly recommend the Milford Plaza to anyone travelling to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / value for money”
Reviews.Author: foodforfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and found it great value for its location. the room might be a little small for two people for a week but this is quickly forgotten about by sitting on the side of the bed and looking down across time square. Staff were friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: PC65
Reviews.Content: the refurbished rooms are nice and modern. the 2 double beds room is quite small and 3/4 people struggle moving around. the maids' service has been poor (forgetting to take the rubbish once or replacing towels). The hall is still the old one (very tired), and it is not clear how long it is going to take to see the new look. We found appalling the fact that this big hotel cannot offer any service (breakfast, drinks etc) and did not even manage to provide glasses (apart from plastic). With a $150 a night rate in March, I think they could do better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla594
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel, which urgently needs reform. However, its location is one of the best for those who will walk around New York. So I think that staying in Milford was a very good option!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Conor O
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is quite good. I had previously stayed in some pretty shady hotels around Times Square for a similar price that were nowhere near as nice as Milford Plaza. I'll admit I was somewhat apprehensive after reading reviews from other guests as my stay approached but on arrival it was not as bad as others have made it out to be. The lobby was a bit hectic and when we checked in we were accidentally given a room that another guest had not yet checked out of. The other guests luckily were not in their room and there was no issue however this could have been very awkward depending on what we walked into... Also, as the other guests luggage was layed out on the bed we could easily have walked away with all of their stuff. In the end no harm done though, we got a new room and a couple of complimentary drinks at the bar. The rooms are equipped with safes so in light of this incident we made full use of this feature and latched our door when in the room. The rooms are also a bit on the small side, but for NYC that's standard fair in my experience. For the price and location I would stay here again, better the devil you know than the devil you don't as they say. Also, the staff were very helpful for dinner recommendations and pointed us to a rooftop bar-restaurant called '230 Fifth' a short cab-ride away. That was by far the highlight of our stay in NYC for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kenjaCornwall
Reviews.Content: Milford Plaza is a great place and location for your stay in New York, its close to all major attractions and I must say the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in (apart from my own) I have just return from a trip to NY and stayed at Milford. Awsome experience and a comfortable nights sleep to be for exploring the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: IRLKK
Reviews.Content: Me and a buddy stayed here from March 15th to March 20th for the Paddy's Week celebrations. I'll be honest, the last time I stayed here was 2007 and while it was clean, and basic, it really needed some refurbishment. It was closed down I think in 08 or 09, and the whole room thing is really far, far much better. When you walk in the foyer is the same as it ever was, it's old and needs doing up. However....the sign says that 2012 is when this will happen. Don't be put off. Give it a chance. When you get upstairs it's actually quite a fresh hotel now. Beds, rooms, linen, etc etc. I had a problem about setting the code for the safe deposit box, no fault of the hotel, the last guest locked it while it was open......we rang reception, who rang security, who had a guy in our room in under 10 minutes. You can't ask for better than that...... So, my verdict? I like it, I'd stay there again. Location? Perfect. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, still bit shoddy.”
Reviews.Author: traveljan60
Reviews.Content: Milford plaza is located in a great position just behind Times Square. It's about a 3-5 minute walk before your in the main area of Times Sq. The hotel is undergoing refurbishment and has been since 4 years ago when I was last there. Sadly the refurbishments are taking forever and to be honest they're not that great. Our room looked fresh when we walked in but then realised the paintwork was messy,wallpaper poorly matched, curtain blind broke on retraction and other issues. There was also at lot of street noise when trying to sleep at night even though we were on the 19th floor it was still noisy. Don't know if other nearby hotels would also experience this though. However, I would still return to this hotel purely for the location. It's pretty much central to most things. Walking is a must in NYC if you want to see everything. Having a centrally located hotel is paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected”
Reviews.Author: RichInCuba
Reviews.Content: Went down with a group to the Milford Plaza March 10th-12th 2012 I let the group leader make the reservation. This was my first stay at this location and I must say I was highly impressed with the rooms. Which was once known as a flea bag hotel is now boutique style. Still under reno's, very clean carpeted floor,nice bed and although small,a very efficient bathroom & deep tub for soaking after a long day of walking and shopping Can't think of a complaint about this place or it's location. Close to Times Square's hustle and bustle.Loads of restaurants and bars,maybe too much activity.You can hear the vibration of the city from your room Great hotel for value in one of the best city's...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: Chiara R
Reviews.Content: Overall I found this hotel extremely great value, comfortable and great location. The bedroom was comfortable, clean and warm and the bathroom was clean. There is still renovations going on in the hotel and the noise of them working away woke us up a couple of times too early in the morning. The one thing that really put me off was a particular staff member on the day we checked out. She was unbelievable obnoxious and rude. I had a problem with paying with my debit card and although perhaps I should have checked whether they accepted it before we checked out I had thought that there wouldn't be an issue. I thought americans prided themselves in good customer service but I was incredibly let down by her attitude with me over the fact that they couldn't accept my card. She repeated several times in a rude loud voice " We don't accept that card". Then told me that I would have to get money out down the street and again kept repeating the same thing. She made me so angry I told her "ok ok" and walked away from the desk, she then turned around to my friend and said "you know if she doesn't come back we will be charging to your credit card" in a rude manner. She was bang out of order and she would not have not been to able to authorise that. She ruined my morning with her attitute. I of course I am an honest person and had she been nicer to me I would have apologised profusely for the inconvience. There was also a queue of people behind us which would have heard her talking to me in that manner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3-star room and price”
Reviews.Author: frankiemagic
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in March 2012 We had a newly renovated room on the 28th floor. The room was compact - queen size bed, flat screen on the wall and small bathroom but it was brand new - it was spotless. And cleaned every day. We paid roughly $110 a night and it was a steal. If you want glitz and glamour then no, it's not for you. But for $110 a night, it was clean, comfortable and perfect. Yes the hotel is a bit of a building site but our room and hallway was spotless. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but prime location.”
Reviews.Author: mh2parker
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with the new renovation special, about $110+ so it was a good deal for an excellent location. But if I have to pay $200 or something, I would recommend checking out Yotel or the Pod Hotel. Those are more fun. Milford Plaza reminds me of an old nyc apt building. I lived in nyc for 4 years so I recognize the old closet door frame, the old noisy hotels ac unit and outdated ceiling light. My room also had the worst view. You can almost reach out to the neighboring building. The bedding is new. The bathroom was renovated. But the carpet was visibly dirty and curiously, there is an ice bucket but no plastic bag lining nor plastic cups. All in all, I walked away with an average impression. I can't imagine staying here before the renovation. On the other hand, the location is undeniably prime. Subway station is one-block away. The world famous neon lights of 42nd St is only a couple blocks. You can certainly stay out all night and get back to your room easily.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but still needs work.”
Reviews.Author: moddycurl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Milford Plaza Hotel for a mid-week get away. The price was great. They are offering specials while the hotel undergoes renovations. The location is great for Broadway shows and Manhattan attractions. Rooms are small with few amenities. Bathroom tiny. Lobby has yet to be renovated. The biggest downside was that our room was not properly cleaned when we arrived. Debris on the carpet, sink and tub not properly clean and towels missing from bathroom. At 8 am construction started taking place on scaffolding outside our window.

Reviews.Title: “A Short walk to times square in exchange for a trendy room at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Roma90210
Reviews.Content: Catching the subway just outside helps u make the most of your stay. Fresh, renovated room and now the hotel lobby is in the process of being renovated. Elevators take you straight to your floor, plenty of restaurants/cafes and a few bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, no view, miniscule bathroom, paper thin door, but cheap!”
Reviews.Author: crimedoc
Reviews.Content: Close to Penn Station and Times Square, this hotel is undergoing renovations. I stayed in a renovated room with sleek white furniture, chrome lamps, a nice flat screen on the wall, and crisp white linens. The view was a brick wall. The room was so tiny (which renovations couldnt fix), there was no room for traditional doors. The closet was covered by a curtain and the bathroom door was a sliding cover. The bathroom was clean but I literally could put my left leg wholly in the tub, sit on the toilet, and dunk my right arm in the sink while sticking my right leg out the doorway! With tons of restaurants and bars and the theater district just steps away, the location (and the super cheap rate I got on kayak) made the small room very worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Sandra700
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at Milford Plaza a couple of times and we mainly stayed there because of the location, after all it is located in the heart of Manhattan. Now the hotel is going through renovations. Unfortunately, we stayed on the 27th floor and everything in the halfway to the room was unfinished. In the room, we had a nice surprise with the renewal: nice décor, flat screen TV, modern furniture and finely a hotel with good lighting (my eyes were pleased), but the downside was that everything was dusty and the bathroom sink was clogged, but we complained to the front desk about it and they solved it immediately. It’s good to bear in mind that the room is very small. If you came to NYC to go shopping, you probably (like me) could barely walk into the room. At this time, we had bought some products by the internet to deliver at the hotel and we were surprised with how organized and efficient the staff is. They held our products and delivered them to us perfectly. (Thanks Mrs. Reina for always being supportive).

Reviews.Title: “Maid rifled through our belongings and took the gift, returning it later”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary M
Reviews.Content: Thep hotel was suspect -- We had a late departure, 1pm, my husband had a do not disturb sign on the door. We arrived back at 12:20pm to pick up our bag, the door was open, the bag was gone. I had a plastic bag containing my clothes and they were gone, the bag empty, the gift bag from the hotel empty. The maid said she took the bag and put it in the hall closet for safe keeping. I asked her where my things were, she said" on the bed with the teeshirt gift. She brought our bag back into the room, then came back with the keychain. I later found some of my clothes in that bag and the coffee mug gift in the very bottom. WOW--we have never encountered anything like this anywhere before. I spoke to the manager and he said she probably didn't know we were checking out???? Our toiletries were in the bathroom. Who is minding the store. I called the Hotel twice and asked to speak to the manager or owners, or their phone numbers. I was transferred to the bell hop. When asked for a survey I said the same and have never heard a word back. Go somewhere safe.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: drsheri
Reviews.Content: For the price, still not worth it. I didn't get that great a deal. The positive: Near Times Square. Period. That's it! Negatives: No fitness center and no indication that it was under renovation on their website or any other website. (I now see reviews reflecting this). They were unable to tell me where the gym is that we can use instead, except that we could ask the desk at the other hotel. No customer service, no smiles, not friendly staff AT all! The room is small, but it's NYC, so that was expected. My room was hot without the heat being on (75+). The shower leaked onto the floor and nearly flooded into the room (I had to be careful how I stood in the shower- ridiculous! My friends' room was over 87 degrees and though they claimed to fix it they didn't. I was with her when she complained for the second time. They said they had no record of her complaint from the first time despite her getting a call saying it was fixed (it wasn't). I would not EVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged & Room Was unbearably Hot”
Reviews.Author: Tri-State B
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing trip to NYC. The Milford was a Prime location close to everything with a resaonable rate. However its only the beginning of march and the room was unbearably hot. The air conditioning did not work and we had to leave the window open at night to breathe. We are also now being charged for a car that we never had, We arrived in NYC via a Bus. But the Milford Refuses to take the car off of our bill. So now we have to go thru the hassle of contacting our bank and the bus company that we rode in with for proof that we didnt bring a car. will be returning to the city, in a few weeks but will not be staying at the milford for just this reason. check your credit cards because this charge Showed up a WEEK after we departed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for taking in a Broadway Show”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMissy
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to NYC for her birthday to take in a show and to visit museums. It was the perfect place to stay for our little trip. We parked the car at a nearby garage and either took the subway or walked to our destinations. Since we were out and about all day, we didn't need a more luxurious hotel to stay at. The Milford, while undergoing renovations, is clean, and the staff was pleasant. We checked in too early for a room to be available, however we were able to secure our luggage with them so that we can go around the city hands free. We did the same when we checked out early. Make sure to keep dollar bills handy for tipping. Also, keep in mind that if you are sensitive to noise during bedtime, bringing earplugs is a must. There is also a set of two window shades, one for the daytime and a room darkening shade (behind the daytime shade) for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: CatIsInTheHouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights a few days ago. The lady at the front desk when we first checked in was a real charm!! A plus: check-in age: 18 years old, which was perfect, for us who are 20. Our room was quite small for 4, but very comfortable, clean and secure, which were my main concerns... And I would definitely go back. But there were a few communication problems which lead to major discontent. (Asking for a fridge, which they told us was available, several times, no room service one day= no towels that evening, asked for them several times and took hours to come and we were charged for a phone call which we did not make. Too pricey for that many mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Glorn26
Reviews.Content: We picked the Milford Plaza due to the price and location.I did not know anything about the hotel due to the fact that we had prviously stayed in a bed and breakfast and I had to leave cause it was so not the place to stay.After my bad experience with the bed and breakfast place I was praying that this hotel was going to be ok.I am more than happy to say that it was prefect.Check in was smooth staff was nice.Michelle greeting in the lobby was very nice and willing to help in any way.The room (23fl) was clean awesom bed.Yes its small but that's NYC for you.Did not encounter any rude staff everybody was nice and friendly.Great location close to everything!!!Would stay here again . gloria

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Otoh
Reviews.Content: Room: compact; modern and slick; ample lighting; sufficient storage; desk and chair; comfy bed; very large flat-screen tv; deep bath tub. Elevator system: never waited longer than 15 seconds. Cons: Overall ambience was a negative. At no point was staff friendly and welcoming. Check-in was cold and business-like. Dowdy lobby. Room had no bath towels, no hotel directory. Room was hot. Shower was one degree from being cold. I called with regard to the ice machine location, and I was sent on a wild goose chase on another floor. Unless, I got an incredible deal, I would not stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Security”
Reviews.Author: sailtheworld1
Reviews.Content: I advised the front desk I had two packages,they called the lower level of the hotel I would be stopping by for the packages, when I arrived the man at the security desk had an attitude and utilized a hand gesture to tell me to calm down-I was perfectly calm until I was confronted by his body language, when he brought me the package he asked for a tip. How rude. I immediately went to talk to the front desk manager and he did not give a dam.. I am a Sales Manager for a very well know property in Philadelphia and I am appauled by both employees behavior.Simply awful.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy service”
Reviews.Author: Sif S
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a few nights after I finished competing in a fitness and figure competition and this was suppose to be my holiday after all the hard work. I come all the way from Iceland and had been traveling a lot. When we came there to check in the girl at the front desk seemed to be very frustrated and tired an was not helpful at all and gave us keys to our rooms that did not work. The luggage that we had to leave in the lobby so that the bellman could bring it up to our rooms never came so we had to go downstairs again to go get it ourselves. The room was so hot and there did not seem to be air-conditioning in the room like on the hotel-description so we called the lobby and after an hour they sent a repair-man up to the room to fix the temperature. There were workers right outside the window ( and our room was on the 21 floor ) so we could not even open the window !! The room was very very small and no closet-space for all the luggage. Had to keep all our stuff on the floor and could hardly walk in the room because of so litle space. The hallway was painted black and was very dark, narrow and creepy. We are all fitness competitors and personal trainers so it is crucial for us to have a GYM where ever we go so we chose this hotel specifically because the gym seemed to be good ( from the pictures ) but then they told us that the gym was CLOSED and that we would have to go to another hotel a few blocks from there to go to the gym...ARRRGGGG.....by the way because firstly they gave us the wrong directons and secondly the wrong hotel name we never found this gym that we were suppose to use instead and it was freezing outside. So the whole vacation went by without getting a workout done and that really really pissed me off. They should have at least posted it on the website that the gym would be closed. Then we would NEVER have chosen this hotel. When we were leaving we had to keep our luggage at the hotel after checkout for a few hours because our flight was not until late that night and he man at the desk that took it for us was very rude to us and obviously tired of all the turists ( but hello you work at a hotel so get a grip man ) he was very annoyed with me when I asked him to take very good care of one of our bags because it had a huge, very expensive TV camera in it and a laptop. I asked him if he could see to that the bag would not get stuffed under some other bags and he just kept hissing at me that there was no space there so he could not make that promise to me. I know that the hotel is going through renevations but there is a long way to go and the staff was very unhelpful and did not even want to listen to what we were saying (but we speak good english so that was not the propblem ) they just didnt want to listen and did not do anything to make our stay feel welcoming. Its not our first trip to NYC but we will NOT be staying there again even though the prize is good I would have wanted to pay more just to get what was promised and a better hotel...like a WORKING AND OPEN GYM!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Garysnum1girl
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much for $150 this close to Times Square, but I was pleasantly surprised. We were met at the door, greeted warmly at the front desk, alas only to find out our room was not ready even though it was 4:30pm. Apologies, followed by drink vouchers for bar (small but nice), walk around Times Square (3 blocks away), then a phone call letting us know our room was ready about an hour later. It was small but nice, plain decor, flat screen TV, VERY comfortable beds with feather pillows. Check out was noon, which gave us time to do some morning things without backpacks, then express checkout was super easy. I would definitely stay there again. Oh, and I LOVED the express elevators -- great idea!

Reviews.Title: “Small, small, smallest”
Reviews.Author: 1TheSmith1
Reviews.Content: Allegedly renovated hotel. Great location for theater goers and times square. However, the room is very,very small. Our room had two double beds. We requested a rollaway and were told they did not have rollaways anymore....now we know why. There isn't enough room anywhere for a the smallest of rollaways. New window treatments are quite functional with an extra room darkening shade. Keeps out the morning sun nicely. Bathroom is Small! Has a sliding door....since there isn't enough room for a regular door. It was well-cleaned....did I mention it was small? So if you are in need of a small spot to put your stuff while you spend every waking minute out in the city, this is okay - if they give you a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: catherine059
Reviews.Content: I can only speak from our experience and found this hotel wonderful. Yes there are renovations going on, but as another reviewer said, we knew this before we arrived. Our room on the 17th floor was absolutely spotless and smelt lovely and clean. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels everyday. Safe and hair dryer in the room. Our bathroom was fine and we had a bath tub as well as a shower. We didn't wait too long for the lifts and bearing in mind the deal that we got with Travelzoo, overall we were delighted and would recommend this hotel to anyone. We never heard other guests through the walls and certainly never heard or saw any drunks. Location is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on a pig”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: I reserved a “renovated” room at the Milford and requested a quiet room with my online reservation. Check-in time isn’t till 4:00pm so I had to wait about forty minutes. When checking-in, I again requested a quiet room, and told them I didn’t care about anything else. I looked out the window and saw a ledge (24th floor) full of scaffolding, rigging, and equipment. I went back downstairs. The Manager on Duty told me they weren’t working on that side of the building, but couldn’t promise I wouldn’t hear “anything.” I again reiterated I was going to be working all night the next night, and I just wanted to be able to sleep late. There was no work going when I checked-in. At 08:30am the next morning, the electric chisel started only to be briefly interrupted by the occasional hammering and planks dropping on the ledge. The electric tool was so loud and close it made the floor vibrate. I stayed as long as I could with earplugs and pillows over my head praying it would stop, but it never did. So not only did I not get a quiet room, I probably got one of the noisiest one in the hotel. The “renovated” room is more like “redone on the cheap.” New furnishings, but same old beat up door, heating units with unknown layers of paint, wires and pipes running across the ceiling, etc. The air conditioner was new but didn’t work at all. Same old run-down Milford Plaza from the ‘90s really. Uncaring staff with mildly redone rooms–kind of like lipstick on a pig. New ownership? I don’t see it. Three different people ignored my request just for a quiet room, or they don’t know where the construction is in their own hotel. Either is unacceptable. I cherish the few times a year I get to stay in NYC. My plan was to sleep late, check-out, view the city all afternoon, and go to work. Due to the lack of sleep, I had to check-out, and go to the office to find a chair to sleep in for the afternoon before I had to work that night. Basically, the Milford ruined my brief stay in NYC. I did talk to a different manager on the way out. He was very nice and sympathetic, and offered to let me stay for a late check-out. Listening to more jack-hammering really doesn’t help me much. I explained I really had to get some sleep before tonight, and I that I just had to go.

Reviews.Title: “Milford Plaza - NYC”
Reviews.Author: Joralex
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza is an old New York Hotel that has had every room renovated recently. Although the rooms are small, they are very clean. Our bed was comfortable and the pillows were amazing. We had a safe in our room and an iron and ironing board. The bathroom had soap, shampoo and cream rinse... nothing fancy, and no blow dryer. We had one small issue upon arrival that the staff tended to immediately. I found this hotel very good value for the cost and, truthfully, we left our room at 8:00am and came back to sleep at 10:30pm. We did not need a big room.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Wanda R
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews posted, I felt compelled to give an account of my experience. Yes, the hotel is undergoing a massive rennovation--it was built in 1928 for goodness sake! I knew this ahead of time and expected some glitches. My 20 year old daughter and I stayed in a rennovated king on the 17th floor for $115/night TravelZOO promo for four nights! The room was a nice size, clean, bed and pillows comfy. Okay so the bathroom is small, but it has the essentials! Our room had no tub, but a large shower which definitely is poorly designed as the tile was not built up high enough and the shower curtain too short so water splashed everywhere--hopefully the staff will address this issue to avoid future water damage. Most importantly, the water was hot. A couple of times we heard some knocking from the rennovation, but once again I was prepared for this. We also had a very hot room, but guess what? We turned off the unit when it was obvious the thermostat wasn't working properly. I called and the maintenance guy named Fausto came right away to try to remedy the problem, but he agreed the thermostat wasn't working properly. The AC actually worked for us...for a while--LOL! Unlike some reviewers, I NEVER heard other guests in my location. Moreover, we had a safe in our room; therefore, we locked up "valuables." Who would go to NYC or any hotel and not do that? If a safe wasn't in the room, I would have asked for one at the desk, etc. Furthermore, if I saw bugs, I would have asked for another room or left immediately, wouldn't you?....The lobby--"run down"??? NO, what I saw was all new---but I did not look behind the black curtain to see what was being rennovated or to see if "the wizard" was standing there conjuring up "Wicked" experiences for unsuspecting guests....As far as the staff, I personally talked to at least ten employees and they were all very helpful from the bellhops to the front desk folks to the people who serviced the rooms. I NEVER had a problem with the elevator. If you like a more European style hotel with a historic past, enjoy being around international guests, and can tolerate a few inconveniences due to the rennovations, the Milford Plaza is a great deal. If you want to spend three times the $$$ for more "luxury" go somewhere else. There is no way their employees can be more helpful or accommodating than what I experienced at Milford Plaza. Furthermore, the location is terrific! We walked to Macy's, K Mart--yes, K Mart near Macy's--check it out for snacks, etc.),the Hudson River/Intrepid Museum (have lunch at Ollie's Noodles on 42nd and 9th on the way there), Rockefeller Center,Lincoln Center, and from the Guggenheim all the way down 5th Ave back to the hotel via Central Park. Try John's Pizza and cheescake at Junior's, both around the corner. Had burgers and shakes from the Shake Shack across the street--much more reasonable than Junior's. Also if you like historic buildings, check out the famous NYC Public Library next to Bryant Park--free tours. We had a mini fridge and bought a few things at Food Emporium a couple of blocks up 8th toward Columbus Circle--they have terrific salads, sandwiches, pastries, and hot bar. For discounted theater tickets, don't stand in line at TKTS booth, check out Playbill.com, get promo codes and buy tickets at the theaters (check out section on student and general RUSH tickets). If you stay at Milford Plaza, you will have extra $$$ like us and can pay to see a non-discounted play like Lion King--it was the best Broadway, London, or Vegas play I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, centrally located, helpful folks, clean, bright”
Reviews.Author: Leathab
Reviews.Content: This was the most restful, easiest to find, closest to all the theaters...hotel. It was clean, tidy, plenty of hot water, and very helpful with gaining tickets to all events (even a reservation at Sardis)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience Until the End...”
Reviews.Author: LaurieBR
Reviews.Content: I received a Travelzoo promotion for a ridiculous deal at the Milford Plaza. Who can pass up $95/night, guaranteed renovated room? I know the city very well and being next to Times Square, next to every train and restaurant possible, is huge. The hotel looks very bad from the exterior with scaffolding everywhere. The lobby was fine; it looks like the hotel bar had been displaced with the renovations. We received an upgrade to a king renovated room, which was brand spanking new, clean bathroom, nice linens. It was difficult to regulate the temperature, as in many hotel rooms, but it's tolerable. At peak points of the day, 10/10:30 a.m., it took forever for an elevator to come, which was annoying. All in all, a pleasant experience until I'm packing to leave and find that my train tickets are missing. I knew exactly where they were when I walked into the hotel and three days later, disappeared. I followed up with the hotel afterwards and was told that no one accessed the room without authorization, and housekeeping "never saw them," and there was "nothing they could do" to reimburse me for the duplicate tickets I had to pay for. A good weekend, marred by a crappy ending.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad place”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer666
Reviews.Content: The Milford is not a very good hotel, and things were even worse the nights I stayed there recently. First of all, start with the decor. Very garish. The rooms are small, but that's OK; to be expected of an older NYC hotel. But the lobby is really rundown looking, the bar is tiny, and the hotel is understaffed. Expect to have to wait for everything. Also, there's no restaurant or coffee maker in the room, so you have to run out to Starbucks every morning just to get a cup of coffee. Gym was out of service. The told me to use the gym at a sister hotel down the block, but what are you supposed to do? Run down the streets of NYC in the middle of winter with your gym clothes on? And they didn't even offer to comp me something for this. I would not recommend this place. There are a lot of nicer hotels in the area, including the Intercontinental and the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: lal66
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many NYC hotel most which were more expensive ,yes the rooms were larger and the lobby more elegant but you don't stay in the lobby nor the room very long. This was a newly renovated room which was very clean, bed very comfortable & very clean bathroom.The only downfall was you had to pay for wifi and we couldn't controll the heat in the room (a little too hot). I would stay here again we only paid$98 for a night best value I have ever paid!

Reviews.Title: “Room has not been done!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IbizaSpecialist
Reviews.Content: Hi, I am staying at this moment at the hotel. Today is 03/03/2012. After a long walking day and enjoing NYC we went back to the hotel and found that the room has not benn done, and no clean towels. Went to front desk and asked why? They said they were short of staff and they could discount 20U$S. An Insult to us. After talking to the Manager I got 50% off the night but still not happy and I didnt want to argue anymore because I was really tired. If someone has the same problem, push to get the full refund. Oshi was called the manager, he started offering 30 dollars then 40U$S it was bargaining in Moroco. Also connceted rooms are realy noisy. If They give you one, ask innediately for a cahnge, becuase you will listen everything your neighbour does or whispers. Hope this info helps for next clients

Reviews.Title: “Much better than last time”
Reviews.Author: robynzechel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a year ago in an old room and had the worst experience. They have improved alot. The rooms are VERY modern now. It was much better and more enjoyable this time. Much cleaner and nice tvs finally! Was a bit loud

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise at the Milford”
Reviews.Author: Glendyrr
Reviews.Content: I was really surprized at the good value for money I received at the Milford Plaza, my room were comfy and clean and overlooked the city ,and the staff were friendly and attentive,especially the Conceirge service.The hotel is under construction at the time,but not at the cost of the tourist,I will gladly recommend the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, horrible follow up”
Reviews.Author: JumiMclu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milford Plaza for four nights in late January. While the hotel is in a decent location and the stay itself was not unplesant I have one warning... don't leave anything behind. I accidently left a framed picture in the lobby when we checked out. I confirmed from the airport before we boarded our flight home that they had located the item and placed it in a secure location. I attempted to make arrangements to have it returned to me at that time and was told by the front desk agent that she couldn't do anything and I would have to talk to the director of security Jerome. I made several attempts to contact him after arriving home including messages requesting that he return my call, however I have yet to recieve a response. I have attempted to escelate this issue to the front office manager with the same result, message left explaining the situation and requesting a call back and no response. While I wish I could rate this hotel higher or reccommend this to fellow travelers, the lack of concern over guest satisfaction or follow up has ruined those prospects for me.

Reviews.Title: “Our quick trip to new York!”
Reviews.Author: TheRobeys
Reviews.Content: We took a last minute trip to New York and decided to stay at the Milford Plaza as the price was great. On arrival we went through the lobby which was tired and worn, upon check in we were allocated a renovate room on the 19th floor. Staff were ok, not overally friendly but weren't rude by any means.The room was clean and basic, which is all you really need when in New York. note the rooms do not have safes! The concierge desk were really helpful and provided maps and informations on shows. The location of this hotel was fantastic and literally just around the corner from times square, walk out the doors turn left and left at the corner walk up the block and you are bang in e middle of times square which was amazing! I don't have anything bad to say about this hotel but if you are going be sure to go with the expectation that this is a 3* hotel and is basic with not many facilities or services. Fantastic trip did lots of sight seeing! Amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great stay when it comes to location. It is close enough to Times Square and many of the theatres (if that's what you fancy). It isn't quite as busy as central Times Square, but the hustle and bustle is still there. Just across the street is Shake Shack (www.shakeshack.com). They serve up some good burgers/shakes and is totally worthy of the line that forms throughout the day. Literally just around the corner is the Majestic Theatre where Phantom of the Opera plays. It is also a short walk from Port Authority Bus Terminal!! So very handy We stayed in one of the renovated 2x double bed rooms (the floor was actually just opened a couple hours prior to check in..lucky us!). It served its purpose as we just needed a place to lay our heads after long days of walking around. A down side to this hotel is that the walls seemed thin and renovations will continue into the summer. Occasionally you may here hammering of nails, drills and saws going, but we were all deep sleepers so not quite an issue. Overall I would stay here again if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: C-Stop
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC often and this may very well be the smallest room I have stayed in here. There is street noise from 8th Avenue. Though the rooms have been recently remodeled, it's one of the cheapest quality remodel jobs I have seen in a hotel (e.g. not all of the room was remodeled). No towel/sheet reuse program (they even replaced the soap I used just once) - not green. No channel sheet (I only need to watch CNBC - don't make me flip through all the channels to find it), no note paper/pens. The upside is location (close to Times Square/theatre district) and the hotel is across the street from the 42nd Ave A-C-E subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location If U Like Busy!”
Reviews.Author: TurboKickChick
Reviews.Content: Im not a tourist to NY, as I have been there more than 5 times. I stayed @ Milford b/c their rates were so cheap this Feb 2012 @ $307 for 3 nights including tax, which is unheard of in NY for a decent hotel! The hotel is constantly busy during the day with tons of tourists from all over the world. I didn't care for the busyness because it too almost 10 mins to go up & down the elevator, which is ridiculous! Their elevators are situated very strange. There is one electronic box that you type your floor number into & the elevator deccides what elevator will take u. I stayed on highest floor - 27th, so the elevator could stop on as many as 5 floors. It was so annoying & frankly took too much time! And elevator was so small with many people squeezingin & I felt clasterphobic. I was very irritated. Simply, there was just too many people in this hotel always coming& going and checking in and out.. Lines for check in, to drop bag, was just too long. Funny though late at night (11pm or later) the hotel is quiet. Drawback, their 1 hotel ar closes at 11pm - what???? Besides these quirks, the Milford's rooms are newly remodeled so the room is small (but most rooms in NY are small) but nice, modern& great big flat screen TV. Room is clean, and. great for the value. I would never pay more than $100-$125 a night for this hotel though. No anemenities (this could be because of the remodel). They have no restaurant (they send you to neary restaurant Daniela's to redeem your free continental breakfast), which I think is lame. Who wants to walk off location to eat breakfast? Its a hotel with 600+ rooms. They should be able to cater in a continental breakfast. Milford is perfect if you are not a hotel snob & are not looking for special treatment, and if you like to stay with tons of tourists and wait in lines to take elevator to room, check in & store or pick up your bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Mary K
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend in NY at the Milford Plaza. The hotel is getting a face lift but it did not create any problems for us. The room is small like most in NY but all the furniture was new as well as all the fixtures in the bathroom. Aside from a bit of dirt on the carpet and on the tile wall beside the toilet, the room was very well kept.. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We were very happy at $85 + tax (found on their website, less expensive than other travel websites) and thought it was a great value. Very close to subways and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot - great price”
Reviews.Author: Smaryj
Reviews.Content: Travelled here in Jan 2012 for my birthday and first trip to NYC. Managed to book a special via Travel Zoo and got a twin for the incredible rate of $90 per night for a renovated room. The room didn't disappoint at all! Sure it was small but it was clean, warm, the bathroom renovated too and modern. We managed to zip easily all over New York from this location. The foyer is grand and dated but hey, it's an old hotel. The concierge was amazing, giving great advice and printing off maps for us to show us where to go when we wanted to get out to the Museum of the Moving Image. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a budget hotel, but great location”
Reviews.Author: crystal531
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza Hotel is definitely a budget hotel. That being said the accommodations are basically what one would expect. When I booked my room I was to have a queen bed and a larger room, however upon arrival I was asked to switch to a smaller room with two twin beds. Since, I was going solo on this trip it was no big deal to me, but it may be an aggravation to some. The front desk staff was fairly friendly. The room was neat except for the bathroom. The bathroom had what appeared to be dried urine on the toilet seat and the area in front of the toilet was shall we say "splotchy" as well. I called the front desk and someone was sent up to clean the bathroom within about 15-20 minutes. I'm not sure how something like this could be over looked, but the person that came up did a thorough job cleaning the toilet, shower/ tub and sink. The walls in the room must not be insulated very well as I often heard doors slamming and people talking in the hall. One disappointing thing is that there is a $14.95 per day fee to connect to the internet. It's pretty pricey and I guess where I've been accustomed to having free access to wifi basically everywhere I've stayed it was a little annoying. The best thing about this hotel is the location! There are a ton of restaurants near the hotel and it is only about a five minute walk to Times Square and many of the theaters! There is valet parking at the hotel, but as it is now with the construction taking place it's a bit difficult to see the entrance to the hotel as you're driving in. If you park right on 8th Avenue between 44th and 45th you'll be in the right spot. I only mention this because I missed it and ended up driving through Times Square, which was a pain! I would probably stay here again because of the location and the price. Compared to the other hotels in the area it is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for price”
Reviews.Author: pianoflynn
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on-line last minute & got it for $79+ tax, so did our friend who's stayed here numerous times & recommended it. However, it is in the middle of renovations inside & out. We had no hot water on 12th floor 1st night or next morning. It was lukewarm at best. The constant hammering in the morning was unbearable. Our friend was on the 28th floor & didn't have a problem. He also had hot water. We were switched to the 28th floor after going to desk & complaining. I tried calling front desk/concierge & leaving msg. twice, but no one called back. After switching to new room, we did not have any problems, & we had a corner room with great view of Hudson river on one side, & the entire city on other. The rooms are typical size for NYC, perhaps a tad bigger than some. Seems all rooms have been up-graded with new beds, linens, big flat-screens, new sinks, tubs & showers. We really liked the bathrm mirrors lighted from behind! They're called "magic mirrors". One thing missing which is usually on the desk in any room; a pen & pad of paper! I was on-line booking something & needed to write a # down, & could find no pen or paper, so I saved it to cell phone... I am sure we'll return when the construction is finished, if we can afford it then. I have the feeling this will be a much desired hotel afterwards. We literally got the last room on-line. They also gave us a gift bag w/souveniers & a discount card for numerous places for our troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: patkatmom
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for the room which included breakfast at Daniela's down the street. We arrived at 10 am and checked our bags. Was told our room would be ready that afternoon. We were hungry and went to Daniela's for breakfast (didn't know that's where our free breakfast was going to be at that time). My daughter and I were having breakfast when the front desk clerk came in to eat. She told the staff at the restaurant that we were staying with them and they gave us a 10% discount on our bill!! What a lovely gesture, I wish I saw her again to thank her! We finally got back to our room around 7pm and checked into our renovated queen size room. The hallway leading up to our room was clean and you could tell it had just been renovated - still had that new carpet smell. Room was small but very clean. Not too many outlets to charge phones, computer etc. Got a great night sleep with the black out curtains keeping the light out. Bed was comfy and water was hot! At checkout I reported the 2 things we noticed. Sink drain was very slow and the we weren't able to see out the peephole (someone had knocked on our door and I couldn't see who it was). Would definitely stay here again and look forward to seeing the lobby once the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: postie_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an unbeatable location, one block from Times Square and just a few minutes walk to Port Authority bus terminal. While our room was quite small, it was clean and great value for being so central. It has a nice lobby area, and friendly helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Vday In NY”
Reviews.Author: MilaBS
Reviews.Content: From the reviews I thought it was gonna be bad...but it was good....loved it! I got the new renovated queen room...decent size. Even though the bathroom was small but that didn't bother me. Everyone at the hotel was nice. Had amazing views from the 19th floor! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_R-NJ
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Got a great deal with a groupon. The location is perfect - right in the heart of the theater district. Was a healthy walk to the Met. Just a few blocks from MOMA. The staff was very pleasant. I didn't need anything special so I can't comment further. The room was recently renovated. Was in great condition. Room is on the small side but it is NY & (hopefully) you're not there to sit in a room. There were a couple odd things about the room. The tv is hung in a weird spot. The only way to watch it is diagonally across the bed. Don't know how you do it with 2 people in a room. There's nothing on the walls, which is fine. However, they painted the word "Restaurant" across it with the letters "Rest" in one color & "aurant" is a faded out color. Guess they are highlighting that you get "Rest" there. I didn't like the subliminal suggestion behind "Restaurant". The bathroom is long but cramped where the utilities are. Luckily I am small. I wonder how an older or large person would fare in there. The toilet is really close to the shower. The shower is tiny but not enclosed. The room seemed clean. I like the bedding they use. There are sheets on both sides of the blanket. It eliminates the yuckiness of a comforter. The view was fabulous. I could see the water in the distance. The room had a safe. It also had room darkening shades that worked perfectly. The room was fairly quiet considering the NY traffic below. I was on the 26th floor. The elevators worked well so it wasn't a problem getting up & down. Overall I had an excellent experience here & would highly recommend this hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you care more about location”
Reviews.Author: FrankandJules
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, near broadway and times square and empire state building is a short walk away. We had a superior room and to be honest, if that is a superior room the standard rooms must be very small. The reception is always busy and many parts of the hotel are tired. If you are more bothered about location, this is an excellent hotel. If you want an luxurious hotel it is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wants to be more but has long way to go.”
Reviews.Author: dunowon
Reviews.Content: Dirty sheets and bathroom. If you are going to have white furnishings, dust once in a while. Dark halls and the renovations are not complete. Understaffed.

Reviews.Title: “Milford has evolved: WOW!”
Reviews.Author: jarah9
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel previously in August 2010, having paid 250$ a night (for an old dingy room that might have had bed bugs in my opinion), was not impressed at all. Recently, I had heard that the hotel had been renovating its rooms, a complete revamp. I had received an email from the hotel around Christmas time offering an I love New York package which included a t-shirt, keychain, mug and a card that offered us various discounts at restaurants, sights around NYC, stores... I booked Milford Plaza for 95$ a night, a queen size bed room. I prayed that it would be a better experience. And let me tell you this: IT WAS! The room, albeit small (but hey, who stays in their room all day when they are in New York City?, and I heard that some rooms are smaller than others, so if you are a bit claustrophobic you can always make a request to get a bigger room), it had brand new furniture, clean white linens (which can attest to how clean the room is), new carpeting and an updated bathroom as well. We arrived there at 9 am (way before our scheduled check-in time) and the room was already ready us! This hotel is steps away from Times Square, right near a subway station, many restaurants and much more. This was a steal of a deal! I would go back there in a second, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Standard and fine, definitely not a "nice" place”
Reviews.Author: pandasuh
Reviews.Content: For a quick NY trip and the price we paid ($100/night incl taxes and fees) it was fine because the location is unbeatable in the heart of Times Square. But as the review is probably about the hotel itself, let's note a few things: 1. Their elevators are the ones where you push the floor number in the keypad and you get assigned an elevator. Now, this probably is more efficient on normal days, but imagine having a busload of high school students ALL TRYING TO GET UP TO THEIR FLOORS...and shortly thereafter, ALL TRYING TO GET TO THE LOBBY. We wasted 30 minutes because of the elevators, as we waited forever and watched each elevator pass by because it was full from another floor. Not fun. 2. The rooms are small. I'm fine with that, but NOT fine with the thin walls. Every time someone closed their door in my hallway, I jumped (and I'm not even really sensitive to noise!) Also, when we arrived, there was a piece of plastic garbage on the floor...which is fine, not a huge deal since I can throw this away myself...but when we came back from our day and our room was remade, they had not thrown out our trash in one of the cans. So, housekeeping could use a little help. Again, not a big deal, but just saying. All in all, if I was going for a relaxing trip, I'd rather use points and stay in NJ or Brooklyn. If I need the location, I may consider staying again, but ONLY if I got an AMAZING deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: chriswin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for $95 per night which included an "I Love New York" gift package. Arrived around 3:00pm to find just one person at the reception desk, which I think is odd given this is prime check in time. Had to wait a longer period of time than normal. Was given a room on the 24th floor. The room appeared to be one of the renovated rooms as it had what I call a platform bed and there was a nice tv in the room. I'm not a fan of these low beds and it wasn't that comfortable. What made it worse for me is that I couldn't figure out how to set the temperature in the room - I like it very cool, almost cold and it was warm in the room. Since my room was prepaid and there is no restaurant in the hotel, I couldn't figure out why the hotel needed to place a hold on a credit card, but that is a minor issue. What bothered me more was the $14.95 per day for wi-fi and the $5.00 minimum charge to access the internet from the computers in the lobby. Fortunately, I found a FedEx a couple blocks away that only charged $.30 a minute with no minimum. I did like how you had to enter your floor number into a key pad to be directed to the appropriate elevator and the front desk staff was polite. The clerk did confuse me when I checked out because she asked if I wanted to keep my room charge on the same credit card, but I had prepaid. I finally figured out she was giving me the option to pay cash and then receive a refund to the credit card. The location is perfect if you want to be near Times Square and the Theater District.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine fun in NYC”
Reviews.Author: gwyt
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights over Valentines Day and had a wonderful time. The location is unbeatable, you can walk everywhere. The rooms are all renovated and the lobby is next. Our room was on the 28th floor with great views and was a good size and clean. Our friends had a much smaller room. Staff were very helpful and knowledgeable The only negative thing was there is no-where to get coffee. The gift shop had decaf. and tea. There are so many places near by, it is not a big problem. For NYC the price was very good. We will book there next time..

Reviews.Title: “What a shambles”
Reviews.Author: nikki m
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times in the past and because we were not impressed we changed hotels.The location is brilliant so when we saw their web site and saw it had been refurbished we thought it was worth trying again. Well the hotel does not look so impressive as it does on the site pages.Our room was so small we had nowhere to put anything, so had to live out of our suitcase.The room was so hot and uncomfortable, my shoes were left by a pipe which melted the bottom of my soles.Our room was not cleaned or serviced for three days out of the seven we were there, even though we complained three times nobody seemed to give a damn. Our bath water was brown on one occasion and our view was exceptional if you like looking at scaffolding!We have found a better hotel now and will not be going back to the milford even though the price and location are good.

Reviews.Title: “For student travel - great!”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in NYC with a few friends for a week. With an issue our accommodation cancelling a month before our travels, we booked this place. Pros - For the three of us, it was pretty cheap accommodation especially for NYC (think $900 each for 7 nights). SO CLOSE TO SUBWAY AND TIME SQUARE. Best feature of the hotel. You could not get a better location then this. It is being redeveloped. Lobby looks fantastic, with somewhat helpful staff. The beds were so confortable! Cons - Yes, there was ripped wall paper. and small. The room was also tagged with writing on the walls. bathrooms weren't anything fantastic, with cracked titles. The floor was held down with tape in the hall ways. The cleaners were lovely, but wasn't the cleanest place around. As a a student, this place worked fine. If you want a good location hotel and don't mind not having all the frills = this is the place for you. Wouldn't suggest for families or if you could afford better, but if you're looking for a roof that's close to everything, this is it! I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Paddywack1964
Reviews.Content: I had initially booked this hotel a year ago for a suprise trip to New York for my girlfried, however on reading the reviews we made what I consider to be at the time the right choice in switching to the Belvedere Hotel. Because of this original booking I was still obviously on their mailing list and when considering whether or not we could afford to go to this year the decision was made easier by getting the offer of the $99 renovated rooms. It was also good to start to see the vastly improved reviews of these rooms coming through on trip advisor. We arrived on 11 Feb for 6 Nights and were given Room 2010 a single Queen Size room. Check in was quick and efficient and before long we were up in the room. As stated by many others the room was small with an exceptional small bathroom but too be honest it was more than adequate for two people unless you were determined to share the batroom at the same time. The Room (The Good) Clean with daily linen changes. Decent sized TV with plenty of channels Black out currents keeping the room in total darkness when needed The Room (The bad and the Ugly) Lack of sockets meant that a number of gadgets had to be charged in the bathroom The finishings on a number of items was poor - not enough to downgrade the hotel but if i was in charge of the renovations i would like someone to have made sure the worked did what they were meant to do. The hotel (The Good) Location a block for Times Square and within a few minutes walk of the main theatres, subways, fast food and normal restaurants. The price - hopefully this stays for a while Staff where helpful and corteous with even the cleaning staff having a smile and a good morning when passing. The hotel (The bad) Having to pay for internet access - not a deal breaker but would still be nice if it were complimetary.
