The lifts - These are hit and miss due to the way thhey operate get there when no ones is around and there is not a problem. Get there when the crowds are back from shows or a bus or party of students arrive then you can expect a long wait. Lack of anywhere to dine within the hotel is again not a deal breaker but would be nice and it is something which may be resolved when all the renovations are done. Summary A very clean, and comfortable hotel that provided you get a renovated room will be more than adequate for your stay in New York City. At the price point of $99 I can highlly recommend it but would like to give the hotel a word of warning, dont put up your prices too much in the future as the facilites will not justify it and location alone would not make me choose the Milford over anoter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy C
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for herr 18th birthday! It was our first time in New York. We were a little concerned with some of the reviews before we went! However, I only have good things to say! We were greeted by lovely, friendly staff. Yes, the entrance and reception are are a little tired looking (but this is going to refurbished sometime in 2012) but the room was good. We had a queen size room and it was a little on the small size but we got a good deal and it was worth it. We had everything we needed. The room was clean with a new bed and the pillows were great! To be honest we were out most the day anyway and came back, had a shower and then out for a meal, then back to bed so it was adequate for us. The location was fabulous. Only a very short walk to Times Square - it was ideal. We too had lots of school kids staying but you know what we had no noise problems. It was fine. The only thing that did bother us was that sometimes in the morning you had to wait some time for the lifts - but that is it. We had a great time and I have recommended to friends who are actually visiting in October 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Marta33
Reviews.Content: January 2012 It is the third time that I stayed in this hotel, excellent location, Times Square, the subway station, fine restaurants and good theatres are within walking distance of the hotel. In these moments are in remodeling and rooms are very nice. The price is very good considering its good location. Enero 2012 Es la tercera vez que me hospedo en este hotel, excelente localización, Times Square, la estación del subway, buenos restaurantes y buenos teatros estan a pasos del hotel. En estos momentos estan en remodelación y las habitaciones estan muy bonitas. El precio esta muy bueno considerando su buena localización.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: kad2pa
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and was overwhelmened with students. I thought the WORST. The location was perfect, check in ran smoothly, the room was recently renovated and quite nice and very comfortable and clean. There was no problem with children noise, running up and down halls and just generally being unsupervised kids. We have been to many hotels where the discipline is totally broken down. BUT your hotel was actually quiet during the night. We would recomment a new renovated room to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: pdxkelly
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many budget hotels, and this was one of the better ones. I recently spent three nights at this hotel and can, without a doubt, say that I WILL return. And honestly, how much time do you really plan to stay in a hotel in NYC, anyway? You're in the city that never sleeps -- get out there and explore! The hotel is conveniently situated just a couple of blocks from the Port Authority Bus Station (drop point for the NYC Airporter shuttle - $12.50 from LGA, $15.00 from JFK), the A/C/E Subway stop ($2.50 subway, $5.00 AirTrain transfer to JFK), a block from Times Square, and in the heart of the theater district. Taking advantage of the close proximity to the TKTS booth at Times Square, I managed to take in three Broadway and off-Broadway musicals during my three night stay - all shows were within a couple of blocks of the hotel. (If you're looking for a great comedy/musical, I'd recommend NEWSical the Musical, Avenue Q and/or How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying). There were also food options, galore, surrounding the Milford - Shake Shack was right across the street; Starbucks and McDonalds within a couple hundred yards. Lots of local eateries on 9th Avenue, as well. Food Emporium was just a few blocks away. Looking for last minute, forgotten toiletries? There's a Duane Reade (24 hours) just across from the Port Authority Bus Station. On to the hotel, itself: I stayed in a recently renovated Queen room - #2603. The room was average-sized for NYC, but fresh and clean. The design of the room was sleek and well laid-out. The room was quiet, too -- either I had no neighbors (unlikely - the hotel seemed very busy), or the walls were well insulated (let's go with that explanation). As a light sleeper, I slept comfortably through the night. The room was also equipped with black-out shades -- an absolute must for anyone sensitive to light. The bathroom was small, but for a single person, it was more than enough space. They definitely got it right when it came to the fixtures. It looked very modern and new -- lots of glass and chrome/stainless steel. The shower had great pressure (no tub), but be careful as you could accidentally flood your bathroom (the shower curtain was barely long enough to reach the lip of the shower). Despite other reviewers mentioning the ongoing construction, I heard none of it. I'm not sure which part of the building is undergoing the renovation at the moment, but I had no issues with sounds or noise (I was there Saturday-Tuesday). The only times that I could hear any noise outside was if a neighbor slammed their door in the hallway, or if an emergency vehicle was blaring its horn on the street (and even then, it wasn't bothersome). Be aware that (at least for my room), there was a balcony that looked as if it was shared with a neighbor. The windows to the rooms were fully openable, and didn't seem to lock -- I didn't go out onto the balcony, so I don't know if the windows could be opened from the outside, but just be aware of this possible security issue. Others mentioned issues with a lack of outlets. I didn't have this issue - my room had more power outlets than I knew what to do with them -- all conveniently situated around the bed and desk areas. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. The hotel is situated in a great location, the room and amenities were well-appointed and for the price, it is very difficult to beat ($99/night). I was in town for a trade-show, so its location along the shuttle routes was very convenient. My only complaint is the fee for internet usage, but I was barely in my room (except to sleep), so the lack of free wifi didn't bother me much.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: mtl-wasa
Reviews.Content: Great location, only 5 minutes away from Times Square and a block away from the bus station and the Times Square subway stop. The rooms are small, as well as the beds, but it’s clean and good enough for a weekend in New York City. Good quality/price ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherT10
Reviews.Content: I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. When we walked in to our room it wreaked. the smell was awful and the window was open... in January. Now we know why the window was open. Also the heater was loud and leaking and made the carpeted floor all wet. This is probably why it smelled in the room. Room key did not work and we had to constantly go down to the front desk from the 23rd floor to get the key re-programmed. I was supposed to stay here for 2 nights... once night was enough and we ended up leaving. Not a happy camper after this stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - still room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Bains19
Reviews.Content: We picked in the Milford Plaza for long weekend break to NYC. The choice was driven by the location and price we were offered at the time. This was our first ever stay in NYC hence we had no idea if our choice would turn out to be good or bad. Cannot fault the location at all - It’s in Time Square and right opposite a subway station which will take you to most locations both uptown and downtown. The rooms are average in size. We noticed in some reviews people quoting that they were small but compared to most European hotels we have stayed the size matched up well for hotels in this price and star bracket. We arrived around 3pm and were promptly greeted by the check in staff. We asked for a renovated room with a views of time square, the lady was more than happy to accommodate our request. The room we were given was fine however it was a connecting room so we could hear the neighbours next door. We asked for this to be changed which is was and we were provided a similar room with views on the top floor. Having now seen 2 rooms I can confirm the two were similar in size. All rooms have flat screen TV’s and an iPod docking station which was handy bathrooms varied in size. Only negative point was the heating as it was cold we turned the heating on which was fine except for the fact that it made random noises which was annoying if you’re trying to sleep. The noise would come and go but as we were so tired from our exploration we ignored it and slept well. The beds where Queen size and comfy. Linen and towel were changed on a daily basis. We left items (shopping) in the room daily and they were never moved or missing. The views of time square were great even better as we could hear the celebrations from the people of NY when the Giants won the SuperBowl. There are renovations going on, this is mainly noticeable from the outside of the hotel as there is scaffolding all around. Inside we could not see or hear any works. In regards to location and services there is no shortage of places to eat or shop nearby. Time Square is only a 2 min walk, there is a McDonalds and Starbucks within 200 yards of the hotels along with gifts shops etc.. Shake Shack (burgers) is across the road and there are many more places to eat and drink all within walking distance. We found the location to be excellent for our exploration. Most midtown attractions including, Central Park, Macys, Empire State are all within walking distance. Downtown and Brooklyn are all accessible via the subway which is safe and cheap. Watch out for rouge taxi drivers from the Airport to Manhattan. We were duped by one on the way in which cost us an extra $40. Stick to yellow cabs regardless of what they say or quote. There is flat rate for yellow cabs the extra is for town cars which I think we got. On our return we opted for a shared taxi arranged by the Hotel concierge this was paid in advance and pick up was from the hotel at an agreed time. Its saves a bit of money compared to a normal taxi. Would we recommend to stay again – based on our experience I think we would.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible service despite excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bart H
Reviews.Content: In short, the worst service in a hotel that I have ever experienced, despite its excellent location. Personel was unresponsive to many issues that were not okay. Then the manager would show some kind of response, but one could tell not much was done with it, probably similar to all quick responses written in response to any bad reviews posted on this website. As I have many stories to pick from, I will just limit myself to one example. I came in for the New York marathon a couple of days early and was sick with the flue trying hard to recover. The heating was turned off, which with a flue beginning of November in NY is not optimal, to say the least. I called three times out of my bed to request someone to come and take a look, and the constant response was that it would switch on automatically at an outside temperatur of 50 degrees Fahrenheit. All good, but I told them that in my room it was for sure already approaching that temperature. The smart answer I got was:" Well Sir, it is probably the case that it is colder in your room than outside." How does that work, I wondered. Do you actively cool the rooms at Milford Plaza? Anyway, I decided to ignore that and stated that November new york 8.00 PM, it is for sure way below 50, which it was. It took me three calls to get the same answe three times and nobody wanted to come up. Finally I went downstairs and one would think it can then be arranged quickly, as one would expect some service face-to-face at the frontdesk, right? Wrong! It took three one-to-ones with an uninterested open-mouthed gum-chewing staff, which looked like they could not care less giving empty promisses before anybody was sent. At 22.30 (2.5 hours after starting the attempts) finally somebody arrived at my door, to simply open up the heater and change some screws and vaults, so that the heating was no longer set to vacant. In short, something drasticall needs to change in the management and the staffs attitude at this place, to realize that a hotel is built to make a customer have a pleasent stay. Untill such changes, I would highly recommend to go somewhere else. There are enough places in NY. We stayed at the Helmsley a couple of days later, which was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: JimenaCM
Reviews.Content: there were bedbugs, terrible service, and incredibly dirty! :S i couldnt even stay there! THE WORST! they didnt want to give my money back! :S they stole it! and the beds are smaller than individual ones, its super old and in bad conditon. and you may not believe it but there were hairs taped on one wall, I SWEAR.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mrsdeb
Reviews.Content: Our room (one of the newly renovated ones) was extremely small, but sleek, modern, and quite clean. There's Security after 11pm to make sure you're actually staying in the hotel. The price was decent for New York City - but the topper was - you just cannot beat the location. You're literally steps away from Times Square - so see a show, go out for drinks or coffee, and stroll around the corner to your hotel. No worrying about watching the clock so you can catch the bus or train out of the city to find a decently priced room.

Reviews.Title: “Really good!”
Reviews.Author: katiekun11
Reviews.Content: So I'm still here, it's my last night, & I just wanted to come on here to review because I probably won't have time tomorrow. This hotel is a very good location... it's central, right in the middle of Manhattan & it's relatively easy to get to from Penn Station OR Grand Central Station. Of course if you're no good with directions it's probably better to hop in a cab but the fun of NYC is to 'lose' yourself in it! This hotel is newly renovated. I got a renovated room. It's quite small but that's the standard for NYC hotels apparently. The room was exceptionally clean, everything worked, & the electrician even came by to check that everything in my room worked, which was nice! The TV was huge with 69 channels - an amazing selection. They have friendly staff here who will endevour to help you with anything you want. They also have a gift shop where you can purshase phone cards, electrical adapters, food, drink, magazines & other travel essentials. You get a map when you check in. No hotel guide but not a big deal because they are so friendly here you can ask them anything (as I mentioned before!) Housekeeping is very good & I recommend leaving a $2-5 tip per day as they're so good! I recommend this hotel for couples, solo travellers, business travellers but not for family. The rooms are small so you'd probably have a tough time moving around & stuff. But yes. I WAS worried about going because of the reviews but don't let them put you off. Just make sure you ask for a renovated room when you book online/check in at the desk & HAVE FUN! PS: Have put 1 star rating for restuarant & swimming pool because hotel doesn't have these amenities. However there are a few wonderful bars just across the street so not a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly good!”
Reviews.Author: poitiers75
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the newly renovated Milford Plaza over the holidays and were a little skeptical before arriving -- after all, who gets a quality hotel room in New York City for $99.00? Answer -- WE did! We were there for a long weekend and were amazed at the quiet, clean and well-appointed room with a large-screen TV, safe, iron and board, hair dryer, personal amenities in the bathroom, wonderful shower with great water pressure, and more than adequate lighting. The staff was very accommodating, anything requested of housekeeping appeared immediately, the doorman unfailingly delivered cabs upon a minute's request, and the lobby featured free boaring pass print-outs and a very helpful concierge desk. The bed was extremely comfortable and afforded a wonderful night's sleep. Express check-out featured a copy of our paid bill delivered under the door the night before and a key drop near the front desk. All in all, a fantastic experience! We'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “What a difference!”
Reviews.Author: Travelinscott
Reviews.Content: When in the city for business, I have stayed at the Milford for many years; putting up with drafty windows, scalding/freezing showers, old televisions that barely work, broken lamps, poor service, no desks in the room, keys that stop working, and several other chronic problems because the location and price couldn't be beat. This week I opened the door to my room and thought I was in the wrong hotel. I was greeted with new double pane windows, a comfortable platform bed with feather pillows, new carpeting, modern night stands with drawers, good size desk with enough outlets and an ethernet cord, small dresser with drawers, all new bathroom fixtures, soft bottom tub with curved shower curtain rod, and a new large wide screen flat panel TV. I stayed four nights and everything worked perfectly. Even the amenities (soap, shampoo, etc) was high level. Service can be spotty but that is not unique to the Milford in this city. Had there not been computer problems at check-in, I would have given it a 5 star rating. The location is in the heart of Broadway at Times Square. Plenty of cabs on 8th Avenue and right next to the "A" train subway line that will bring you straight in from JFK (if you want to save on cab fare).

Reviews.Title: “Great Area, Good Price but Construction Noise”
Reviews.Author: lam91897
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an overnight trip to NYC to see Anything Goes. My stay at the Milford Plaza was good. I had a queen remodeled room. Comfortable bed and pillows. Location was great for walking around and walking back from the theatre. I was able to check in early. The downside was the construction noise that began at 7:30 AM. I was awake and getting ready to leave so it did not bother me. I would stay again if I got the same price for the room while the construction is going on.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 5 days and thought it was great!”
Reviews.Author: UptownGirl123
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of mixed reviews on tripadvisor, I was worried about staying at this hotel--especially since I was staying 5 nights!. But, because I was traveling alone, I decided to go ahead and take my chances. As it turns out, I was more than pleasantly surprised! My room (#2605) had a full size bed and was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small but clean. Although I did not request a renovated room, this one had been renovated and had a cool sleek look. There was a small desk and a flat screen tv. The closet contained an ironing board but even though they said they have safes in the room, mine was missing. It turned out to not be a problem since I did not want to carry my ipad each day, they arranged for it to be stored in the managers office. I picked it up each night. No trouble at all. The staff was friendly and helpful, the location was easy and close to the subway. There is a free USA Today newspaper at the front desk for you each morning. There is a charge for the interent, but since I had an ipad and already subscribe to services, I did not need the hotels. (I think it was about $5.00/20minutes which seemed reasonable.) You can print your boarding pass in the lobby for free. And if you are seeing a show, this is near Times Square and a perfect location! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but be sure you don't need anything from your car!”
Reviews.Author: OCPinkFrog
Reviews.Content: The room itself was nice. Good for the price. We didn't have the best of views (a brick wall) though we weren't spending any more time in the room than necessary so that wasn't a problem at all. Right next to Times Square - excellent location. Our biggest complaint is with the valet parking service. It's $42.00 for 24 hours - however your car is taken to a garage a couple of blocks away and you are not allowed near it without checking the vehicle out of the garage, paying your $42.00 (whether your 24 hours is up or not) and then checking it back in for another 24 hours - and subsequently another $42.00. We kicked up a fuss and were (very begrudgingly) allowed to return to our car for a few seconds once an employee had brought it down to the entrance of the garage without having to pay double - but be careful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean room. We will stay again”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth Staying here. We had a refurbished room and it looked cool!! No bible or hotel guide were in the room but that's not a deal breaker. Room was on the small side but well layed out. Bathroom was clean but only person could fit in it at a time unless the other person was in the tub! Desk light could not be plugged in??? It would not fit! We would stay again! We asked that our bags be held after checkout and was surprised to find out their was a $3 per bag charge WTF really ???

Reviews.Title: “15 years is a lot of time”
Reviews.Author: tigerflight202
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milford Plaza back in 1994 or 1995. I grew up outside of Philadelphia where I had been bombarded by this commercial: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UwlvkUMsDgI The place I stayed was not the place they showed in that commercial. Of course I wasn't expecting dancing bellhops, but i was expecting a shiny, clean hotel. What it was back then was dark, dank and smokey. After a deal way too good to pass up, I stayed there this weekend. And WOW what a change. I guess it's mid-rennovation right now but the rooms were spotless, the bathrooms as pleasantly modern as any 4-star i've stayed in recently. ANd it was very quiet. THe lobby carpet is still a little thread-barren, but it seems that's the last thing to be renovated. I will happily stay here again. I had a great time. THe price and location could not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Location & Price Can't Be Beat!”
Reviews.Author: kmcanderso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently undergoing a $140 million renovation so when reading reviews it is key to differentiate between the "old" Milford & the renovated rooms. The hotel is one block from Times Square and directly across from a Subway entrance so there isn't a better location in NYC. The rooms are small but it is to be expected in NYC. There is a bed, a desk, chair, set of drawers & a small closet. There is enough room to walk around the objects but not much else. The bathroom is also petite but there was enough space for a week's worth of sundries, make up, etc. The staff was extremely courteous. The evening before I arrived I called to tell them I would be arriving early in hopes of being able to get into my room before 4pm. Not only were they able to accommodate me but they also noticed the room rate had decreased since I made my original reservation & adjusted the reservation to extend the lower rate. The hotel housekeeping was attentive & did a fine job. The room was clean, there were no reports of bed bugs when I was there (a huge problem in NYC) and the towels & bedding were always fresh & crisp. TIp #1 - Make sure you get a renovated room. TIp#2 - There are no coffee makers in the room & the hotel does not anticipate adding them Coffee is available in the lobby shop. Tip #3 - When you enter or leave the room make sure you pull the door completely shut behind you. The doors do not slam completely closed as in some hotels. If you assume the door is going to automatically close behind you it is likely you are Saving the door open. Tip #4 - Keep an eye out for room rate promotions even after you have made a reservation. They are happy to revise your reservation even if it is less than 24 hours prior to check in. Bottom Line - The hotel isn't luxurious but for the active traveler looking for a good value the Milford Plaza is strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Mrt1837
Reviews.Content: My fionce and I went to nyc for the first time. We loved that it was located so close to time square and all of the subways. Its an average looking hotel but the rooms are actually decent for nyc. Plus, we only spent about 8 hours in the our room the entire weekend so, it was good for what we needed. I would go back because of the prices that you can grab a room.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL NEAR TIMES SQUARE”
Reviews.Author: GRAHAM P
Reviews.Content: *Major renovations taking place when we were there *Staff very helpfull, nothing too much trouble *Rooms quite spacious and well appointed

Reviews.Title: “Great value..good location.”
Reviews.Author: Brock1126
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times but this was the first since it has been renovated. What a pleasant surprise. Comfy beds and nice linens. Bathroom small but nice shower with lots of water pressure. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best $98.00 we ever spent!”
Reviews.Author: Juanita T
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC with my adult daughter and what a pleasure it was to stay at this hotel! The room we had was pretty small but just right for two people. We shared the queen size bed. The room was very nice and clean! The decor was very retro and bright. We were greeted by a wonderful gentleman every time we came down the elevator or going up. He was always cheery. This is the perfect place to be in Manhatten, within walking distance of so many great sites. We took the subway to the 911 memorial which was super easy to use. We will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a busy trip”
Reviews.Author: johnsie80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on what was pretty much a shopping trip in Jan 12. The room wasn't the biggest i have ever stayed in and wasn't the most modern either, however it was clean, and sheets towels etc were changed daily. The bathroom was tiny and there, and didn't have a proper door, rather a "slidey" thing that didn't properly separate it fully from the bedroom. The decor was a bit dated, even though the room was one of the recently renovated ones!!!! however it did have a big plasma tv! The major plus side of this place is location! it is only one block from times square. within two mins walk you could be at any of the Broadway theatres, and the view from our room (apart from Skyscrapers) was of the theatre that the Lion King was running in. There were any number of delis, restaurants and shops within easy walking distance from us, and we were only a short walk from where the buses to Woodbury Common leave. We were also close to a City Sightseeing bus stop and Port Authority. Although it is not perfect i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going on a shopping/city break to New York. The cleaners took away all the rubbish from our Shopping trip also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In New York At The Milford”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Milford Plaza for 5 nights 8th to 13th December 2011 traveling from England. Having read some of the poor reviews we decided to write To Ms Diane Devine seeking a number of assurances, we received a very prompt and courteous reply covering all of the points that had been raised. We arrived around 8pm and were pleasantly surprised to be met at the kerbside and our bags taken care of by a most helpful bellboy. We were checked in efficiently and our bags were waiting at our room door which was on the 23rd floor. We had a newly renovated room with twin beds and although it was not huge, we found it adequate for two people, it was very clean and smelled new, we had a great view down 8th Avenue, the beds were amongst the most comfortable that I have slept in while staying in a hotel, the bathroom, again, not huge but adequate complete with a good supply of towels, soap, shampoo etc, together with a most efficient shower unit. Being a cautious person, I decided to check out the stairways as these were indicated as fire exits and I always like to check the emergency exit in any hotel. Probably a little over the top but I walked down all 23 floors twice in checking out 2 stairways and noted that they were clear all the way down, no obstructions, good lighting, just a little dust and builders rubble which I expected as the lower floors in the hotel were still being renovated. We had no problem with the 4 elevators which served our floor only having to wait minutes every time we were looking to use one of them. The location is of course excellent, just minutes from Times Square, Broadway and The Port Authority Station etc. Although I had stayed at The Milford some years ago and thought that I knew my way round, the staff were happy to answer any questions, they brought out maps, drew sketches for us to ensure that we found our way around easily, they made sure that we understood the subway system and pointed out where to eat, we could not have asked for more. In particular the housekeeping staff were most pleasant with usually a cheery 'Good Morning'. When it was time to leave, our request for a late afternoon check out was not a problem and the concierge arranged a bus to the airport. Unable to rate the swimming pool or spa, we did not ask if they were available as we were to busy sightseeing. No question, we will be staying here again on our next visit to New York which will be after my next visit to Texas later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: G_L0u_
Reviews.Content: Only downfall I had with this hotel is that reservations are completely useless had a dealing with a guy called andrew if you are to deal with anyone you do not want to deal with this guy, rang the hotel a week before staying to extend our booking he done it for us honourjng the same rate but when we rang the hotel the night before we were going to stay he never put it through into the system. After a hour nearly of dealing with this the front desk had the booking for the extra 3 nights??? How they didn't have it in there system is beyond me?? Besides that everything else was perfect, for the rate we paid we got a lovely renovated room, spotlessly clean, couldn't have ask for a nicer place for the rate we got and how close we were to times square. In a safe area also. If your staying a long time and included in breakfast you will get sick of eating it, stayed 6 nights and options were scrambled egg, pancakes, croissant or French toast , not much of a selection and be aware the breakfast it less then a block away not actually in the hotel. I would defiently reccomend this hotel to anyone staying in New York, can't beat the price :)

Reviews.Title: “Broadway Show Week”
Reviews.Author: PokeyandGumbyTravel
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Updated and Clean. Smaaalll. Not much room to move about. Two twin Comfortable beds. New faucets, shower head, etc. Very nice water pressured. Recvd a great deal for the week ($150/night) through their website. One bad: The heat wasn't controllable. We had to leave the window open because we were boiling. Glad it was quite cool outside. Bottom line: Great location, Clean, Cozy, Cheap for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location small room”
Reviews.Author: shardylan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Dec for 4 nights.Hotel is 2 min walk to Times sq so excellent for location.I got a newly decorated room and though it looked fab on the website it was tiny.Luckily it was just me and not 2 people.You have a tiny space at the end of the bed to get to the window and you could not get past unless standing flat against the wall .Bathroom was tiny too you could nearly touch both walls at same time.Im not sure if they gave me this room as i had stated it was just me .Would stay here again but would be tight if 2 people.Also because i wasnt paying with a cred card i had to pay a $100 deposit/security fee which would be refunded but it wasnt mentioned to me at anytime when i booked .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evolet2012
Reviews.Content: No regrets booking this hotel, really close to everything, if you're like us just want to have a comfortable place, but the priority is the location with a strict budget, then this hotel maybe for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor for that price!”
Reviews.Author: IroMac
Reviews.Content: We booked a renovated room because we saw on tripadvisor.com that the old rooms are terrible. At the check-in desk, we waited about half an hour. The staff was very unfriendly, we didn't feel welcome at all. As we got into our room, we found it very small and the first thing we noticed was that it was about 85 degrees (30 Celsius) in there. We complained at the check-in, and they've sent an engineer. He told us that we had "one of the good A/Cs, because it still heats the room, other guests are freezing". We were surprised that he couldn't do anything about the temperature. So we opened the window to the max (about 5cm) and went for dinner. After returning (about 1 hour later), the room was still way too hot! So we complained again and they sent the engineer again to our room. Meanwhile, we found out that the heat was coming from the bathroom floor, he told us that we (obviously) cannot turn it off. Best thing he told us: They had problems with the A/C for months, but cannot solve it. So we went to the check-in again to complain, but they didn't care at all. To make matters worse, she mocked us because it was freezing outside and we were complaining about a room that was too hot. But it was not just that, the room is simply not renovated. The bathroom door cannot be closed properly (and I don't mean locked, the door cannot be CLOSED). The room smelled weird and we couldn't get rid of the feeling that we paid way too much for that and that we are just getting ripped of. Last but not least, you wait forever for the elevators. They couldn't offer us ANY alternative, so we booked another hotel (the Belvedere) for about the same price. That hotel was great, we were so relieved and confirmed that our feeling about this hotel being to expensive was just right! We spent one night at the Milford (didn't sleep well though because of the heat and open window) and changed the hotel right on the next morning. Don't book this hotel and if you booked, cancel! It is really not worth it, you will just be disappointed. As I saw on tripadvisor.com, Diane Devine, Manager at Milford Plaza Hotel is answering all the bad reviews with a standard text. I have news for you: In a city like NYC, where there are hundreds if not thousands of hotels, nobody will give you a second chance. You act in a very short-term oriented manner, not realizing that you will loose a lot of customers like that in the future. The prominent place will not guarantee you guests forever. It is simply not a coincidence that every time I went to the front desk there were other guests complaining about diverse things too. I understand that this hotel is under renovation, BUT selling rooms as renovated while they are simply not finished is not just wrong but also illegal in my understanding. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and price was great”
Reviews.Author: jamadelizmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in January 2012. Obviously not a really popular time in NYC so we got a great price ($80/night). Yes, the hotel is a bit dated. We were in an unrenovated room. However, for the price plus the convenience of the location this was a great hotel. the beds were very comfortable. The room was small but who goes to NYC to sit in a hotel room? The carpets were old too but the hotel is going through a renovation right now. I really thought this was one of the better places I have stayed at in New York. I don't think I would have paid $250 a night for this hotel but if you get a good deal take it. I would rate this as a 2.5 star hotel. The staff was also great. Very helpful. This trip was with my 10 year old daughter. This was a perfect sized room for the 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: AmandaSK82
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York towards the end of July 2011. This hotel was under renos when we stayed there so the price was right at the time. The room was small with 2 double beds and a small, old tv. the bathroom was also small but it did good for the time we were staying in it. overall the hotel was in a good location, close to times square and it didnt take us that long to walk anywhere we wanted in that area. It was also close to restuarants row and we felt safe walking basically anywhere. lots of garbage on the streets once the evening comes around and early morning. loud to stay there because it's close to times square and you can hear planes and emergency vehicles constantly. I would stay here again if the price was still right.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Ashen15
Reviews.Content: We had an afternoon flight in but check in wasn't until 4 (we'd been hoping to rearrange, get our bearings, and change). We were able to store our luggage, thankfully. Rooms are very small but clean. We were tripping over our luggage and hitting the sharp corners in the bathroom. Room cleaning service was done daily. However, we had to request toilet paper twice, and once it didn't arrive until after we'd left for the day. We had a newly rennovated room (I requested such when booking and also requested a room with a view, which we kind of had). The hallways are very dark and dingy (can't find that particular pic atm). Concierge was difficult to get a hold of pre-trip and had inconvenient hours while we were there. Security was only out front one of the 5 nights we were there. t was conveniently located a few short blocks from Times Square, most of the theaters, and from one of the major subway stations, connecting to all lines. Not having an onsite restaurant was a little inconvenient but several delis and a Starbucks are within a few hundred feet. The morning we left we realized we didn't have any cash to tip the bell hop after we were loaded into the taxi. He actually screamed at us as we were pulling away. This review gets a 3 only because of location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidpetrillo
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews was not sure about staying here. after spending 5 day at the milford it was great would surely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “happy new year”
Reviews.Author: Claire J
Reviews.Content: stayed here from 27 dec - 1 jan 2012 and was really excited about spending new year in times square. The first couple of days was fantastic and thoroughly enjoyed it, However when we were in the taxi to the airport on our way home, my daughter realised that her phone wasnt in her bag and her money(english) was missing from her purse. As we got to the airport My husband phoned the hotel asking them to look in our room, which they did but no phone was found. On arriving home we also noticed that my sons PSP and games, which he got for xmas, was also missing. We phoned the hotel and explained the situation as obviously someone had been in our room. The hotel explained that they would hold a thorough investigation and would check how many times the key had been used for the room that day, The milford Plaza did not contact us about the situation and we had to contact them ourselves a few days later. They ran through all the times the key was used and explained that our door was left open for approx 1 hour whilst we were out of the room. The doors in this hotel do not have a self closing mechanism, which we were not told about. As we were home before we realised other things were missing we could not file a police report and therefore cannot claim on our holiday insurance. A great start to 2012 NOT!!!!!! Many Thanks Milford Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Dec.28-31,2011. Due to a mixup with our travel agent, we arrived a day early for our booking. Despite it being one of their busiest weeks (remember that this hotel is just one block from Times Square !) we were allowed to check in a full day early! Good thing too because our other option was the train station floor. In light of some of the negative reviews, we were slightly apprehensive but once we got to our renovated room on the 20th floor, we were very impressed. Wonderful view out over Hell's Kitchen and the Hudson River combined with quite comfortable beds and adequate room for four adults to maneuver-we were "home" in mid-town Manhattan. Next four days flew by with the knowledge that we had a safe, clean, comfortable place to return to. Milford Plaza is definitely on our list of places to return to,as is New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great experince at the milford plazza”
Reviews.Author: mink_11
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not as bad as the reviews said, the bathrooms had a bit of mold but you have to understand new york isnt a new city. They are under renovations currently we were on the 8 th floor and they were on the 9 th working their way down. NO BED BUGS, in our room at least. Maids were very nice and helpfull great views from our room, room was a good size for the $ you pay. If u complain about the size go to the marriot and pay doubble. Very happy with the milford plaza. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “You'd have to pay me to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Mischa_VA
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at the Milford Plaza. First time was in December 2009 this time December 2011. It was ok in 2009 but this time we were very disappointed! Here is a list: 1. Bathroom: LOTS of mildew on the bathroom ceiling! It was gross! Sink was very loose. 2. Outlets: faceplates for the outlets were missing! We asked for a small fridge (we had 2 diabetics taking insulin in the room) - it took hours to get the fridge and when it finally arrived they tried to plug it in and said "oh that's broken, we'll send up someone to fix it. meanwhile don't use the plug." The fridge still was never hooked up by the time we left (only stayed 2 nights) AND they tried to charge us for it. They said "well, it was in your room." 3. Keys never worked. We had a group of about 30 staying at the hotel using 8 rooms. Reservations were made in January 2011 for the December 2011 trip. We did get a good rate HOWEVER, 7 of the rooms were ready when we arrived, one (ours) was not. We (4 of us) didn't complain since we were going out for a late lunch anyway. After lunch (about 4:30 at this point) arrived back at the hotel to get the keys. Room was ready & keys given. So far so good. We met up with the other 2 and got keys. We stopped back at the hotel before going to a show and found out our keys didn't work. Went down to the lobby got new keys (for all 4 of us). Kept the keys separate and all that. 2nd day - same thing keys didn't work. In 3 days we got 3 sets of keys! 4. Room wasn't very clean and the heater/ac unit made lots of strange (and loud) noises. Others in our party mentioned that: 1. one night someone tried to break into their room. 2. they had to move because the fitness room was right above their room and apparently the hotel was fixing something or the machines in the room were old that they said it sounded like someone with a jack trying to come through the ceiling. 3. lots of mold in the bathrooms Also, when we tried to talk to the manager about the problems we had (especially the key situation) it seemed that we were bothering him. I did mention that this was my 2nd and LAST stay at the Mildford and all he did was look bored and didn't say anything. I would rate customer service at the Milford at a big fat zero!

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMomSS
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive, clean hotel in the theater district. This hotel was very reasonable and clean (no evidence of bed bugs, I checked thoroughly). The hotel is undergoing renovations so I made sure to ask for a renovated room. It was extremely small but the bed was very comfortable and we did have a nice view outside of our window. My daughter and I didn't really spend time in the hotel other than having a place to sleep so it worked out well. Not much privacy when it came to the bathroom, sliding door with rather large gap. Not sure if all rooms are set up this way but if you are modest you might want to inquire at tiime of booking. I would definately book again with the Milford.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a poor place!”
Reviews.Author: Raphisdogs
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely great but everything else is not worthy what you pay for. The staff was nice but the room was very small and extremely noisy because of a huge A/C unit. The bathroom was old and one day they forgot to clean the room. There is no bar in the hotel, no coffee pot or refrigerator in the room. Overall I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Average- don expect too much- but good price for location”
Reviews.Author: UmbrellaRed
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights over Christmas with family in the hotel. Make sure you reserve a renovated room. Also- if possible reserve a double room if it is the same price as a regular one queen bed room- the extra space is very handy as the one bed rooms a very small. Good location, make sure you dont pay too much though as it really is in a state of transition. Room wise- it is nice if it is renovated, except the bathroom door does no close- it is a slider with a good 1 inch gap all around. not very private so not very good if you are sharing with anyone otherthan a close family member. if not renovated- awful smelly and dirty. ( had family staying in non reno room also.) Also- I disliked the lack of effort by staff. I went to reception to ask if non-feather pillow was available- he said no. i waited and pushed the subject, as it is not uncommon to have a feather allergy. After 5 mins talking he agreed to ask someone else. 10 mins later he returned to say there was 1 non feather pillow in the entire hotel. I gave him my room number and he said it would be taken there. it never was. very poor serivce for simple ask. My allergies were very bad, i had to sleep with a towel for a pillow and only the sheet for bedcovering- in the middle of winter. not impressed with service at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great improvement!”
Reviews.Author: plori
Reviews.Content: The hotel has improved considerably since the renovation. (Ok, it used to be a dump.) Now it is clean, smartly decorated and cool. I had a renovated room with the "I Love New York" promotion, so I got a little bag of goodies. The staff even seems to try harder. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “This is worse than terrible”
Reviews.Author: Ray R
Reviews.Content: We were faced with an extremely bad and disgusting service at the Milford Plaza Hotel. We checked in flying all the way from Niagara Falls to Buffalo and then to New York arriving on December 28, 2011 – at around 11:30PM – 1:00 AM. When we arrived at your hotel, the two security guards / doorman told us that the elevators were broken and that we had to carry all four of our luggage up the stairs to our room. We asked for a bell service but they told us that there was none and that we had to “deal with it ourselves”. Please look back at your camera footage. This is the worst service I have ever seen by far for a hotel of your nature. We booked your hotel for New Year’s weekend and hoped to enjoy ourselves but instead found that the service your hotel provides is horrible and in fact, racist. Coming from an Asian descent, we felt that the doorman/security was extremely racist towards us due to our race and did not want to help us at all. I was with my wife and two kids and with a total of 4 luggage. Even a passerby (another hotel guest) was willing to offer their help to us. Even a homeless person would offer their help seeing the conditions we were faced with. In addition to the horrible service we received upon arriving, the hotel room smelled disgusting (similar to new plastic/remodel. Obviously, nothing was done during our stay to help compensate this fact.

Reviews.Title: “The "Mildew" Plaza”
Reviews.Author: WILLY P
Reviews.Content: For a good room go to another hotel, the bathroom had lots of mildew on the ceiling, plus the room was not very clean. This hotel belongs in a third world country, not in NY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best NYC value.”
Reviews.Author: ciaobla
Reviews.Content: OK, the staff at front desk was nice and the location is perfect for tourists that want to be in the center of the Times Square action. I prefer a larger space (you know, so you don't have to turn sideways to get to the window) and a cleaning crew that uses a crevice tool (the built-up dust around the beds was gross). It would seem that the renovation has not yet reached the 7th floor because our sheets were literally see-through and my top sheet was stained (we thought is might be many things and settled on chocolate!). I won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Milford Plaza Revisited!”
Reviews.Author: artworld8
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Milford for two nights, just after Christmas. The Milford is in the process of being renovated, which I knew before I booked. I was here about 15 years ago, and I have to say the improvements are impressive! I stayed in one of the "renovated" rooms--and had a small, but beautifully situated room (#2248) on a corner of the building with two amazing windows. I had a view of the city one direction, and a magnificent vista over the river from the other! LOVED it! The room was spotlessly clean with a sleek modern feel, and although free of frills--some of which I missed--the beds were brand new, and very comfortable. The best part of the experience, however, was that everyone we encountered from the reception/check-in staff, to the bell captain/doorman (who was most charming!)--all went out of their way to be cheerful and helpful. Valet parking was a breeze. The breakfast (not automatically included), was half a block away, in a small linen-tablecloth bistro--and it was perfectly delicious, with great service. If I had any criticism, it would be that some of the basic creature comforts are missing--like a coffee maker in the room. (We found the Starbucks in the gift shop day two, which helped!). Our other mission was finding a roll of toilet paper--about 10 PM one night, and that proved impossible, short of getting dressed and trekking downstairs to the reception area. No answer at the concierge desk, no way to contact housekeeping that we could find, and even calling the desk downstairs took some doing. Advice to the hotel: Provide a little "guide" to services and perks in the room (like the Starbucks in the giftshop) so that guests can get comfortable faster. Bottom line: There are still some rough edges, but overall this is a great place to stay, right in the heart of the theatre district, right at Times Square, that doesn't cost a fortune. Be sure to book a renovated room, for best result.

Reviews.Title: “At Less Than One Hundred Dollars, It was a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: westernfb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 12-23-11 until 12-26-11. We stayed on the 28th floor in room 2824. This room had what I believe were two twin beds. There was just enough space to squeeze in the beds, a night table between them, a desk, and sufficient area in which to walk around them. A flat screen television was mounted on the wall and faced the beds. The closet was also small but sufficient. Same for the bathroom. Everything seemed to have been recently installed and was clean comfortable, although we noticed some signs of poor workmanship, such as the panel on which the TV was mounted and the doorstop. The view from the room was of another wing of the building. The hallways were clean but dull, and there were no directions to the one ice-maker on the floor. The elevators were small and reasonably fast. The lobby reminded me of a boring old Soviet hotel, but the staff were cordial and helpful. I understand that the lobby will be spruced up as part of ongoing renovations (our room being an example of the renovations already completed). The entire hotel was a "no-frills" facility that completely met our needs. After taxes, fees, etc. were added to the price, we paid a bit less than one hundred dollars per night, which was for us an excellent value for a hotel located so close to Times Square. We would definitely return again and again for the same experience. If you just need a safe, clean place to rest your head between shows, shopping, and other excursions, this might be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: msgrad
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the reviews, make sure you are in a recently renovated room. Amazing location in the Theatre District. YES, THE ROOMS ARE TINY, ANY ONE WHO COMES TO NYC FOR THE ROOM SIZE SHOULD STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE AND PAY 3 TIMES THE PRICE! They are clean Ikea like and fun. Get out of the hotel and explore! I paid 95 dollars on Christmas Day. Amazing! Hopefully they are doing the lobby and exterior next.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and very outdated”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: I travel almost 100 days a year for business and this hotel was the worst I ever stayed at. The room was very dirty with mold throughout the bathroom. There was old plug adaptors and I just wanted to leave. The hotel needs major renovation and cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: josydaisy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milford this last week. The location is perfect, so convenient to everything. The room was very clean and nice inside. My only mini complain is that the heater was very loud and the pillows were down and i don't like those - it was hard to sleep with that but it's certainly a preference thing. Outside the hallways looked like backstage of a theater - so cool. We were on the 26th floor and the view down 8th Avenue was so cool. Overall I'm very pleased with the hotel and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “First NY Trip”
Reviews.Author: DeborahD61
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 12-20-11 until 12-25-11. The room was beautiful,clean,friendly. We stayed on the 18th floor,#1816 to be exact. Over looked TIme Square.This room was plenty big,new flat screen TV,comfortable bed. Bathroom was clean and shower was hot and water pressure was great. Elevator was fast, never had to wait very long at all.This hotel was a welcoming place to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. There is not one negative thing I can say. Thank you Milford Plaza for making our trip perfect

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms are nice”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinVagabond
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night of 12/15. From reading the reviews of others staying on the very same night, the room quality apparently varies greatly. I was part of a group reservation, and we specifically asked for "renovated rooms" when booking - this seems to be the critical factor in getting a good room. We negotiated a group rate of $103/night. The rooms were very nice, freshly painted in bright colors and new bathroom. My room faced the street, with moderate but tolerable street noise. There was a room safe large enough for a laptop. My room was large enough to fit another entire bed into it, but others in the party had smaller rooms. I'm not sure how easy it is to "guarantee a renovated room" when booking a single room, but that appears to be the best bet at getting a good room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, Trying Hard, Still A Little To Do”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugged2008
Reviews.Content: This one is a tricky review to write - the Milford Plaza is in a brilliant position in New York on 8th Ave, just a block from the middle of Times Square. Easy to find, with friendly and efficient staff doing a good job. Be aware the hotel is being renovated - they tell you that with signs all over the place. It looks like it has been a pretty run down sort of place previously and the cost to renovate would be enormous. The rooms are small, but clean and servicable. Our room (we stayed 6 nights) had no hot water, but that was soon rectified after a quick call. Lifts are super fast, staff friendly, comfortable beds and a nice bar is situated in the lobby. The small downside was the noise (started about 7.30 am each morning with the workmen). The big downside was the smell. No 2 ways about it - our room stunk a bit. By "a bit" I mean a lot. A mouldy smell (I think). It was only just tolerable. Would I stay here again? Yep, but only if I can smell the room first.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: joe c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about 3 years ago and thought it was ok. I decided to stay here again on this trip 12/15/11 to 12/19/11. That was a terrible mistake. I understand the renovation thing going on but has normal maintenance stopped? My bathroom had a large hole in the wall about 12" by 12" it was covered with cardboard and "masking tape" really? The bathroom was covered with mold and mildew. Probably a major health risk to stay here until the renovation is complete. Then look out, the price to stay will probably triple. The front desk staff acts like they are doing you a favor. No people skills at all. They actually make faces at you if you approach them. The only thing they have going for them right now is housekeeping. These poor ladies are doing all they can with what they have. The hotel smells really bad. Good luck to all who stay in the next few months. The heating unit is very loud and not working very well. You can hear everything from inside your room. I mean everything. Other guests in their rooms, and guests going down the hallway. Thanks for ruining my experience in Manhatten during the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “Give Milford Plaza a chance.”
Reviews.Author: carolynheritage
Reviews.Content: This hotel is obviously under major renovation. I think when the work is complete it will be a great hotel in a fantastic location. We stayed 12/14-12/18 and had no complaints. Our room had not been refurbished but was clean and had everything we needed. Our landing and corridors had been completed and it was a lovely calm chic grey with colourful wall murals at corridor ends. We had no need of any staff assistance but everyone we saw was pleasant and cheerful. We would definately come back and stay again to see the finished product.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: mcachilles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 12/16-12/18/11 the staff were rude, upon entering our room we found someone else's trash and the bathroom covered in mold. Had to wear shoes in the room, the tv was broken, when we called the front desk it took 15 minutes for them to pick up the phone, they said they we over booked actually and may be i just needed to turn the tv on ( sarcastically! they ended up replacing the tv but said they were busy and they offered no apology for the room being filthy. I would never stay here or reccommned it!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a satisfying 6 nights stay”
Reviews.Author: tommytan357
Reviews.Content: As with many people, was apprenhensive when i book the hotel. But the feedback on location that win me over. No issue on customer service, dirty room etc. Have stayed in the renovated room from 11 Dec to 17 Dec 2011. Will stay here again if I am able to get a good deal again. Hope they dont raise the price after the completion of renovaton. Free daily newspaper, self collect from the concierge. My son went to watch some broadway show that was just one or two block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the Milford Plaza”
Reviews.Author: bgleen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the renovated part of the Milford Plaza and I must congratulate them in their efforts. The rooms are still small, but what they lack in space they more than make up for in style. You get off the elevator and into an uberchic hallway of muted greys and track lighting. Then, when you enter the room, you are astounded at the esign- reminiscent of 2001 a Space Odyssey; grey carpeting, white wallpaper, and either an organe orblue accent wall; new everything, bed, furniture, lighting, window treatments. The bathroom is also small but all brand new with new vanities, tubs with pulsating showerhead, toilet. A large flat screen TV on the wall and ample storage space. The hotel is in the middle of renovations-the lobby still has to be workd on, but for a hotel room in the heart of Times Square for $120 a night-what a steal. I couldnt wait to return to my room and enjoy the space. Good work, Milford.

Reviews.Title: “I call it the smelly Milford plaza”
Reviews.Author: petrina s
Reviews.Content: It was are first time in new York are 30th wedding anniversary the hotel was really dirty and smelly staff not very helpful had to change rooms 3 times --the rooms were so bad looking back we should of check out and asked for are money back and gone somewhere else butvwhen your a long way from home we felt we had to put up with it--- it was a special holiday which having a really bad room just made are 30th anniversary such a let down we wS looking forward to a nice hotel all we got was a dirty room I will never stay there again petrina mike from England

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: driveonly
Reviews.Content: I gotta admit, on the trip up to NYC, I was getting a little nervous about this hotel as I was reading some of the reviews. We stayed there four nights, and were truly happier than I thought we would be with our experience there. Sure, the rooms and bathroom are small, but they put the square footage of the rooms on their website, so that was no surprise. The room wasn't so small that we were uncomfortable at all. We got one of the renovated rooms and I loved the decor. It was simple and I love when hotels have all-white bedding. The hotel was such a convenient walk to everywhere we wanted to go. When we looked out our window, we could see the reflections of Time Square's lights on the other buildings. The theater we went to was in the same block as the hotel, so that was nice. And it was only maybe a 10 minute walk to Rockefeller Center, at most. The rooms were so quiet, we didn't hear any noise at all from the hotel, only street noise, but it's New York City, what do you expect? If you go here expecting crazy luxury, you are not going to find it, but if you want a nice clean and quiet room with a short walk to theaters, Time Square, or Rockefeller Center, this hotel is perfect. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: georgiagi
Reviews.Content: The hotel´s location is PERFECT. And I gotta say that is the best cost benefit! The beds are so good also. The problem is the size of the hotel. Too many people, always crowd to go upstairs, mess on the entrance, no help from people on the front desk.Also I was taxed by a phone call that I didnt perform. Recommend it and would stay here back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: purplehuff
Reviews.Content: First and foremost it should be noted that the Milford is a very old Hotel dating back to the 20's and therefore the small closet like rooms. Hotels rooms just weren't that big back then.With that said all I can say in defense of this Hotel is the outstanding location. One block to Times Square about 4 blocks to Radio City and so on. I understand that they are going through a major renovation project but that started 2 years ago this month, how long does it take? My guess they started at the top and they are working their way down. I stayed on the 5th floor and the room albeit tiny was barely passable. The bathroom floor looked like it had not seen a mop in weeks or months and there was a black hair in the bathroom sink ( I have dirty blonde hair). There was no temperature control so you were at the mercy of the heat coming on once in a while. Fortunately it was a very mild weekend and not much heat was needed. The sheer curtains at the window were dirty with black stains. Perhaps the renovated rooms are very nice, so if you choose to stay here request one of the rooms that has been redone. Even with this bad review I would probably stay there again because of the fabulous location. Expect the worst and be pleasantly surprised if things have changed next year when I go back for my annual NYC Christmas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, undergoing renovation.”
Reviews.Author: tatkei
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business in new York. New rooms are very modern, simple and neat, which I really enjoyed. Rooms are quite small, corridors are dark and elevators are quite slow. That is probably because of being an old building. Had some construction noise in the morning though. Right in the heart of the theater district, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Request the renovated rooms! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JamB57
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Milford Plaza Hotel for two nights - December 1st through December 3rd. We had one of the newly renovated rooms and although small, the room was very clean. We were on the 22nd floor and our room stayed plenty warm, so warm that we actually had to crack the windows at night even after we turned the heat off. The room was very small, but the beds were comfy and the location is a quick walk to Times Square and Restaurant Row. We did request some Kleenex from the front desk and we never received it. The phone doesn't have a direct button down to the front desk, so any requests we had we had to go downstairs. The ice machine on our floor also didn't work -- all minor things though considering that the room was clean and comfortable. The holiday season in NYC is very busy and considering the price of this hotel versus other hotels I would stay here again. We walked everywhere -- Rockefeller, NBC, Central Park, Grand Central Station, Restaurant Row, Times Square, our Broadway show. It will be interesting to see the hotel after the renovation is complete next year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Amy J
Reviews.Content: One word for the unrenovated rooms - NASTY!!!! Don't be fooled by the pictures, and there is a reason they do not show a picture of the bathrooms - peeling wallpaper that has mold on it. As noted in other reviews, the bathroom was dirty. The carpet was so filthy our socks and slippers were black on the bottom. Regardless of whether the rooms are renovated or unrenovated, cleanliess should be a priority and it definitely is not a priority at this hotel. Management and staff were not friendly or helpful. The only positive was the location to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: erdincbektas
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days between 20-23 th of November in Milford Plaza. Location was great. You are on the middle of everywhere by walking. My room was quite ok, nice view and clean, not so many facilites at hotel as bars and restaurants. but stuff was very friendly. It is good to stay if you wanna go around in newyork

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,lovely refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: Von64
Reviews.Content: After manger George eventually getting us a refurbished room (which we were told may cost us extra $30 per night per room - but was never charged) we were very happy with our room and hotel. Brill location, minutes from everywhere from theatres, times sq, central park, rockefeller - would def stay again. Staff very helpful and polite, especially the bag storage men - remember to tip!. Only thing missing in room was tea/coffee facility, no coffee machine even in hotel lobby - due to it being reburbished still , and we had to do a 1st thing "coffee run" to starbucks a block down from hotel.. At time of booking in March we were told it would be Oct before hotel fully refurbished,so as we were going Nov dont worry about rooms- but hotel staff advised us it will be April nxt year - so if going before then request,email and phone for a refurb room as the old rooms are smelly, worn and flaking decor! We had a quad room, no storage space other than a drawer each and a cubby hole for your coats - we lived out of suitcases, which dont go under your beds! I took earplugs, as the noise from traffic (even on 22nd floor!) was constant all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: skimadgirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from NYC:( we have used the hotel twice no its not the plaza but you pay for what you get.The bed is clean security is good(checking that we all had official keys at night) and only 3 dolars a case to store out stuff on the last day.Beds are made daily with towel change.In terms of location you couldnt get much better.We were concerned that it would be bad as saw all other reviews so emailed them in advance and we were upgraded to a larger room.But if you are complaining then I suggest you pay a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “Go With a Realistic View”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelers02
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip to NYC in November with my two daughters and 86 year old Mother and we chose the Milford for its location. I had stayed there several years ago without incident, but was worried after reading so many negative comments since its reopening. We went with full knowledge that we might encounter some problems, but decided to take our chances since most of our time would be spent sightseeing, etc. We were given an original room on the 8th floor as they were filled to capacity by the time we arrived. Were there some problems? Yes, but really minor in the scheme of things. . . fresh paint odor in bathroom upon arrival (but better than mold!), old bathroom fixtures, slow heat, thin walls. However, we laughed more in those 6 days than we had in the past year, and enjoyed each other, the sites and sounds of New York, and the cool crisp air of the Fall! So what if it wasn't the Hilton? I wasn't paying for amenities I wouldn't be using, it was clean, and it was a fantastic location for just about everything we wanted to do or see. The people were pleasant enough to work with and the night security was good. I do think it will end up being a terrific hotel once the renovations are finished, but if you are looking for just a good, clean bed for a few winks before heading off for more touring or shopping, don't be afraid of the Milford.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in New York”
Reviews.Author: mariell98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Black Friday night. We could not check into the hotel until 4:00 pm so we had to store our bags and come back. On their web site it showed beautiful remodeled rooms. This was not the case. Our room did not have heat and we had to call 3 times to get a response to this. Our telephone did not work in our room. They never did fix it. The bathroom was dirty and there were black curly hairs on the floors and walls. We are blond and redheaded. I could not take a bath because the fiberglass tub was broken in the back and would not hold water. There was almost no seating in the lobby to even wait for anyone or to meet friends. My nephew and mother came into to town to see a show, and they would not let them into our hotel, not even the lobby, to visit us after the show becasue they did not have a room key. They tried to call us but(see above) the phone was broken and they could not get a call through. When we checked out we had to pay $3 per bag to leave them at the hotel. This included our shopping bags from the day before. It was an all over bad experience and we would never stay here again. There was no down escalator so we had to carry our bags down the steps to street level. All this for $300 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Still under renovation”
Reviews.Author: RERD09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before international trip. It is still undergoing renovation and we got an old room. Small with poor temp control and outdated bath. It was clean but the wallpaper was bubbled. At 8 am the renovation crew started drilling into our outside wall with a jackhammer. It was deafening. We had to get up and out early. The front desk people were helpful but the lobby is almost non-existent with nowhere to relax. This is a bare bones place that is in transition. We have stayed here before and the real draw is the location and proximity to Times Square and Broadway. If you can get a good price and don't mind some hassles then it may be OK for you. Don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: davefaye
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days over Thanksgiving week at this hotel and LOVE it!! The first night we had a room with two single beds. The room was recently remodeled and very spacious for a twin bed room. The closet was huge! The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The next two nights we had a larger room with two double beds as our daughter arrived. This room was also recently renovated and spacious, very clean and comfy like the first room. The hallways have been renovated also with new rugs, lights and fresh paint. The front desk clerks were amazing and helpful...very friendly. All the other staff were also very friendly. One evening when we returned to our room after midnight, we had trouble starting our heater. The front desk sent a maintenance man up immediately. He was very friendly, did not seem put out at all. In a matter of minutes, our heat was working. We were very impressed. We had a very speedy check in and check out. This hotel has such a great location. We have been staying at the Milford Plaza for many years and have never once had a bad experience. Once you become a regular and sign up for emails, you are offered tremendous savings. We have never had to pay the full rate. We always take advantage of the discounts offered. GREAT HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST PERECT .... READ READ”
Reviews.Author: Singergirl1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days for the Thanksgiving day parade. YOU MUST ASK FOR A RENOVATED ROOM. If you read through all the reviews the negative reviews are from the old rooms. We stayed on the 27th floor. We had a large bathroom, comfortable bed, flat screen tv, AC/Heat, a. Great view. It was literally 5 min walking to the heart or times square or 15 min to Rockefeller center. We never needed a bus or cab. The hotel will park your car for $43 dollars a day. The renvovated room are nice and it's in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Toldnaes
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a newly renovated room, and we loved the location. You're almost on Times Square. Clean and quiet rooms with a really nice view over Hell's Kitchen towards the Hudson River.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Marcela I
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend in May 2011 for a week in the Milford Plaza. The only good thing about this hotel is the location: 1 block away from Times Square, near to everything. The hotel is very old, the room is small with old furniture,the paper in the walls is torn and the bathroom is very small and old as well. Walls are very thin They charge you for wi-fi and it has no breakfast. I think that accomodation in New York City is expensive if you want to be near Times Square, but I believe there are better places to stay for a similar price. I put 3 points because of the unbeatable location, but the hotel itself is 2 stars and a half. I don't think I will return.

Reviews.Title: “worst part of my honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Mary84Cork
Reviews.Content: I just cannot believe a place like this still exists today. We stayed here in July on the final leg of our honeymoon. The whole place wasa flithy dirty, from the entrance to the carpets. When we got to our room it was tiny but this was just where the problems started. There was a plastic fork on the ground with dried on food on it, the towel in the bathroom had make up on them, the show tray was missing alot of tiles and there was someone elses hair in the shower not to mention the very many black stains all over the walls. I sat on the bed and cried and begged my husband to go back to JFK and get the hell out of this dump. He however went down to reception and was greeted by a very rude and abrupt receptionist that made out that we were being over fussy....!!!! She gave us another room, it was bigger but just as disgusting. The smell was violent and made me physically sick. We had booked the hotel for 4 nights however we left after the first night and stayed with relatives in New York. As dont mind the rubbish about the 'deep clean' renovations etc....there was zero evidence of any cleaning for the last 30 years. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Noisy and Sub Standard”
Reviews.Author: oioisaveloy
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights at the Milford for myself, my mum and my aunt as a 60th birthday present for my mum. We were very disappointed.The web site is very misleading. The room was filthy, the bathroom wall had holes in it and the shower was very temperamental. The curtains were so dirty they were black. The reception played banging house music 24/7 for some reason!! Most odd! On the first night after very little sleep on the plane we were awoken by a pneumatic drill outside at 2am digging up the pavement! This went on until around 6am and was there placed by hotel workers drilling at 7am!!! There were no tea or coffe making facilities in the room and no cafe at the hotel. I guess it says this on the website but it all added to our unpleasant experience of the hotel. The beds were advertised as doubles but they weren't, they were a lot smaller, with metal bits sticking out of the bottom which my mum tore her ankle open on. The location of the hotel was good but the inside was a hell hole to say the least. I wouldn't bother staying here again. The YMCA would have been cleaner and better value. By all means renovate a hotel but keep the rooms that are in a state of disrepair empty. they weren't fit for an animal!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Milford and had one of the new renovated rooms. The room was beautiful, clean and and spacious (this might vary?) enough for two people. Nice design and with a view over the city and the Hudson River from our bed - pretty cool to stay at 27th floor and enjoy the lights of the city from there in the evening.
