If youre a light-sleeper - remember earplugs, cause even youre staying at the 27th floor, NYC is still a bit noisy at night ;) Kind and helpfull people in the reception. The hotel is placed only one block away from Times Square and all the theaters and if you come with the bus from Newark, it is only 5 min away by foot. We would definitely recomend this hotel and is looking forward to stay here again, probably after the big renavation of the hotel trough 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JC1527
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milford Plaza in February 2011 for 5 nights. I booked this hotel because of it's location and it's price and was fortunate enough to get an excellent deal which meant that the total cost of the hotel and flights was extremely good value. Only after booking did I read the reviews on tripadvisor. To be fair, I was concerned but then decided that all I needed was a bed so did it really matter. Yes, ok the room wasn't renovated, but it had a comfortable bed with no bed bugs, a tv, and a bathroom with a hot shower. What more did I need? So it wasn't luxurious or particularly spacious, but it represented excellent value for money. The location could not have been better, right in the heart of Manhattan close to diners, restaurants, grocery stores, theatres, sightseeing tour buses and the subway. If you want luxury, stay somewhere else and pay the premium you would expect. Don't expect luxury for the what it costs to stay at the Milford Plaza. Like the title of this review says, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Wendy A
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible. The room we were offered had not been renovated for over 30 years. It smelled, it was dirty, the furniture was banged up and had chunks missing from it, the tv was the smallest "old" box set I have ever seen in a hotel and the ceiling was falling apart in the bathroom. When we complained to the front desk they said we didn't book a "renovated" room. There is no place on their website that offers "renovated" vs. "non-renovated" rooms. THIS PLACE WAS SO BAD, that even though we were two females from Florida, we checked right back out of the hotel and pulled our three pieces of luggage down the streets of New York until we found a great and clean hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The ugliest room ever, no warm water”
Reviews.Author: Joanna T
Reviews.Content: Who does an elevator safety check at 11 am at their hotel? Milford Plaza Hotel does. Why would they do that right at the time when people are checking out is baffling to me. After a few minutes of just standing in the hall we asked an employee (he did not understand or speak English at all- I am never against that person having a job, but still an employee should be able to instruct about where a stairway is in case of an emergency) if we can take the stairs down and where they are. He showed us to door after a while of explaining what we wanted to do, so we took the stairs down. We were on the 6th floor. The stairs ended on the 3rd, and the doors were blocked by construction. I guess if there was a fire or some other emergency, we might as well be dead by now. We went back upstairs to the elevators and waited some more for the safety check to end. Don't get me wrong, I'm all for safety, I don't want the elevator I'm in to fall down the shaft to a crushing death but why not do it at 3 am or some other time when there aren't so many people waiting for them? When we finally got downstairs there was a line of pissed off people checking out. There was one person at the desk at the time most people were trying to get out of that God-forsaken place. Our room was smaller than my bedroom at home and I rent a 1 bedroom apartment in Chicago, so that should say something about it. The bathroom was also smaller than the one I have at home, which is luxury compared to the one in the hotel. There was not even a chair in the room, because it would not fit anywhere. The beds were tiny and offered no support at all. The view out the window? Trash receptacles. What was probably the worst thing about it was that on the day we checked in there was no warm water neither in the sink, nor the shower. I'm not talking about hot, I'm talking warm. We washed in cold water is what I'm saying here. I don't know who gets the rooms, which were pictured in the Pictures section of the site I booked it on but I guess I'd have to shell out 10 times more than what I paid. If I haven't booked through Kayak but paid the full price for it, I'd just demand my money back for the experience. I guess that's how the Times Square area is hotel-wise because I will not say the same thing about the entire Manhattan. Just two stops north on the 1 subway we got a room at Upper West Side in a 4 star hotel for $30 less. Two queen beds, everything brand new, wood-paneled bathroom with a great shower. My advice to folks visiting Manhattan: never room anywhere in the Times Square area, unless you have the money to splurge on something at least 4 star. The "3 star" (seriously, who gave them that rating?) are shoddy, disgusting, tourist traps. Take a cab or the subway 15 blocks away either way and you'll room like a king for less.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive hotel in the Heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Natalie M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Milford Plaza for 2 nights in November. Before I stayed I was a little worried about the reviews, however thought I would give it a chance. I was not disappointed. The hotel is undergoing renovations, however apart from the outside facade you would not know these renovations were going on. I had a twin room on the 28th floor and it was clean, a good size, with comfortable beds and a spotless bathroom. The room was well heated and quiet and had a great view of Broadway. The hotel was well located near Braodway, Times Square and the Subway. The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. I would definately reccomend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Soo noicey”
Reviews.Author: Cypan
Reviews.Content: This hotel isnoisey. I could hear the people in the other room talking very clearly. The windows are not insulated and so you feel like there are no windows at all! The rooms are tiny and old. We had a 19 inch old tv on a barely standing table. The service was nothing extraordinary. The only good thing about this hotel is the location

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: travelbug170945
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel away last year as it was for our 50th wedding aniversary ,knowing hotel would be upgraded ,we arrived at 9pm on friday 11 november ,we were allocated a twin bedroom on floor10 i told chap we did not want a twin room ,he said come back tomorrow .we went in the elevertor and went up down a few times before we got to our room .it turned out the room was old and damp ,plaster hanging off walls bathroom door fell of .the beds were clean and so were towells but room was tiny and small tv .we could not be bother dragging our cases out to another room next day ,we reported bathroom door and they fix it ,we decided not to have room cleaned on 12 november as were were in bed betime the cleaner came and we had enough towels at that time ,but we never got a cleaner the next day and room was smelling by this time .very impersolal staff good location but rooms look like a doss house .on checking internet on returning home they are displaying a brand new room for less than what i paid spoil the time we spent in new york as we had just came off a 16 day cruise

Reviews.Title: “Better Not”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis011
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Milford Plaza all the time 25 to 30 years ago. I stopped going as it got more and more run down. I heard that they were renovating and wanted to give it a try. We reserved 2 renovated rooms. The rooms were so small two people had to walk sideways to get around the beds. We asked for two rooms together (months ago) and when we got there they said they couldn't accomodate the request. The gal at reception was yawning and couldn't be bothered with us. One room didn't get made up until 6pm when we finally asked. The place still just looks run down. Either wait until it's all redone or find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Mad Y
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in NYC, was worried about the reviews for this hotel, but still booked, as they were new renovated rooms. The hotels is in an excellent locatioin, beside the Port Authority Bus station, 42st Street Subway, in Times Square, couple of blocks from Central Park, Perfect location could not have asked for better. The rates were excellent, and much cheaper than other 3 star hotels. Yes the rooms are small, but it seems all hotels in NYC have small hotel rooms.but your in the city that never sleeps, so you wont be in the room much. We were on the 23rd floor, excellent views. The staff are excellent could not be more helpful, clean towels, clean sheets everyday, house keeping are brilliant. My advise book a renovated room, you will not get better value anywhere else in NYC. We'll be staying again next year. THANKS TO EVERYONE AT THE HOTEL :)

Reviews.Title: “if you want to stay in a shoe box, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Marie044
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed in the milford plaza when i visit NYC. This trip was extra special as we were having a family part to celebrate our sons engagment. We booked 4 queen rooms in the New Milford Plaza. My son and his wife were in a shoe box. I dont know how they fit the bed in there but that was it. To get dressed they almost had to stand on the bed. I requested several appointments with the general manager as I got no joy from the assistant manager and could not get an appointment. We were there for 5 days and I felt so bad for my son and his wife who were so diasppointed with their room. Our rooms were OK not bad but I think the Old Milford Plaza would knock the sox of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lesley S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in October. On the positive side, great location. Just off Times Square, ideal for theatres etc. The room was one of the old ones and quite disappointing. The bathroom was held on by one hinge and even when supposedly fixed, still didn't full close. Fixtures were oldfashioned and room required some upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rachel1310
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in the Milford plaza from nov 3rd till nov 7th.We booked it mainly for the location I did stay here before and did think it was quite grubby and in desperate need of a renovation. When we were looking at hotels for our trip I noticed that there were newly renovated rooms so I went ahead and booked it . I was extremely pleased we did as from check in to check out I wouldn't have one bad comment to say about this hotel .The staff at reception were quick and friendly .When we got to our room I was so surprised the room on the 28th floor was bright and airy 2 big windows with fab views. The room and bathroom were absolutely spotless ,everyday we had plenty of clean towels and clean bed linen .I would definitely recommend this hotel (renovated room)for the service and location and I will definitely book it for myself again .

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to all the negative reviews it's not that bad...”
Reviews.Author: Kpayne75
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews on here before my stay and I was worried about the hotel, especially as this was stay was to celebrate my husbands 40th. Yes the hotel is undergoing a large renovation, and yes the room we were allocated was tired and in need of work, but having been on holiday many times to Europe, I have stayed in much worse hotels! If you are expecting the ritz then don't stay here, well not until the rennovations are finished anyway. Our room was always cleaned and the bed comfy. We were hardly in our room it was just a base for us, and location wise you can't get much better than the Milford. Don't let the bad reviews put you off!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: Dottie N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights beginning Oct. 31 at the special $199 rate. We stayed at the Milford Plaza before about five years ago and liked it. This time we had one of the remodeled rooms, which was boldly and modernly decorated but very small -- not so bad if you consider the rate. First, the great -- the location is perfect for Broadway fun, only a block from 1/2 priced tickets at Times Square. Our room and bathroom looked perfectly clean everyday we were there. The only real problem we had was an unpleasant odor that eminated from the bathroom several times when we came back in the afternoon. The main room was OK when the bathroom door was closed. The hotel staff said they would try to fix it, and did try a couple of times, but it happened again the last day we came in. My husband believes that the plumbing in the bathroom might have been improperly installed without a gooseneck to eliminate backup gas. The staff was very nice and tried to help us, and did give us a discount on our room for our trouble. I hope this hotel gets the renovating kinks worked out because it is such a great location and I liked the staff.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany575
Reviews.Content: Nov 5 - 6th we stayed here. My daughter, husband and I. This place was horrible. Our reservation was for a non smoking room. We get there and the windows were open in the room (it's november and freezing) and the bathroom door was shut. We open the door and yes SMOKE came out. So either the cleaning staff was smoking in there or the room was never cleaned from the last tenants! The hotel was booked no where for us to move so they said they would put an air cleaner/purifier in there while we were out adn about. Good news is they did go back up to our room the bad news THEY TURNED THE HEAT ON HIGH we got back into our room and it was like 100 degrees. For a daughter with asthma the amount of mold and crud in the bathroom was insane. Disgusting do not recommend staying there at all. the lounge looked good but the rooms were horrible we pre-padi $369 +taxes for the room Wasn't expecting the ritz but this was horrible. Really bad. think twice.

Reviews.Title: “A stay on Skidrow”
Reviews.Author: Shirley W
Reviews.Content: Nov 1-Nov 4; I hate to be critical of hotels or their service, however, my reservation was for a queen size room and upon check-in, they gave me a room with twin beds. The beds were extremely worn, and the linen and top sheets had not been changed on either bed. The carpet was filthy, and there was mold all across the top of the walls in the bathroom. We could hear virtually every conversation of the adjoining rooms. Drapes and curtains were so filthy; I couldn’t bear to touch them. The desk personnel seemed to ignore you for a few minutes every time we went to the desk. For the average of 250 nightly, I would have expected to of at least been placed in one of the newly renovated rooms. I didn’t see any photos of the old rooms as I was looking for a hotel on the web. The only positive note was the location. Close to restaurants, theatres, etc. I’ve had better experiences in third world countries.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darrensale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. the hotel is still undergoing renovation but it didn't affect our stay. The room we had was quite small but clean and adequate for our needs. The location is the huge plus point, for the price! One block from times square and the main theatres. We would definitely stay here again especially when the renovations are complete next year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared off!”
Reviews.Author: SusanKLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I continually read TripAdvisor reviews of the Milford Plaza and was a little afraid to book there. However, my visit to NYC was going to be just after the 10/1/11 opening of their renovated rooms, I took a chance. What a pleasant surprise! Yes, a small room, but clean, bug-less, comfortable bed with fluffy pillows, large flat-screen TV, great rate and the location was AWESOME!! They seem to rent out to large groups of students so sometimes there is a line at the lifts, but never too long of a wait. Make sure you book a renovated room - and if you stay more than five nights and book through their website you get a 20% price reduction. Any staff with whom I had contact were very friendly and the concierges were very nice about helping me find my way around!

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Bad”
Reviews.Author: jchoolie
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write reviews typically nor am I very critical of most hotels. I do not mind if the hotel is older or lacks renovation as long as there is a clear effort for service and cleanliness. I just read some reviews that said the renovated rooms were very nice - perhaps management should consider only renting these rooms. I stayed in Room #744 for two nights. Hands down - the worst, most run down place I have ever stayed in my entire life and that includes the "broke college" days. The wallpaper was severly peeling, the corners were dirty and the shower only worked from time to time. I was in NY for business or else I would have found somewhere else to stay. Words cannot express - it was grossly unsatisfactory and guests simply should not be put in those rooms. The staff was not overtly rude however clearly there are no standards by which they follow for customer service. If you want to really enjoy your time in NY please do not stay at the Milford Plaza hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: shantravels_10
Reviews.Content: How pleasantly surprised I was when I checked into the Milford Plaza last weekend. I have stayed many times before but had not been there since the renovation of some of the rooms. Altho the rooms are still very small, they are smartly decorated. The staff could not have been friendlier and the rooms could not have been cleaner. And the location is still one of the best in NYC! Kudos to the Milford!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and genuinely OK for the money. Don't be scared off.”
Reviews.Author: 2guys_london
Reviews.Content: I booked this place because we were visiting NYC on a budget and wanted a centrally located place to stay. As we had tons planned, it was literally a place to sleep and shower. We booked a renovated room directly through the hotel website and this worked out cheaper than any other hotel in the vicinity. I would stay here again and would suggest it to travellers wanting a good location, serviceable accommodation and don't have unrealistic 5-star expectations. To summarise - Good and less good points (all totally objective). - It is a very big hotel (over 26 floors). There were sometimes queues to check in. We waited 15 minutes. The check in staff were perfectly polite. - There's about six lifts and never had to wait long for a lift - We had clean towels and new bed linen every day. The cleaning staff were friendly.Soaps and shampoo also provided every day. - We were allowed to check out an hour later at no extra cost - The hotel is a brilliant location in central Manhattan. Lots of good food places nearby. - Substantial parts of the hotel do look dated. That said, so do a lot of hotels in New York. -Definitely book a renovated room... we had a giant flat screen tv and cool furniture. The room was compact, but this is New York so wouldn't expect anything different. - New York is a busy,quite pricey and very cosmopolitan city. Lots of the reviews for this hotel are very unfair. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Martin O
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza was adequate for our needs i.e, somewhere to store our gear and sleep. There was plenty of hot water and the location is superb. The hotel is being refurbed so allowances need to be made but over all it is a good budget hotel for the NYC tourist. The Deli over the road can make good English style tea now too!

Reviews.Title: “In some ways, it was what I expected, in others it was not”
Reviews.Author: LivandMarc
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a room with two beds for a girls weekend at $329/night. Seven days before we were scheduled to arrive, our trip plans had to change. As a result, we cancelled that reservation. My husband and I decided to make the trip anyway, and due to the last minute change - budget was a serious determining factor secondary to location - so Milford Plaza was the best fit. While exploring hotels, I really was price driven when I encountered a "12 Hour Sale" through Milford's website and I was able to book a Queen Room, guaranteed to be renovated for $199/night on Friday & Saturday nights of Halloween Weekend. We arrived just after4pm and checked in almost immediately. Front desk wasn't friendly, but wasn't rude, so no problem there. We barely waited 10 seconds for an elevator and were quickly taken to the 5th floor. Room was renovated as promised. Small as I expected. No real surprises with that. Aside from the scaffolding, there was no other indication that renovations were taking place - we had incredible water pressure and plenty of hot water for our entire stay. My observations: Even after renovations are complete, Milford Plaza will never be a luxury hotel. At best, it will be a budget hotel that you will pay more for than other comparable hotels because of its location. Their attempt to renovate the entire hotel, top to bottom seems to have been a necessary step to continue to operate. However, I imagine the budget for these renovations was under compared to the reality that it may have become. It appears to me that the renovations have been done on the less expensive side and that they're reusing as much of the existing materials as possible. While I appreciate the attempt at this, much of the wood work wasn't stripped or sanded prior to painting and any wood work that was rotting or water damaged previously was simply painted and reused. If I were the management of Milford Plaza I would be upset with the work of the shotty contractors - paint dripped on the new carpet, globs of paint dripping down the walls that was never cleaned up, holes for the shower weren't aligned with the faucet, door knobs poorly reinstalled - just a few examples of what we saw in our room. Whether it was previous water damage or nicotine from a previously smoking room - when the ceiling and wood trim was covered in steam (from the shower) - yellow beads of water would trip from the white and gray paint. Also, none of the construction mess was cleaned out of the wall unit heater - every time it kicked on construction dust blew around and all the chunks of plaster knocked around on the inside. Other Issues: Housekeeping is clearly lacking at this hotel. First, the carpet in our room had only been vacuumed in the high traffic area around the desk and the bed. If you're going to have black carpet installed it needs to be thoroughly swept each and every time. Second, the bathroom trash wasn't emptied prior to our arrival - there were dirty Q-tips, dirt from sweeping the floor and Kleenex in the trash can. The partially used shampoo and conditioner provided by the hotel were left in the room for our use, rather than replaced. Finally, we had no wash clothes - not the end of the world, we used hand towels. My last issue with the hotel dealt with the bedding. I travel a lot for work and strip every bed before I sleep in it. There was no mattress pad on the bed! There was nothing between the mattress and the sheet we slept on, nor was there any extra bedding anywhere in the room. Not having something else between the mattress and the sheet I slept on, knowing how many people sleep on these mattresses every week - was a bit much for me. Whether this was an oversight by housekeeping or another way to cut corners at Milford Plaza is to be determined. Final thoughts: I felt like I got what I paid for at $199/night. Overall, the room was clean - nothing disgusting was found in the room. It has been freshly painted and low end furnishings were installed. It provided a clean, safe place for us to rest our heads in between activities. Given the price of $199/night - I would stay there again. However, I wouldn't pay more than $240/night - and even then I would shop around before I settled on $240/night. Had we paid the original price - I would have been extremely dissatisfied with my overall experience and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: kjtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza was a huge disappointment. We stayed here a few years ago and thought it was great. Nothing super fancy but the value in what we paid and what we got was certainly there. In coming back to the Milford with my husband this year and my parents we recommended that we all stay at the Milford again since it had been supposedly been upgraded and remodeled. What a disappointment. The remodel was only half complete and you could feel it throughout the whole hotel. I'm going to start with my parents room. They checked in to an inside room in which you have to literally turn yourself sideways to get around the bed. Literally the suitcases couldn't even fit on the floor anywhere except the desk at which the desk chair couldn't even fit at the desk it was so crammed. They had a bright red paint on one wall which I'm assuming was their remodel? The next day they asked to switch rooms and boy was it a nightmare. No accomodation to guests, it took two days. The 2nd room had the new flat screen TV and this old dusty wall heater. When they tried to turn it on it made some weird noise and the entire box fell off of the wall. Not only did they refuse to move my parents they sent an engineer up and no housekeeper to clean up all the dust and paint chips. The next day my husband went down and was so pissed to get my parents a third room and they were not only difficult but rude. The third room was fine but the most accomodation they gave my parents was a $100 off their 6 night stay which is nothing considering they had to move or attempted to everyday. Our room was fine. Again bright red paint, new TV and then the fire alarm looked gross and old. Every time we had been to the front desk people were complaining about mold, dirty towels, etc. Our room was also an "upgraded room". The lock on the bathroom door so you could lock someone in but not out. The duvet cover had some spots under it so I opened the duvet up and found huge clumps of dust. We didn't even bother complaining considering how awful the front desk had already been to my parents. When we got into our room late one night the maids had come but not refilled the toilet paper. When we called down to the front desk they said they would send someone up but they were busy and it could take a few hours--for toilet paper!!!!! Overall the only good thing was the location. They have loud club music in the lobby as an effort to make the hotel seem cool and trendy and they painted over everything old in the rooms. They are running out of money which is clear from their lack of customer service in resolving issues and even charge $3/bag for checking your luggage! We would never stay here again and would not recommend this place to anyone. It's sad that the upgraded rooms were worse than the ones we had when we came a few years ago. This was a nightmare hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The location is the only good thing about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scottishloobeeloo
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in a triple room at £80 per person, per night. The location is great if you have not been to NYC before and want to be central. However.... When we checked in, we asked which floor the gym was on (as advertised on the website) and was told the 3rd floor, and was told it is open 24 hours a day. Due to my jet lag, I went looking for the gym at 4.30am. I was surprised when I found the gym, with dismantled equipment, walls with large sections of plaster missing, and the strip lights in the middle of the floor. Needless to say, I did not get much exercising done. We made it to our room after a relatively long wait for lifts (they are on a strange automated system) and we were very disappointed with the room on the 12th floor. The carpet was stained, old and tatty, aong with missing bathroom tiles and a continuous running tap, we were not overally impressed. The heater did not work, instead blowing out cold air and the safe did not close. We got the safe fixed, and they did comoe up straight away. However we did not want to wait in all day for the engineer for the heating, so went without during our stay. At check in, it was made very obvious to us, that this was the only room available with triple status. The website also offered a good restaurant. We did not see any signs when we checked in, but when we checked with a very unhelpful receptionist, we were told in a very rude way that renovations were going on and of course the restaurant was closed. 7am each morning was the time the builders started banging! there was no let up even on Saturday! So we got used to getting up very early, which meant that we did not stay out late into the evening. I cannot decide whether the staff did not care, or were so embarressed by the situation that they tried to block it out. Toilets in the lobby were kept locked and the key kept at concierge. Not an issue, if the concierge were working 24 hours a day, but guess what........ We also asked about a local attraction taking place in October, an annual event for some years, but they had no information. I understand that refurbishment is necessary, however I am a strong believer that you need to be honest with your guests. No restaurant or gym were big issues for me, along with tatty rooms, noise at 7am and staff who were de-motivated and unwilling to help. My advice is to stay at the Intercontinental across the road or another reputable hotel and avoid the Milford Plaza. Also as 3 guests in a room, I would love to know how we were meant to share 1 bath towel! If you do have to stay here, don't pay for internet at $15 a day. Walk for 30 seconds and use Starbucks :) where the staff were really friendly and they are open from 5.30am.

Reviews.Title: “C'mon now!”
Reviews.Author: AlanGrm
Reviews.Content: I think that if you're going to make excuses about the hotel being shabby due to a major renovation, you should drop your prices in the meantime and offer free amenities such as wireless access, internet, breakfast vouchers, etc. To compare yourself (as the manager did) to other hotels in the area that charge for these services is ridiculous. These hotels are in good condition, are not getting the horrible reviews that the Milford Plaza is receiving and are not shabby flop-houses. That management would make excuses for the condition of the hotel and NOT offer complimentary amenities during renovation is a hollow gesture and shows how insincere it really is. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Milford Horror would be a better name for this place”
Reviews.Author: Dorotea W
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in an un-renovated room. Mold all over the bathroom...sink,tub, ceiling and mold in the corners of the bedroom. After much complaining we were moved to another un-rentovated room. 4 people. 2 towels. No bath mat, hairdryer, or wastebasket. Door to the bathroom was hanging off on both sides ..and that was after maintenance had been called in! Ice machines on nearest floor broken and the elevators are the worst. Disaster! Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PetesMrs
Reviews.Content: Having read the awful reviews on this hotel, to say I was apprehensive about the stay was an understatement! However, I have to say overall it was absolutely fine. Yes the hotel is undergoing extensive refurbishment which it desperately needs, as it is very tired, we were not disturbed at all by any noise from the construction work. We stayed in a double family room, which was larger than the same type of room we stayed in London, I was expecting a box with no storage so it was a pleasant surprise. The room was dated and the decor wasn't the best, but it was clean with the bedding changed each day along with the bathroom towels. Check in was really speedy and the staff friendly, we experienced none of the issues other visitors had. The location was excellent right round the corner from Time Square and central to everything. All in all if you want a basic clean hotel at a good rate who's location is great then the Milford fits the bill, if not and you are prepared to pay for it then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bad quality”
Reviews.Author: Peter104
Reviews.Content: A stated in other reviews, the not renovated rooms offer a very poor experience: bathroom not very clean, mold growing on the walls. Very old furniture in the room, dirty drawers one did not want to put any clothes into, and in addition the room smelled so badly that I had to leave the window open all time. On top, a 15 Dollar surcharge for 24 hours internet access is outdated. Even in Manhattan,other places offer much higher standards, a clean room and free internet at a comparable rate to what the Milford Plaza charges.

Reviews.Title: “Flea bitten nag has definitely seen batter days”
Reviews.Author: PaulK1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are closets, linen is dingy, Queen is a full they refer to as "New York Queen", poster board covering holes in walls, literally duct tape holding carpeting together in rooms and public areas, faucet falling apart, the bathtub was actually spongy-squishy, sheet and blanket on bed only--staff said "there are no comforters in New York". Milford looks and feels like a third world hotel, it is way over priced, and my first thought on seeing the room and laying on the bed was bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best!”
Reviews.Author: Mustang1560
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2011 and I was shocked at the size of the rooms and the facilities within the room. We had a twin room and the beds were not the biggest ot the most comfortable I have stayed in. There was a tv at the end of the bed on a very unstable stand and you literally had to do some mission impossible moves to get around it! The air con seemed to be controlled by the hotel and the room was freezing, we had to cover the vents with towels which was under the windowsill and literally within touching distance of my bed. However, the hotel is in the middle of a major refurb and I did ask to see one of them as I am travel agent in the UK but they were behind schedule and couldnt let me in. So I hope this hotel can be a better place to stay as the location is fantastic! The price is reasonable for New York but they are putting the price up for the refurbed rooms so I hope they are way better than they offer now!

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: akehllah
Reviews.Content: First the good news of this hotel:No bed bugs, comfortable beds, fresh clean linens daily (no washcloths), efficient elevator service and wonderful location. Our 2night stay over weekend of Oct. 21-23, 2011 started off with a very unfriendly person at the reception desk....At the time of our booking (August, 2011), we were promised the "web site special" of breakfast vouchers pp along with the AAA rate. However the receptionist refused to honor this offer and blamed it on incorrect information by reservationist. We requested to speak with someone else who also denied our request to honor quoted reservation.... ...after much discussion, we resigned ourselves to taking what we were assigned. Rooms were very small and appeared to be partially renovated by the looks of bathroom fixtures and lighting...However bathroom walls were covered with mildew and paper was coming off the walls. Thankfully we did not need to spend much time in the rooms , as there would have been no place to sit other than on the beds (lone chair in room had to be used for luggage).Perhaps the hotel should have stayed closed till all renovations were completed...Even when that occurs, the rooms will STILL be very small. Be forewarned and look for a better place even if you have to pay more money.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Walktorememberme
Reviews.Content: One thing I can say is the Staff is very nice and accomadating here. However, the pillows are lumpy and too soft. The beds in the unrenevated rooms are bouncy. No dresser for clothes, air conditioner way too loud and you can hear other people around you on the floor talking which kept one person in our party up all night long. Also there were no face clothes, coffee maker and no brochures on where to dine or what to see that you would usually find in a hotels room.

Reviews.Title: “MOLDY MILFORD”
Reviews.Author: calb39
Reviews.Content: We went back to this hotel as it was one of the less expensive hotels in the city with a great location. We had stayed here 2 years before and it was closed for renovations last year. It was reopened this year so we figured we would try it assuming it had been renovated. BIG MISTAKE! Not only were the halls dank, dark and smelly as it has been closed up for a year, the room was horrid. We tries to get another room we were even willing to pay an extra $50-100 per person but they were booked, if you can imagine! We called housekeeping to ask for 2 blankets, never saw or heard back from anyone, never received the blankets either. As to the bathroom, to say it was small was an understatement Small would have been bearable at least if it had been clean. The sink still had the 2 different taps for hot & cold, that dripped all night. The shower would have loved to meet some Clorox as the mold was all black around the faucet and tiles along the bottom of the wall where it meets the tub. The shower head periodically gave you hot and cold water with no rhyme or reason as to when you would get blasted with either one. The best was the wallpaper literally hanging off and then finally falling off the wall behind the toilet. Oh and last but not least were the rusted out bottoms of the door frame, which looked as though they would collapse at any time.... NASTY is a mild word in describing this snakepit! The room itself had 2 double beds, and I use the word beds loosely, they we more like sponges sitting on top of a box top. There were no covers on the bed except for the top sheet, which maybe that way as the "BED BUG" scare through out Manhattan, but not to worry, those bugs have moved on up and out of that neighborhood! We learned our lesson and will not be back at the MILFORD! I don't care if the "THE DONALD" takes that place and makes it over. I guess at $350.00 a night you get what you pay for....It will certainly be worth it to pay more to get halfway decent.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and bad service”
Reviews.Author: boxspacelady
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 1133 Oct 21 &22. I have two rashes which I thought were mosquito bites. I think they may be bed bugs! My stay was not pleasant, old room, poor service. I would not stay there any more or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: brunospba
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nightmare. No better word to describe it. It is old, ugly, smelly, expensive and very bad service. Above all, the rooms are really small, the carpets in the halls and in the rooms smells really bad, and the bathrooms are terrible(small, old, and the water goes very hot and then very cold on its own while your are taking a shower! It is a very loud place too... You can hear people talking in the next room and in the halls, what can make it difficult to sleep there. If you are in doubt about making a reservation in this hotel, don`t ! You can do better with your money. If you already have a reservation, you should definitely try to cancel it ! If this hotel charged 50 dollars per room per night, I would, perhaps, consider staying there again because of its location. But, the rates are at least $250, and it is way above what would be fare for what they offer you. Avoid this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DavidG759
Reviews.Content: Although in a convenient theater district location the Milford Plaza smells, feels, and looks more like a bus station that a Manhattan hotel...totally without amenities and certainly over priced for what was offered. Add another 40+ dollars for parking and this dump exits for all time the "affordable" or "reasonable" price range. A little bit of research will get you a much better accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: dancingmoonbeam
Reviews.Content: No heat in the room! No service! No help! Never again! Pay for interent? Who pays for that anymore?

Reviews.Title: “The Mildew Plaza Reborn?”
Reviews.Author: RussianRiverWineGuy
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza, for years, was our corporate hotel. If any of us had business in NYC, we knew we would be housed at what we laughingly refer to as the Mildew Plaza. The stories from colleagues are quite funny. However, despite its absolutely perfect location in Manhattan, I can't imagine staying there in any room except one that has been completely refurbished. You will be disappointed. My fear is that once renovations are complete, the Phoenix Milford will no longer be the most convenient and affordable hotel in NYC. If you toss your dice towards the Milford, be sure to DEMAND an refurbished room - and, regardless, it will be small,

Reviews.Title: “Barbara P. Awful”
Reviews.Author: ebony719
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the location. The room was entirely too small. We were there 2 nights and there were no wash cloths. After calling for the wash cloths 4 times, finally I went to the front desk to be told they didn't have any. I asked if I would be compensated for this inconvenience, and the manager did take $30.off of my bill. TV cable system went on and off during the daytime. The bathroom was awful small. In all of my traveling this was the worst accommodations, considering the cost was $500 for 2 nights. The only good thing about this hotel was it's location, which is in the heart of the theater district. It is convenient for theater, shopping and restaurants. The curtains at the window was dirty, too. I would not recommend this hotel until they have completed their renovations. Hopefully, it will be better then!

Reviews.Title: “Good just for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Janelle M
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in NYC in Jan 2009. Rooms were small. The bathroom was also very tiny. Had a corner room which had a great view of parts of times square. For the price it was reasonable. We spent most of our time walking around the city and at shows.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Georganne S
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed there this past weekend and we'll never step foot in there again! The room was incredibly and unbelievably tiny!! There was no dresser or chest to put our clothes in. There was a night table with 2 drawers but upon opening them, we didn't want to put any of our stuff in them-ugh!! The room looked to have been freshly painted but that's about all. The bathroom was disgusting!! Only 1 luggage rack and we had to keep it between the two beds so we could move around. No bedspreads on the bed and the mattress was terribly uncomfortable. Next time I'd be willing to spend twice as much and stay in a decent and clean hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tiressa
Reviews.Content: usually i dont take any notice of the reviews written by pretentious princesses, however the milford does live up to every negative review and then some. The shower was a psycho. it would be on warm and then all of a sudden go to boiling point and then after 30 seconds, drop to stone cold.... i understand there are renovations, but the fact that my complaint was ignored... AThe bathrooms were not too clean either - the whole room was crap and the curtains especially didnt hardly close i had to have barely warm showers to allow for this crazy water show. the rooms were a box. barely had room to open our suitcases. beds were old and crappy i am surprised there werent bed bugs. the location is good but i would never stay here not even to save a buck. my 4 nites cost me around 1200 - 1300 for 2 ppl. worst place ever and ive stayed at some bad ones around the world..... big fail ruined my nyc experience - but perhaps i am spoiled coz i had spent 4 nites at room mate grace hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Firemw1
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. Room the size of a bathroom. 50 year old furniture. Threadbare sheets, towels with holes in. Dirty carpet and mattresses. Stayed here 1 night. Never again. Locked out of room at 1.30 am due to malfunctioning lock on door. Had to be moved to a new room after waiting an hour for staff to break into old room. Seen better rooms in outback Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa R
Reviews.Content: While the Milford is still undergoing its renovations, we got a newly renovated room that was quite nice. The bathroom was new and clean and bright, the beds were comfortable, everything was clean. There was some background construction noise (more like white noise) in the mornings, but we were already up by then anyway so it didn't bother us. The location absolutely cannot be beat for the price! One block from Times Square so we got the convenience of it without the noise. The nearest subway station is at the end of the block. The staff was polite and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “MILFORD PLAZA”
Reviews.Author: snugglescat2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed there, NEVER AGAIN!! Because of a convention in New York, prices were sky high $320 a night. The room was dirty, there were finger prints on a mirror that only a giant could do..never removed. The carpet was crunchy..eek, sand, grit..who knows. Keep something on our feet all times. One phone did not work. The BATHROOM..what to say, revolting, Tiles, broken, grout missing. One day no hot water so had to phone to get it fixed. Took 1/2 hour which at least they attended to straight away but then it had to be run to get rid of brown sediment. The maintenance guys were not friendly either. We were woken up at 7 by renovating going on!! No apologies were given or advice before checking in. It was a good job we wanted to get up early and sight see.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe all the bad reviews, this hotel is absolutley fine.”
Reviews.Author: Theplanetstravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milford for 5 nights in October 2011, we too were a little concerned about all the bad reviews that had been written, but we had nothing at all to worry about. We had booked a renovated room, the room was immaculately clean and remained so throughout our stay, we had ample fresh towels ever day and the bedding was also changed every day as well as the whole room being cleaned throughout. The beds were very comfortable, all in all the housekeeping could not be faulted what so ever. The room was of average size, we stayed in a hotel in Paris where the room was smaller. The only evidence of the current refurbishment we witnessed was the scalffolding outside the entrance of the hotel, there was no excessive noise that we wtinessed. The lifts are excellent we were on the 26th floor you simply enter your floor number and the lift takes you straight there without stopping at any other floors. We felt very secure in this hotel on numerous occasions on entering the hotel, security asked to see our room card. On our last day we were not flying home until late evening and asked for a late checkout until 5pm, as this would allow us to another full day in NYC, this was no problem and the charge was minimal but well worth it. We found the main reception staff friendly. The only thing I could fault the hotel on is the in-room safe we could not get it to work, we had to ask a second time for someone to look at it and when they did they did not have the tools to fix it. They said they would return however we discovered the safe is not secured so if anyone did break into your room they could simply lift the safe and walk out. A note to hotel management secure the safe and ensure it is working. Another point to travellers we also had a hairdryer in the room, do not make the mistake I made and moaned about the short lead, I discovered on the last day the lead on the hairdryer was retracted!!! The location of this hotel is second to none, you are central to everything, I timed the walk to Time Square and it took 3 minutes, you are also in the centre of the theatre district and close to 42nd street main subway station. This was our first visit in New York and we wanted to spend money on bus tours and taking in all the tourist spots. The money we saved on staying at this hotel allowed us to do this, when you compared prices to other hotels in the area. My advise to anyone considering booking this hotel, book a renovated room, it cost us less than $100 (£75) over a five night stay to upgrade to a queen renovated room. Save your money and spend it enjoying New York City. I would without a doubt recommend a stay at this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel560
Reviews.Content: located near Times square, bus station, broadway, and restaurants. Service was good. I was in a newly renovated room and there were problems with the toilet and a/c but they were taken care of. Cheapest hotel in the area. They are under reconstruction and my concern was that the staff were not sure where the stair exits were to evacuate. Stair ways were blocked off on the floors that they are renovating. Staff was accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “5 complains about air conditioning no response”
Reviews.Author: Barbanti
Reviews.Content: We are stiil at the hotel, we have checked in the new rooms, but, beleive or not, have complained about the air conditionig FIVE TIMES and non response at all., The air still do NOT WORK properly. The hotel has a good price ratio, but we do not understand why a simple demand is so hard to fix it. Dear manager we are on the floor 24 by the way.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: JoycieAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Location excellent - that's all I can say about this hotel. On many websites they inform you that this hotel had been closed for 2 years for refurbishment. This is NOT TRUE and after speaking to the receptionist they have no intention of closing for refurbishment. The best thing would be for the hotel to be demolished and rebuilt. After arriving we were given a room on the 11th floor - it was dreadful. We went back to reception and asked for another - it wasn't much better and smelt of dampness. On the 11th floor there was a electric cable coming out of a wall in the corridor and it was dangling from the ceiling. The cable went through the facing wall into an ice machine. The net curtains were black and the actual curtains weren't much better. Tiles missing on the bathroom floor and behind cistern. Vent cracked and another just put on top of it. Another vent was boarded off but the board had not been fitted properly. One day I was in the bathroom and heard this noise, it was a brick, from the inside of the wall had fallen down by the board and we ended up with rubble on the bathroom floor. Mold in bathroom, wallpaper peeling off and the list goes on and on. On the ground floor of the hotel was boarded up with scaffolding round it and the other entrance/exit was shut off. We were not informed before we went that building work was being carried on in the ground floor. This work started early morning and you could hear them drilling. The only good thing was that our bedding and towels were changed daily and they were clean. I've never stayed in a worse hotel in my life. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, but sorely lacking in other areas”
Reviews.Author: PDScotland
Reviews.Content: Large hotel very well positioned for Times Square - Subway Station, Bus station etc all very close to hand, as well as dozens of local restaurants / diners etc. Booked on an advance payment deal back in January, for a summer trip - hotel very busy on arrival (seems to cater to large coach parties of school and tour groups) but attended to quickly. Advised that I'd been upgraded to Executive room, which was a bonus. Room was new - flat television, modern decor, clean bathroom with good toiletries - though carpet was dusty in places and one of the lamps didn't work. Finising touches (paint on the bathroom door) seemed odd, almost unfinished. Corridor outside the room matched the room decor, with new carpets etc - though the doors at the end of the corridor were permanently propped open with cardboard throughout my stay. Unfortunately, despite the room being cleaned everyday (I knew the housekeeping worked constantly due to the noise they made and the regular manouvres I had to make to get around the housekeeping carts, which were parked in the lobby quite often), the room wasn't cleaned properly - parts remained dusty and the carpet didn't get vacuumed properly (dust in the corners remained for the week). Aircon unit in the room was also very noisy, and didn't appear to be adjustable Was also awakened a few times with horrendous construction noise - didn't mention this to the staff as I wasn't staying long. I didn't use the bar / lobby area much as the hotel charged for wi-fi everywhere - I would probably have spent more money on drinks / coffee / food if the hotel had comp wi-fi, but gave this money instead to the diner across the street (Smiths) where the breakfasts were excellent. Overall - the updated room helped, though I still think the hotel was overpriced for what was on offer ( I know NYC is expensive, but there are others on tripadvisor that are only slightly more expensive, but that get much better reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby but that's IT! Dirty, run down, gross”
Reviews.Author: Sara P
Reviews.Content: The lobby gives a false security--once we got to our room we saw the real hotel. Mold in the bathroom, drips, missing tiles, peeling wallpaper, etc. The ice machine in the hall didn't work and there was crumbling cement around the bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most of these reviews”
Reviews.Author: cyps86
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website I was inclined to cancel our booking with this hotel. I'm glad I kept it though beause I did not find any holes in sheets (sheets were new each of our 7 days). The room was small but that's what you expect in such a great location. Sure not the newest rooms or facilities but this hotel did not taint my experience of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Milford Plaza”
Reviews.Author: lynn239
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and run down, but we did get a good rate compared to the hotels. Not sure if I would stay there again. Would look for other options, but if prices were like they were last weekend (over $400 at other hotels and we paid half of that) Room very small, but beds were good and had good sheets. We really were not in our room that much. Don't have a drink in the bar. Very expensive. Sardis around the corner was way cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe I payed $ to stay at this place”
Reviews.Author: glvogue
Reviews.Content: I made a two night reservation for the Milford and could only bear to stay one night. Let me start by saying that I do not require any frills from hotels where I am travelling from business, but I do expect cleanliness and some basic amenities. I checked into the Milford two weeks ago. After completing check in, I was advised to read a notice that the hotel would not have any hot water between 8:30 pm and 6:00 am the next day. I arrived at 10:30 pm so I was one the patrons that was affected by the hot water shutdown. As I walked through the corridors to my room, I noticed crumbs along the way and a candy wrapper. The first thing that hit me when I opened the door to my room was the damp, moldy smell. I walked into the room and noticed that there were also crumbs in the room. I decided that if I could not get a hot shower, that I would at least wash my feet. When I opened the faucet, brown water came rushing out. I called the front desk and they said that I should just let the water run for while since they were working on the plumbing. I did not expect any hot water, but at the very least, I expected some clean water. There was actually mold on the ceiling above the shower so I figured I should just cut my losses with the whole bathroom and only use it on an absolutely as needed basis. I checked out of the Milford early the next moring and headed to the Hilton Times Square where I should have started in the first place. The extra $100 that I had to pay was well worth it. When I advised the front desk that I was checking out early because I had a bad experience, I was not event asked about my experience. I guess they are use to complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for travelers and young people on a budget”
Reviews.Author: fayenora
Reviews.Content: Best night sleep I had in New York, and a free goodie bag ... Where can you go wrong? This is a budget hotel that can be booked in advance or at the last minute. We booked it on the day, and there was no experience of damp, mould, or lack of cleanliness in any of the rooms. Bathrooms are well stocked with towels & toilet paper. The security downstairs are friendly and helpful. They retrieved a lost passport and removed a drunk man that followed us home. Staff are friendly and the housekeeping is top quality. The space inside is small, however you are in CENTRAL NYC, surely you won't be spending much time in your room? It is not a top quality hotel, if you want that go to the West Inn just around the corner, but it is 3x as much money. The location, 3 mins from Broadway / Times Squ and Port Authority Bus Terminal, is absolutely fantastic. As a young person and traveler on a budget, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “If only I'd read the reviews BEFORE booking!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne R
Reviews.Content: Where to start??? Well, I'm just going to repeat what other reviewers have already said ..... damp, moldy rooms; tiny bathroom with a shower that blasts you with boiling hot or stone cold water - that's when the shower decides to actually work (the water would just stop for no reason!). I probably shouldn't complain seeing as you are only 5 mins from Broadway/Times Square and a choice of fab restaurants however this hotel is in MAJOR need of a lot of money being spent on it and SOON!!! If people are to be believed and renovation is in process then I probably would chance a revisit but not for at least 12+ months. I've also never spent so much time in McDonalds and Starbucks (a few doors away) for free WiFi - refused to pay $14.95 for 24 hours .... I think the hotel is missing a trick or two! A shame that the hotel was the only blip on what was a fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the hype and bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: WildIrishRover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in september and before we went the reviews of this hotel were awful.We were dreading staying at this hotel. When we arrived we did find the receptionists most rude and unhelpful.The rooms that we had booked were on the 11th floor and we found them to be small (as expected in New York City), but they were clean,decor was fine.We didnt experience any damp ,mouldy or other things as stated by other reviewers. There was no security that we could see at the lifts or entrance but place still was safe. Some of the staff were friendly eg. Doormen and porters.THe housekeeping staff were by far the friendliest there and everyday the towels were changed and rooms were kept spotless.I would suggest tipping the housekeeping staff .If you want a hotel close to times square and cheap and cheerful, then this is a good option.This is not a 4 or 5 star hotel so dont expect anymore than a clean room and safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in one of the new rooms. We have stayed in Manhattan before and are used to small rooms but these are minuscule. The tv didn't work four out of five days, we had to ask for more toilet paper after it ran out in the room, they told us the room had a queen size bed but it was really only a full, and I don't think they ever vacuumed the room once. Our friends stayed in one of the old rooms and they are even worse. Plaster was falling from the ceiling all over the hotel. This place needs more than fresh paint and a new carpet. If you are looking for the cheapest hotel you can find close to Times Square then this is your place. If you are looking for any of the usual comforts and conveniences of a decent hotel, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Find a Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine B
Reviews.Content: My reveiw would be a repeat of the several reviews already posted- mold, dripping faucets, peeling wallpaper, stuffy, old rooms, terrible showers, etc. etc. Bottom line- if you can find a different hotel, it would be worth it to pay a little more and have a better room. We just used it for sleeping and it was OK- I would NEVER want to spend any down time resting in the room because it was so stuffy and not fresh. The beds were comfortable and clean, but the bathrooms were horrible. We changed rooms 3 times before we received one without any mold on the ceiling. The gentleman who took us to each room was helpful and doing his best, but the rooms just need to be cleaned up. As others have said, the location is wonderful-- I would rather walk a little more to Broadway/Times Square and have a nicer room. It is listed in Expedia as a 3 star hotel- I will surely let them know about my experiences and share the pictures I took while I was there- maybe 1 or 2 star at the most!

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla S
Reviews.Content: I visited last week with my sister and neice. We were in a single room with two double beds. The room was TINY. Bathroom had a single pedestal sink. You would think with a room with two double beds there would be a double sink, or at least a sink with counter space. Aside from that, the room was clean although rundown. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We asked for more blankets and they arrived within 10 mins. Overall it was a pleasant stay considering we weren't in our room much. I would like to come back when the renovations are complete because you can't beat the location and price (that is if they don't raise the prices).

Reviews.Title: “Way back in 2000...”
Reviews.Author: susanderek
Reviews.Content: ...we stayed here with our two boys. Yes it had seen better days, and the hallways had 70 years worth of paint giving them a closed in feeling, but we had a great time - the double double room huge, the location a massive selling point and great breakfasts at the Celebrity deli incorporated into the NW corner of the hotel. Ok - so last year's stay at The Plaza was quite a step up (as with most hotels subsequently) but I would hate to think that my first NY hotel has now gone so badly down the tubes as to merit some of what I now read here. Is that 'Open 24 Housr' wallpaper for real?!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Damp, Mouldy Bedrooms and Unhelpful Receptionist. Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolMouse
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. On checking in the receptionist informed us she couldnt give us the double room we had booked & paid for months earlier as we had booked through an agency & not them, the room they gave us number 622 was damp, mouldy, unclean & the wallpaper was badly peeling showing the damp, flaking plaster underneath. A room that should have been condemned! Same receptionist told us when we complained 'that we are lucky to get a room, as it was fashion week' her customer service was appalling. Thankfully a manager overheard us, when we said we had taken photo's & the room was a health hazard & managed to find us another room. This hotel is undergoing a refurbishment, but there is no excuse for giving people these dreadful rooms. I suggest you stay away until the refurb is complete or they get new receptionists!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Edna M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Labor Day Weekend. Room was clean. First time in NYC and had tickets to Broadway play, to my surprise, the theater was right around the corner. A very convenient place to stay at. Near the subway. Many diners, restaurants, and pubs nearby. Time Square was a quick walk around the block. The bar inside the hotel had some fun employees, partied with them one night, they made us feel very welcomed to NY. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Doc055
Reviews.Content: Got there early was able to check in a 2:00pm (usual time 4:00pm). Reeption staff pleasant. Three night stay, good location as not too noisy and busy but only short walk to times square, central park and other attractions. room not bad, clean a bit weathered. Only complaint was the shower in the morning would come on then last about 30 seconds before stopping. wait about a minute then start again.Otherwise its a comfortable place to sleep as thats all you use it for when in New York

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and smelly old decor”
Reviews.Author: Craigwrx
Reviews.Content: Give this place a miss. There are far better around the area. Staff are so rude and simply don't treat you either courtesy or politeness. Building is currently covered in scaffolding. Rooms don't look on to Time Sq like photo suggests - ours was facing brick wall about 2m away despite telling hotel we were on honeymoon. Hall ways smell old and really old decor. Grout around bath was yellow and plughole blocked. The place is truly awful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Junky87
Reviews.Content: Excellent!! Location is fantastic! It is right in the heart of Times Square and Broadway area. Our room size was ok and our bed was comfortable. The bathroom was ok too. The hotel is currently going through some renovations which made it noisy and some things needed fixing (we had a missing grate over an air vent). For the money you pay to stay here you would expect things like this to be fixed, but you are primarily paying for location. We were here for a week and walked most places (took the subway if we didn’t walk) and were very rarely in our room. We would happily stay here again, just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Run away! As fast as you can!”
Reviews.Author: perdigao999
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in my life, and I have been to all continents, including some very poor and "idiossincratic" places. Service was horrible, the smell of mold in the vey dirty room was unbeareable. The neighborhood is riddled with tourist traps, including the electronics store across the street, although the proximity of theaters and restaurants would be a positive point if the hotel was not such a horrible and dirty place.

Reviews.Title: “Milford Plaza...a few years back”
Reviews.Author: rossy53
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of using the Milford plaza several years back when we visited NYC a few times. It was always clean, Very convenient to the subway, ad right around the corner from Times Square and the main theater district. We especially liked their luggage storage area in the basement: very reasonably priced (we had an ariline discount). Guess we'll have to visit it again since some of the reviews are now negative.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent, hotel... Not so much”
Reviews.Author: ND25
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an agent and when reading the reviews on here, it did worry us. But I'm aware from previous experience that some people who put reviews on here do just like to moan and so we decided to give it the benefit of the doubt. The service when we first arrived was reasonable, we didn't have our bags picked up and taken to the room but I did see concierges roaming around so I believe they do it. Our room was on the 15th floor, there are plenty of lifts, no waiting around and they were quick. We were given a free upgrade to a 'deluxe' room as there were no standard doubles free. This was still tiny, dated, shabby but we had a flat screen TV and the beds were clean and comfortable. The air con worked, the shower was tempremental and you either had to shower in boiling water or freezing. Having seen through the doors of the other rooms when being cleaned, we realised that we had actually done quite well with ours so just stayed rather than ask to be moved. Location wise it was great, right on the doorstep of Times Square and Broadway, next door pretty much to a subway. We still had a great time, but this hotel didn't add to that. If you're just looking for somewhere to put your head down then this will suit you but anything else and you're better off going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Choose the Milford Plaza only if you have to...”
Reviews.Author: greenwrangler
Reviews.Content: The Milford has probably seen better days. I would say I felt safe and secure enough to leave my belongings in the room while we went out. For the price, one would feel it would have been a better room. (I have spent less and gotten a much better room but I'm sure room rates are dependent on the time of year as well and we were not looking to break the bank for a two day stay. I also know there are MANY worse places to have stayed for the four bills we spent. Our stay was during "high season". There is a glimpse of Deco left to it. The handrails in the lobby stairs and possibly the elevator cars themselves which seem to have been updated to a certain degree still have a hint of this hotel's possible glory days. We stayed in a 1 queen sized bed room. The air conditioning was just enough to call it air-conditioning. I'm pretty sure the rooms were last updated in the eighties. The carpeting tells the story on that. Don't expect to see much out your window because there is so much soot and mud on the outside. Not sure when the last time the windows were cleaned and I guess in NYC it's an expensive proposition to do so. They were single paned windows and probably the originals. Also, I would say the decor is dull at best. The bathrooms were a bit updated ( from 1920 ) as well, but again, this almost brings it up to satisfactory levels and not much further. They did have room safes so this is another amenity that made me feel like it was secure. The water pressure was OK and we were on the 12th floor. We were there at a busy time of year and maybe this is the only time they were at maximum capacity. I have to say the cleaning staff were friendly and sure to say "Good Morning" as you passed in the corridors. For the four bills we laid out for two days it was not a bad experience. The only cool thing about this hotel is the way you get access to use the elevator. My suspicion is that they sprang for a computerized system that designates what is the most efficient route to get you and any other guests up or down, fast. You use your card key (room key) and slide it through the card reader near the elevator area. It designates which elevator car will come to get you and sometimes we had a choice of two. Check in and check-out were both uneventful and fairly efficient. I rate this hotel at the bottom of satisfactory but it still falls into satisfactory and in addition, I would say it really isn't average either but not bad enough to rate it poor. You're not going to impress anyone by staying here. It was not a bad experience but it is also not one that you write real favorably about.We didn't have a bad experience and believe me, I have had bad experiences in NYC hotels before!

Reviews.Title: “updates required ASAP”
Reviews.Author: summer-of-69-b
Reviews.Content: This place is nothing more than a bed to sleep in and a room to keep your luggage. I stayed here in 2008 & again twice in Aug 2011. Huge change this place has gone way downhill. Smelled, rooms were beyond small, desk service was not accomidating, never saw security, bag check people threatend the safety of our items was based on the size of the tip, required to tip when dropping off bags and picking them up, outlets in the rooms do not hold the plug. If you are going to stay at this place do not expect much. If you get a room with 2 twin size beds be sure it is the one with the bathtub. It's not any better than the one without it has a wall of mirrors so more than one person can get ready at a time (if the plugs work). Both bathrooms are super small with no ventalation. The rates on the weekends are crazy we paid about $150 and the rate jumped to $375 for the weekend. Do not pay over $175 for this place and try for more like one $125. The only positive part of staying here was getting to check in before noon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but...”
Reviews.Author: ms883
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Milford Plaza. First, let me tell you that we made our reservations 6 months in advance and the room charge, including taxes, was an extremely reasonable $225.00/night. Friends who made reservations to New York 6 weeks ago are paying upwards of $500/night. We also were in New York for the 10th anniversary of 9/11. I believe the city was booked solid for the remembrance Keep that in mind as you read my review. I do not know if we are going to return or not. We first stayed at the Milford about six (6) years ago. It was a very enjoyable, but old New York City Hotel. It is very conveniently located to Times Square, theaters and Restaurant Row. For New York standards, the rooms are decent size. Several years ago, the hotel stated it was starting renovations. We were very excited. The rooms need a fair amount of TLC. The bed was clean (the spreads have been removed in favor of the duel sheet process so that there are always clean sheets acting as an envelope for the blanket. That keeps who-knows-when-it-was-last-cleaned bedspreads off me. The rooms are small. This is New York, and after all, real estate is a premium. There are no king size beds at this hotel. Our room on this last trip had a queen bed, straight back chair and 2 end tables and 2 lamps. The room, unfortunately, looked into a light shaft. I could not tell that any renovations were made or underway. The bellman assured us, there were in fact renovations. We did not get a renovated room. The front desk is a short escalator ride to the second floor. When we checked in (Friday night) there were only two people working at the front desk and corresponding line of people waiting to check in. The hotel does not appear to really be ADA compliant. Leaving the lobby, you must walk down a flight of stairs (with your luggage. Unacceptable to me.) The elevators are fantastic. Near the elevators is a keypad. Punch in your floor, and you are directed to a specific elevator car. You rarely, if every share a car with anyone. Once in the specified car, you are whisked right to your floor. In the past, there was a guard monitoring people who accessed the elevators. You had to show a key to gain access to the keypad, and subsequently your floor. That guard is gone and anyone can type in a floor number and gain access to the hotel. The bathrooms have had little to no attention in the past few years. There was a buildup of grime on the bathroom threshold. It was disgusting. I wore socks in the room except when showering. The blackout curtains were also dirty. Ugh. My husband thinks this is a great hotel, especially for the price. Of course I cannot complain about the price, but the grime, in my opinion, is unacceptable. As I stated earlier, I do not know if we will return or not. If renovations are being made, I will give the hotel another opportunity. The location is excellent. There is Wi-Fi available for $14.95/day and FREE Wi-Fi at the Starbucks 5 feet from the hotel front door. There was a complementary safe in our room. The bathroom comes with the usual hair dryer, soaps, shower cap, etc. There was a soda machine on our floor and ice nearby. In the lobby, there is a gift shop. In the evenings, there is a small hotel bar. The servers will pour your drink in a plastic cup “to go.” I do not believe that the hotel offers room service.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dede48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights over the Labor Day weekend. The hotel has a great location in the Times Square Area and we had a great view of 8th Avenue from our dirty window. The room was definitely in need of updating: it was small with bubbling wallpaper both in the bedroom area and the bathroom and the rug was worn. The bed was fairly comfortable but the sheet kept coming out, exposing the mattress (there was no mattress pad). We stayed here a few years ago and we had a nice,spacious corner room. I was disappointed especially because the price was a little high for what we got. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will probably stay again once the re-do is completed and if I can get a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “unsatisfactory accomadation”
Reviews.Author: petrina s
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel "Milford plaza New York" 20th August 2011. To my disgust I found my bedroom and bathroom was full of mildew, the bathroom smelt of urine and was extremly unclean. The wall paper was peeling off the wall due to the damp and mildew. The air conditioning was not working. We changed rooms three times until one was even the remotely liveable in. This accomodation is not somewhere that I would recommend to anyone looking for even a basic standard accomodation. This ruined what was supposed to be a very special holiday celebrating our thirty years of marriage.

Reviews.Title: “Location is all they've got to offer!”
Reviews.Author: Roamin_Mt_Rushmore
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip at the last minute (just days before we left for New York on an unexpected business trip) -- We wanted to stay near Times Square and Broadway. So, we knew we were taking a risk staying here, but thought the location was worth putting up with an inferior hotel. When we first checked in, I thought there had been a mistake. There were sheets on the beds, but no comforters. I called down to guest services and explained that we had no bed-spreads and they promised to send some up. Hours later, when we still had nothing more than sheets on our beds, I called again. - Three attempts later, they finally sent up two very thin and scratchy blankets (one for each bed). I came to the conclusion that this hotel perhaps does not have comforters??? This was odd, but not the beginning of our woes. To reach the elevators, one must take a flight of steps. There are no elevators on the main floor. - Also, the rooms were filthy. The bathrooms had mildewy crumbling caulk on the tiled walls and there were lint balls in the corners every-where.
