The room smelled of damp mildew. We learned after two days, that if we left anything on the beds, room-service would not make the beds. The towels were extremely thin and scratchy. I could go on and on. - However, the one thing they have going for them is location. We were very near the Minskoff Theater where they perform the Lion King. We were also right next to an excellent steak house -- Frankie and Johnnies. Over-all, I'd say if location and price were your only concerns, you might want to stay here. But if you have any real expectations from a hotel other than needing a place to rest your head... this is probably not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room will have me checking in somewhere else next time.”
Reviews.Author: Kris H
Reviews.Content: Upon first arriving in the room, I noticed that the air conditioner was on and the windows (with no screens) were wide open. After closing them, within an hour noticed the room had a 'funk' smell. Throughout the evening clearing my throat, had a little cough - thought it was odd. The bathroom (with peeling wallpaper) smelled mildewy - especially after a shower. After pushing back stained window panels (by the bed), noticed the room-darkening curtains had mold? stains? mildew? at the bottom. Wasn't willing to touch them for closer inspection. My particular room was behind elevator shaft so although it was not LOUD, you could hear them working throughout the evening. As a bonus, there was an electrical power strip with a big electrical cord curled up on the floor with an extension cord running ACROSS the floor for the lamp and tv. Fire and safety issue - perhaps. (I took plenty of pics) Definitely not classy. On a positive note, the air conditioner worked, the bed was comfortable and appeared clean as well as the sink, bathtub, toilet and bathroom floor. The door man (wish I could remember his name) was extremely helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: georgiiiaporga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milford Plaza for our honeymoon. It fulfilled our needs perfectly. We were looking for something cheap in Times Square. We got a great deal and the location was superb. RIGHT ON TIMES SQUARE!! Yes it is going through renovations but we didn't notice and weren't disturbed at all. I do think once renovations are complete that the price will go up, but right now this hotel offers value in times square and comfortable basic rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The most dissapointing part about our NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: nparvez
Reviews.Content: My husbands and I went to NYC for a quick trip through the east cost of US. The hotel service was atrocious. They all acted so stuck up, for what?? Hotel needs renovations immediately. The room was small and very dirty. Carpet, furniture and toilet was old and ugly. I was scared to sleep on the bed because it felt dirty as well. TV seemed 100 years old. Worst hotel i've been to!!!! To cap it all off, we asked for a wake up call - which we never received. As a result we missed our flight to Florida. Don't stay in this hotel if you like good service!!! The only thing this hotel has is good location, near Broadway

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: flamegrille
Reviews.Content: Clean,Tidy and comfortable.. The Staff was extremely gracious and helpful. Will definately be back once the referbishments are complete. The Location is excellent handy and within walking distance to most tourist hotspots and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in our room”
Reviews.Author: Gloria H
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza certainly has a convenient location. The lobby is massive and the concierge service was superb. I consulted with them several times about my anxieties about getting around town and they took the time to carefully explain how to use the subway system and what routes to take. When the guests in the room next to us were partying after midnight for the second night in a row, security was quick to address the issue with them. However, we were most disappointed in our room. Upon entering it, we were overcome by a smell of urine, mold, and cigarette smoke (it was a non-smoking room.) The bathroom floor had a lot of black in the corners and the around the edges of the tiles. The wallpaper in the room was falling off the wall and the mirrored wall had greasy spots on it. There were bath towels but no hand towels or wash clothes and no plastic liner for the ice bucket. My regret is that I did not report my displeasure and insist on a new room but I still doubt I will want to try the Milford Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, no problems at all...”
Reviews.Author: mvasc0
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to stay because of bad reviews I saw. What a surprise!!! The room was clean, towels were new and clean (changed everyday), elevators very fast, and kind persons at the reception. Altough they are in remodelation, I didn~t hear sounds of the works during my stay. Location is wonderful!!! Close to the theaters and near a lot of places for eating.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT SATY @ MILFORD”
Reviews.Author: AmparoBABU
Reviews.Content: Located in the Heart of NY, that is the only good thing.Looks very old, the carpet and the aisle look like a horror movie. When we enter de room on the 19th floor it was..freaky, you cant walk in the bathroom, and event put your things infront of the mirror. The Air conditioner wasBROKEN and it was really hot, we called front desk and didn't get any support with that.. so we stay that night, very noisy we could hear the other people when they use the bathroom or on the aislke walking, next morning the hot water had a problem some pression issue tehy said. we asked for support and they gave us another room to check out, on the 20th floor when we get in...THERE WAS PEOPLE IN THERE..It didn't felt safe for us so we check out and find a great hotel across teh street...BAd Service Ugly Old Crowded...SAY NO!!!!!! and pretty expensive...we pay 40 more dollars to a 5* hotel incredible vie service and great room Stay in August 2011

Reviews.Title: “We'll not come back”
Reviews.Author: AnaAmaral
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Milford Plaza Hotel 2 years ago (august 2009) in our first time in NY. Despite the fact that the hotel wasnt have a nice decoration and not to much charm, it was ok for us specially because of the location and cleaness. So, we traveled again to NY e decided to stay there another time. But, unfortunetly, the Milford Plaza wasnt seem the same for us. Our shower didnt work well, the bathroom realy needs an update, the total price of our reservation was wrong in the front desk computers (was hard to solve this problem!), our floor had just 4 elevators (some floors have 8), but only two was working (in one day none of them was working and we had to use the stairs to other floor). One day we received a letter telling us that we wouldnt have hot water in our room the next day. We complained with the manager and he changed us to another room. And another thing that realy concerned me was about security. In 2009 we had to show our keys to a security employee before we entered in the elevator to go to the rooms. This year there as no security guy near the elevators and I think it is a necessary thing becuse is a very big hotel, with lots of people all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: diana2jen
Reviews.Content: Okay so I made a reservation at this unfortunate hotel. I was exhausted from traveling so the last thing i wanted to do was start looking for another hotel. I checked in went to the room and was immediately mad. There was construction going on and people smoking in the room across from mine making the entire floor smell awful. The bathroom wasnt clean it had hair all over and no applainces worked, the lighting was terrible and i immediately got on my phone and made a reservation some where else. I left this place and went to the other hotel which was incredible (the courtyard Marriott at timesquare). It was truly a dream come true when i left that horrible place. you have been warned if your on a budget which lets face it most of us are dont sacrifice you comfort staying at this place because you will. Dirty, noisy, and overall TERRIBLE!!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great position”
Reviews.Author: raddison
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only for 3 nights, should have stayed longer, great position, walking distance to all the shows and restaraunts and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and convenient, but don't expect luxury.”
Reviews.Author: lightinggrl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Milford twice, and was very satisfied with the location and price. It is a historic hotel with very small rooms and tiny bathrooms, but boasts an amazing location in the theater district within easy walking distance to TONS of fabulous restaurants and is a block off of Times Square, so it is close, but less crowded. The package included a continental breakfast, which was very good. We noticed that there were quite a few international guests staying in the hotel both times we stayed there. I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to friends who can appreciate affordability over luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment in every way”
Reviews.Author: SusanBrown_11
Reviews.Content: Our stay started badly when a young woman at check in snapped "stand back there, someone will call you!" when we approached the desk to check in. The check in process was unfriendly (no greeting, no "welcome to the Milford Plaza", nothing). No one to help with our luggage. The lobby is hideous, worn carpet, decorated like a 70's disco, black walls, glaring lighting, bad art. Elevators slow. Room old, worn, and smelly. Like a hamper full of damp towels. AC barely worked. Old TV, picture so bad it was almost unwatchable. Mold and mildew in the bathroom. Our room was in the back of the hotel, no view, no light. No coffee shop, no room service. No city guide at the concierge desk. Concierge allegedly on duty but either not at desk every time we walked by or so surrounded by guests that the wait for his attention not worth it. Doorman bestirred himself to open the door but couldn't be bothered to take our bags in. Service was either indifferent or hostile. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “good 10-day stay”
Reviews.Author: danpeaze
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at Milford Plaza from 11th to 20th August. We stayed in a corner room, with two windows facing the 8th Avenue and 44th street. It was a decent room, with a dated furniture and a old bathroom, but it was confortable and clean, without any mould or chemical smell. The air-conditioner worked well and there was a LED TV there. We seldom heard some noise from the renovation work. The staff was always helpful and friendly when we needed, in special Mr. Marcelo Col (Brazilian) from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but great location in theatre district”
Reviews.Author: K-Fam_of_4
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here because we were looking for a convenient, reasonably priced place to stay in the theatre district. The hotel is older and is currently under renovation. We were only there for one night (just an overnight trip). The front desk staff was courteous and efficient, our room was small but clean, the price was relatively reasonable compared to other nearby hotels, and the location was perfect. The only (minor) complaint was that the bathroom had a slightly musty smell. Would definitely stay there again the next time we go up to NYC to see a show.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE ...RUN FOR YOUR LIFE”
Reviews.Author: annemarie818
Reviews.Content: There is not One word to describe the Milford Plaza....It takes at least a dozen adjectives to get a slight look into this HORROR SHOW... DISGUSTING...Dirty...Smelly...Smallest rooms...Ugly everything...Hallways smellike urine....Mold hangs from the cielings and behind wallpaper...hairballs in the bathroom... TOXIC...Unprofessional..No service...Terrible staff....Stay away don't even breathe in if your close to it. Checked in , changed rooms and checked out...Spend the extra 70 bucks ans stay acrossz the street at the Intercontinental .....Night and day. Best part of this ordeal was a complete refund from Expedia, no hassles and very apologetic for this totally unacceptable joke of a Hotel...It should be condemned and shut down from the Health Department. Our family's pet name " The MILDEW Plaza...much better suited.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy exterior, horrendous interior”
Reviews.Author: JB2380
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the exterior of this hotel - this was one of the few hotels that had good pricing with a great location hence we went ahead with the booking. Needless to say that the room was tiny, the bed was a twin size (and not even comfortable) Toilet was very small, and I couldn't even fit properly (I'm not overweight either). Rust in the interiors and the room needed a makeover pretty bad. I know the hotel is undergoing renovation, and maybe that's why the rates maybe relatively cheaper than other nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: m b
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - a stone's throw from Times square. But don't expect a view. If you get a room like ours, don't even expect any daylight. I realise space is at a premium in NY but this was ridiculous. I'm sure they have better rooms - just be sure you know what you are getting. The best feature of the hotel is that they have a great (and free) system for looking after your bags after you check out if your flight is later and you want a final afternoon sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wecallis
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza (which apparently is changing its name to "The Milford") is undergoing extensive work in its lobby and on certain floors. However, it does not appear to be upgrading the look of the hotel, but perhaps making the hotel meet fire and building code. The first room we had on the 22nd floor was very small with a window unit hanging out of the window, right over the built-in AC unit that apparently no longer works. When asked if we wanted one bed or two, we thought they meant one king bed or two doubles -- when we said two beds, we got two twins. This isn't Europe, so two doubles is a pretty standard expectation for US hotels. The room and bathroom was very small, with not much space for luggage. It was literally the size of a typical cruise ship stateroom (only without the closet space). The bathroom had been cleaned very quickly, with a dark ball of toilet paper left under the back of the toilet and perhaps half a dozen long black hairs around the toilet, tub, and sink. Fixtures leaked and the room "matched" the rest of the hotel--generally run down. Wires were in conduits throughout the hotel, showing where the hotel had updated to add telephone/cable/fire, but didn't bother actually pulling it through the ceiling and drywall. It was apparent the hotel had tried to update its look, but it did so with some stick-on wallpaper and some thin carpet in the hallways that wasn't installed correctly, so it buckled up. There was constant hammering in another room that appeared to be directly behind our room. Since we had an early AM flight, we needed rest in the afternoon, so we asked the front desk for another room. We were put into another room on the 9th floor. This room didn't have a window unit, but the built-in AC was very loud and took several hours to cool the 12x12 foot room. The bathroom was a little cleaner, but hair was still around. The beds in both rooms were very "well used" and on shaky foundations whereby if you sit on the edge, the mattress would flip upward. This may not be the case in rooms with a larger bed, but as stated earlier, we anticipated having two double beds, not two singles when we request a room with "two beds" (as they were careful not to indicate that "two beds" means "two twin beds"). Avoid this hotel. We would rather have stayed further from Times Square in an updated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “return visit”
Reviews.Author: pghlinda
Reviews.Content: I get to NYC at least once a year and have stayed at the Milford Plaza several times. Yes, the hotel is old. Yes, the hotel is in the process of renovation. However, our room was clean and the staff was friendly. You cannot beat the price and the location of this hotel! My travel partner and myself read some of the reviews prior to our visit and was surprised at the negative responses. Every time we have stayed here it's been a positive weekend in The City. I'm really looking forward to next years trip to see how the remodeling is going at the Milford.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN - You couldn't PAY me to stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: As an ex-New Yorker, I've stayed in a number of midtown, two-star and small, budget boutique-type hotels. And Milford Plaza is positively the Worst NYC hotel I've ever stayed in. I'd pre-paid five days at the hotel with a company card, otherwise I would have checked out after my first night and changed hotels. IF YOU'RE VACATIONING, Do NOT stay here! I booked it to save $40-$50/night for my non-profit but it's worth it to spend just a little more to stay at The Paramount, Hotel 41, The Time Hotel or similar boutique hotels nearby. The Milford is right in the middle of Midtown -- and I had a very nice person help me at check-in, but that's where my positive comments end.. My 19th floor room smelled like mold and I didn't have hot water to shower one morning. The rooms, carpet and drapes were dingy. The "new" elevator banks took forever and one night weren't even working -- and the maintenance and front-desk people didn't seem to care. Customer service was horrible, aside from one nice gentleman who helped me check in. I will tell everyone I know to Never stay here. The photos on major hotel sites are not up-to-date and the only thing that's been slightly renovated seems to be their lobby. I sucked it up and stayed here for convenience but there are MUCH better places for the same price in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bluewater0
Reviews.Content: Good location, good customer service. Houskeeping works hard, so leave tips. Price was good for NYC but still overpriced. Hotel was busy because of location and lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Not renovated”
Reviews.Author: luizCuritiba
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel in July 2011. Had information that the hotel had recently reopened completely renovated, but it was not true, only the lobby was renovated. The rooms are small and very old and dirty. The carpet of the common areas are very bad. Only the location is good but not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!! They also throw away your personal items!!”
Reviews.Author: A-team-Travel
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Milford Plaza on a Thursday evening, with plans to check out on Monday. I checked out on Sunday, since I could not handle even 1 more day of the place! For starters they placed me on a creepy floor, the walls were peeling, the outlets were uncovered, and i was awaken on Friday by renovation carpenters outside me door at 8am! So much for my chance to sleep in. I insisted they switch floors for me minus "the free renovation wake up call" The second morning once I woke up, there was no hot water!!! Once I called housekeeping, they assured me that within about 2-3 hours that we would get back hot water...uggg, sure I had 2-3 hours to waste in a very depressing room. Upon my return that evening, we decided to go grab a late night bite, only to be held hostage by the elevator not working! We were told most impolitely "why couldn't we just go down all the flights of stairs" by the operator on the phone who proceeded to hang up after her rude statement. The last straw was realizing that my medication, which i left on the table next to the bed was missing, where the maid on duty claimed it must of been thrown out. UGGG, take me out of this dump! Needless to say the customer service by the Manager and staff was highly unprofessional when I complained about the loss of my medicine. The manager took part in a very childish heated argument with me, when in reality he should of been doing his best to calm us down. I still have not been compensated for the loss of my medicine, nor was i provided with a discount, despite the whole horrid affair.ess in his opinion that is a good save, guess you can buy your diploma to be a hotel Manager. Never again, will I stay there, surely the great location can be forgone for a decent place that you can feel clean and happy about.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: jcoby
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in., small, dirty and depressing was the only ting I can think of to sum it up. The rooms are very small and dated, the beds was extremely small in which they offer twin beds and upgrades to a full, the bed came with no bed skirt and you can see the worn dirty mattress. The bathroom was so dirty my family didn't even shower for the ONE NIGHT that we was there. The hallways was dark and gloomy as well as the lobby which was hot, humid and dated. The staff I would say was courteous but over all that experience at the hotel was horrendous. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone especially if they been to better or first time in New York. Save your money and find a better hotel if considering, If you stay at this hotel with no choice, just make the best of it, but if choice. I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: alexiachampion
Reviews.Content: I was wary, due to the bad reviews I'd seen, but they were completely unfounded! (I heard no banging, or any of the noises others complained about in their reviews) It's not a fancy hotel; the rooms were small, but clean and well maintained. We had a beautiful view over the city, and the staff were wonderful. The location is the best thing about this hotel and, considering how cheap it was ($190 a night for two people) I certainly have no complaints! I pay almost double that for a hotel of lesser quality in Melbourne, Australia! It's not a hotel you want to lounge around in all day, but it's clean and comfortable, and you're in NYC! You won't be spending much time there anyway! Personally, I will definitely be staying there again when I return to NYC next year! My only complaint - $14 for 24 hours worth of Internet?!!!!! REALLY?

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price but getting a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: RugbyGuy1087
Reviews.Content: We chose the Milford Plaza based on two considerations: location near Times Square and price. On both accounts, we did well. 3 minute walk to Times Square and a price well below what we have paid at other hotels nearby. Be prepared, however, for a hotel that is getting old and needs some TLC. If you are okay with a couple of things in your room maybe not working and decor that is pretty worn, this hotel will be okay for a day or two. Just know this is definitely not more than a 3 star property, and do try to get a room on a higher floor up away from the busy street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever will I stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: robynzechel
Reviews.Content: I dont even know where to start. This hotel was old, grungy, had a musky smell. We did not even get blankets it was 2 sheets on top of each other that had rips and stains on them. We got towels but were never given face clothes. The walls and lamps were dirty. The bathroom has mould in it. It was EXTREMELY loud and the housekeeping woke us up every morning by yelling down the hall to each other. Cant believe how loud it was just inside the hotel. Our phone has no help so we didnt even know which button to press to get the front desk. Picture frames had fallen off the walls and were left on the floor, the beds were small. to get internet was $15 A DAY!! the tv was very old. no space to put luggage so put on bed,drapes didn't close. my list could go on and on. will not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: Garcia41122
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I stayed at the Milford Plaza in Times Square. I knew from previous reviews that they are under construction and there would be noise from it at night. I figured it was worth it to be in such a great location for $200 a night. I slept just fine despite the hammering. The shower temp was a little cold. Other than that, the staff was very friendly at check in and at the bell desk. The room was super clean. I spent very little on transportation. It is a great option if ur on a budget and willing to put up with a little noise and be right near Broadway,Times Square and Restaurant Row. It's all right outside the front door of this hotel.Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine80312
Reviews.Content: As a child you learn if you don't have anything nice to say, you shouldn't say anything at all. Well, because I don't want anyone else to make the same mistake, I thought I should write this review. The location was great! A block from Times Square, and in the midst of Broadway. After that, it was all downhill. This is the first hotel room where I've ever felt crowded with just myself and my suitcase. I read reviews before I booked, and decided to take a chance. Once I checked in, I saw why one reviewer said it was like the Bates motel. This is the first time I ever looked at a hotel shower and thought "I need sower shoes." I won't even go into the peeling wallpaper in the halls, exposed electrical outlets, etc. When you have to make a decision between plugging in the light or the air conditioner, that's a problem. When you have to wait over four hours and 3 phone calls for housekeeping to respond to one simple request (a blanket) that's a problem. Oh, and I hope you're not looking for a clock in you're room, that's a problem. I noticed signs on the building saying they are preparing to remodel. Trust me, they need it!

Reviews.Title: “"Grandma, I'll give you my birthday money if you find another hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: Roresand
Reviews.Content: This was a trip with my 12-year-old granddaughter--her first visit to the east coast. Our train from Boston was late so we checked in about 1am. It was a ghastley experience...the room was tiny, dirty, plaster coming off the wall in corners, with a blinking neon sign outside and curtains not heavy enough to shut out the lights. We sat on the edge of the bed nearly in tears while I called around to find a room we could move into first thing the next morning. We slept in our clothes about 5 hours, got up, brushed our teeth and took a cab AWAY. I've stayed in cheap hotels all over the world and Milford Plaza rates among the WORST FIVE. (And it wasn't even cheap!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Awful Room”
Reviews.Author: markg91359
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the very heart of the theater district in Manhattan. On the positive side, it is also relatively affordable. The lobby is in good shape. Internet use is available for average rates. Guest services or Concierge is above average. The people working it try and do their best, but they are overwhelmed and the hotel needs more staff here. The hotel is also located right by a subway stop and if you know how the underground works its fairly easy to get around all of NYC. The negatives are that the rooms are old, cramped, and dirty. The bathroom fixtures looked about 60 years old. The electric fixtures weren't much more recent. The carpet is dirty. The airconditioning was hard to use and did not work well. We were fortunate that it didn't get too hot in our room despite this. The walls need to be painted. Because of cost, location, and other positives, I wouldn't rule out staying here. However, be warned that the rooms are no place to do anything other than sleep. What is sad about this hotel is that if the rooms were upgraded it would be a real great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.... at all”
Reviews.Author: SuseteP
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New York and stayed at the Milford Plaza and must say my overall experience was not what I expected. We booked a 4 night stay and unfortunately, our flight on the Firiday night was cancelled and we were unable to get into the city until the next day. When I received notification that our flight was cancelled, I immediately emailed the reservations desk at the hotel advising them that we were not going to make it that night and if they could cancel. To this day, I have not heard back from them. It made me worry all night thinking they would assume a "no show" and cancel our reservation all together and we wouldn't have a place to stay. Once we arrived, we went to the luggage assistance desk. They took our bags and gently asked for a tip, which we gave. We went up to the front desk to check in. I explained to the representative about our flight cancellation and asked if they could waive that night's fee. There was nothing they could do for us. We were stuck paying the bill for that one night. Even a discounted price would be a nice gesture. Once we were checked in, we went back down to get our luggage and the gentleman asked for our room number and said he would bring them up. We waited a good 15 minutes before getting our luggage which made me worry a bit and also made us anxious as we wanted to get our vacation started considering it was cut short by 1 day. I honestly would rather bring my own luggage up to my room. They dropped off the bags and the same person then asked for a tip at the door AGAIN. Really? We had just given him a tip when we dropped off our luggage with him in the lobby before checking in. First impresstion: The room was SUPER tiny which I am okay with if it looked and smelled decent. There was an old musty, moldy smell in the room, the washroom was not pretty either. I can deal with small as long as it's clean. The faucet had rings of rust and the water pressure was pathetic. The bath tub was gross. I wore flip flops when showering. The bed sheets were clean but had tears on them. the outlets didn't work properly and one of them by the T.V. didn't even have a plate over the outlets (a bit dangerous). The T.V. looked like it was donated by Goodwill and the cable was static. I mean it when I say it, I do not have high expectations and not picky but I was extremely disappointed with this hotel and would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone. It just felt so dirty and old. The only good thing about this place is the location. Good thing we only needed the place to sleep and freshen up. You want a good hotel in Times Square, check out The Hilton Garden Inn on 8th Ave. The best hotel I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “I shouldn't have cheaped out”
Reviews.Author: markel67
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on price point and really should have dug deep and read the reviews. The room smelled like mildew and bleach and there was mold growing in the grout. I almost went to Duane Reade to buy some tilex instead I checked out after the first night (was supposed to stay for 3) and went to the Sheraton. Don't be fooled by the cheaper price this is one of those situations where you get what you pay for....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Room.”
Reviews.Author: stephonGrant
Reviews.Content: Like make people on Trip Advisor, I was weary about staying at the Milford plaza because of the reviews. So weary in fact, that I called the reservations manager about my concerns and he was fantastic. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because we waited a few hours for our room to be ready, but I couldn't complain because they upgraded us to a family suite from the 2 double bed room that I requested. The room was big, had a couch and plenty of room to be comfortable. The air conditioner was blasting and the hotel housekeepers were wonderful. Does the Milford Plaza need a renovation? Absolutely. But the hotel staff, from top to bottom, was great to us. Concierge was amazing. And the front desk was helpful. My parents are picky and extreme CLEAN FREAKS and I was so concerned about this hotel before I got there that I couldn't sleep. Thank god the Milford Plaza went above and beyond our expectations. And trust me, I am not a part of their staff and would have written a terse review had my experience been anything but positive.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction but great location.”
Reviews.Author: livinlife0624
Reviews.Content: Since the hotel is under construction, there is a bit of chaos and noise around the hotel. The halls and rooms on our floor were in desperate need of renovation, but the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The location made up for any shortcomings of the hotel. Very tolerable for the about of time we actually spent in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch this space! Major refit underway”
Reviews.Author: odeyw
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel and location...just hope the refit transforms the Milford into one of the best! But...Front desk needs more staff.

Reviews.Title: “A no frills and old, worn out hotel, but it is clean.”
Reviews.Author: HotelDeal
Reviews.Content: This place needs a major face lift. They are in process of renovating, but only so much you can do with a property like this. Rooms are small and bathrooms are old, but they keep it clean. Stayed for one night and had a restful sleep. Needed a place near Times Square at last minute so this was best option for the price. It is no frills and worn so not for everyone. Not the kind of place you would pick for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Milford Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: davefaye
Reviews.Content: The Milford is in a perfect location and the price is always very reasonable for the location. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The security is tight and the rooms are very nice. We have stayed at the Milford many, many times and already have a reservation for Thanksgiving. They are always offering good discounts also.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: CCPGuimaraes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is to old and needs a restauration rigth now. It was so expensive for the room that was given for us. Room is too little, we have to jump our luggage to acess the bathroom, The carpet all over the hotel is old and seems durty. The paperwalls seem to fall. We never go back again. We stayed at Sheraton and Wellington on previous trips in NY. Even if I have to pay more I would stay in these hotels,

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: catlover12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonably priced for being in the heart of NYC. Prices range from $99-$199 depending on when you go. We take the bus into the city so the location is perfect for us so we don't have to carry our luggage around the city. The room was plain and simple, but clean. The maid was just leaving and I asked her about bed bugs as I know they are a problem in the city. She has been there for 20 years ( they rehired her when it changed owners a couple years ago) and they have never had a problem with them. I still checked the mattress and she was right, there were none. This hotel is right in the theater district so it is a great place to stay if you are in the city for a show. This is an animal friendly place which is a plus in my book even though my pets don't like to travel. And one big plus- The Shake Shack is right across the street- if you are not familiar with them, they have the BEST burgers ever.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martyn J
Reviews.Content: Local to everything, walking distance from Broadway and Hells Kitchen. The rooms are small, but so are all rooms in new yorks mid range hotels, and city noise was quiet bad on the lower floors. we stayed on 9th and it was ok. the views from the windows are neighbouring buildings, so don't expect sprawling vistas. The rooms and hotel was clean, and the staff helpful, the shuttle to the airport was helpful, but watch the taxi driver and toll charges!! overall a good few days, and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A moderate hole close to Times Squeare”
Reviews.Author: Savur
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in late June 2011. Since my need in this hotel was only to spend a night, it was quite okay. I can`t say it`s too bad due to its perfect location, but it`s defenetly not the good place for family and people with high demends. I constantly felt myself somewhere in a hole :) But location and its price...

Reviews.Title: “This place has deteriorated a lot.”
Reviews.Author: Serenity31
Reviews.Content: Milford plaza I've stayed here a few times but this will be the last. I couldn't get past the hole along with several cracks in the wall, peeling paint, tv set that looks like it was from the late 80's (with missing remote), dirty looking carpets in room and hall, along with dingy looking bedsheets. I wasn't exactly thrilled with some interactions I've had with staff either. If you're willing to look past the raggedy interior, it is in a great location near times square. It will meet your needs if all you need is a spot to drop your bags, sleep and shower while you play tourist all day...but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “When we decided to go back to NY for a holiday, we knew we would stay again at the Milford Plaza”
Reviews.Author: ceear
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza is all about the location. It's a short walk to Times Square and the theatres. The hotel is slowly being renovated. The older rooms are of a good size (for New York) with comfortable bed, but are not particularly attractive. Bathroom in need of renovation, but had plenty of hot running water (once you worked out how to use the shower). The airconditioning is noisy, but at least it works. The older rooms are great value for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “NYC's Worst”
Reviews.Author: bmf60763
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Milford Plaza at 3 am, tired and yearning for some rest. In my first room, the air conditioner was not working. This being the height of a heatwave, a non-functioning air conditioner is not acceptable. I attempted to give a call to the front desk to have the AC attended to, but the phone was not working. When maintenance had tinkered with the AC, he told me that he would not be able to fix it. One bright side was that the maintenance man was very warm and friendly. I was told to wait in the room as reception would give me a new room ASAP. An hour later, having not received a new room, I went downstairs, only to find out that front desk had expected me to go downstairs for a new room. I was given a new room on the 20th floor, and when I tried to open the door, my key would not work. I returned to the front desk once more and was escorted up by a security guard. When he attempted to open the door, it was latched FROM THE INSIDE. There was another guest in the room that the hotel had given me. I went back downstairs, for the third time that night, and was informed that no record of any such guest existed. This is clearly a security concern. How could I be assured that there would be no similar intrusions into my room during the day, while I was out? This is among one of the least secure hotels I have had the displeasure of staying in, not to mention the musky, damp, intolerable stench that accompanies their rooms. The bathrooms are in dire need of renovations, as are their other facilities. One may think that the low price justifies the poor service and facilities, but one would be wrong. For less than this price, one could very well stay in a far better hotel nearby in New Jersey, and still access New York City conveniently. Save yourself the trouble and avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE SUCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: captianpr
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel looks like something from a scary movie. The lobby should have given us a clue. The carpet was old in the entire hotel, with old peeling paint and wall paper.. They were remodeling the outside and inside. When we walked into the room we noticed a ball of chewed gum stuck to the wall, it stayed there for the whole week we were there, so much for house keeping. They were suppost to be queen size beds, no they were full, which were remade each day with the same sheets for the 5 days we were there. I know because there was a blood stain at the bottom of the sheets. The room was small with a 19" TV, which looked like it was from the 80's. The shower kept turning itself off, I finally had to take a bath instead. We had 4 to the room, the staff would only supply has with 2 towels. So each day I would have to call for more towels, if there was anyone to deliver them. STAY AWAY, found another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, overpriced, smelly rooms and no privacy!”
Reviews.Author: ElGrunt
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in July. The stay was to mark the end of our 3 week Canada/USA trip. We saved money so we could finish our trip off in style in Times Sq. The location for this hotel is excellent but that is about it. When I arrived the corridor where our room was was a disgrace. The smell was like a hospital ward and the carpet was old and uneven. There is construction work going on so there were ladders etc lying around. The room itself is very small and the bathroom was a disgrace for the money we spent. The tiles are falling off, shower water comes out in blobs and there were hairs in the bathtub!! Some friends of ours were in another room on floor 16 and had to change due to the smell in the room! The worst for us was yet to come, however,! On our first morning the cleaning lady burst into our room at 8:30 as we were asleep in bed, she didn't even knock or say sorry!! We just decided to get on with our trip but the final straw was on the last morning when we were packing up to leave. My girlfriend was checking that we hadn't left anything in the room. We hadn't left anything, but the cleaners had!! Food and empty subway wrappers from the previous guests!! I complained at reception and received $50 refund but even with this refund I paid too much for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jolahola
Reviews.Content: Nobody will ever suggest that the Milford Plaza is a first class hotel. It is basic. The rooms are small-to-medium. The building is old and could use some renovations (the old carpets for one). Even the beds are a bit old. HOWEVER, if you just need a place to lay your head down at night, and be less than a 3-minute walk from Times Square, then this hotel is for you. The staff were friendly (especially the cleaning staff), the hotel has plenty of elevators that arrive quickly and take you directly to your floor, wi-fi is available (for a fee), and it has a spacious lobby with luggage check-in/check-out (i.e. you arrive early). Overall, we got exactly what we expected with the Milford Plaza. It has no bells and whistles, but overall, it served our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Just say no to the Milford”
Reviews.Author: Ljdu03
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about the Milford is the location. The lobby is very deceiving. The view from our room was more hotel rooms. The room was not clean and during the stay the towel rack fell right out of the wall, thank goodness there were no children! It took the front desk 2 hours to respond to requests. Take my advice and just pass.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodations, nothing too spectacular. Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: heyitscarlo
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I didn't pay much for a hotel in Midtown Manhattan near Times Square and I was getting reservations about staying here after reading some of the reviews. I figured I was gonna be in this hotel to sleep and freshen up anyway so I didn't bother looking anywhere else. This is not the Ritz Carlton or the Mandarin so don't expect anything glitzy. The hallways and the room I was in was pretty dated, but decent. My room was clean and no bedbugs. My lack of sleep was more about jetlag than anything else. The bathroom smelled a bit mildewy but it was negligible. I've bathed in worse conditions. The hot water was superb. The air conditioning in my room was adequate. The TV set was rather old but I barely watched any TV during my stay. To make a long story short, the accommodations are decent. Nothing spectacular and no frills. The location is excellent. You can't beat that. If you're looking for creature comforts, there are other pricier hotels a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of an facelift!”
Reviews.Author: Nicky1904
Reviews.Content: The only good thing at this hotel is the A/C... The rooms are moldy, the carpets are dirty, there is a lack in service (rude maide) and a serious lack in towels and washcloth, missing paper paint in the room . A big big disapointment for our stay in the big Apple! Also, we had made a reservation for 2 queen size beds and got 2 single beds.... Next time, I will pass... It is very unfortunate since I am very easily pleased, used to travel .. But for the price I paid, I find this was a rip off...

Reviews.Title: “Good Price for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: nvstreet
Reviews.Content: It's a little dingy with a "Shining" feel to it, but pretty good for the price and location. It's a few blocks from Times Square. Nice hotel bar. Reminds me of a local dive bar. Above all, LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: andyblueflame
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a trip to the `Big Apple` and despite my reservations about this Hotel from other reviews I can honestly say it was perfect! Okay so its not the Ritz (neither does it claim to be) but considering it is available so cheaply and is undergoing huge restoration work they do a great job. I contacted the Hotel before leaving the UK to point out my concerns and recieved prompt and proffessional reassurances that we would be okay! The entrance is a little old and tired but still manages to feel `Grand` and the check in staff were welcoming and smiling. The rooms again are not bang up to date but were clean, tidy and functional with cleaning and towel change taking place every day plus air-con unit, TV, iron & board, plenty of storage, comfy bed and decent shower in rooms. Having travelled all over the world in all kinds of accomodation including top class hotels I think you would be seriously pushed to find somewhere as good as this in such a fantastic location for the money. I really wonder what other guests expect when they stay at a Times Square Hotel in one of the worlds premiere citys for $127 per night (Queen room)? and again despite other comments during our 4 night stay we had absolutely no interruption, noise or distraction from the maintenance work (we stayed on the 19th floor but heard nothing from anywhere around the hotel). My wife and I would be delighted to stay there again anytime (although I am sure prices will go up once renovations finish!) and would like to personally thank Diane and her excellent team for a truly memeorable NYC 4 night break! Andy (Banbury, Oxon, UK)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: sh314hotel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and the room we got assigned was a complete mess, there were towels everywhere the beds weren't made and there was trash all over the floor. We called down to either have someone clean or to have our room switched and we were on hold for over 15 minutes and had to run down to discuss the issue. When we went down we were told this was the "same service we would get ANYWHERE in new york city". In addition to this, every single person in the hotel would ask for a tip over and over again even if we simply asked for a street name. The windows in our room were all foggy and you could barely see the view out of them also.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again; skanky place”
Reviews.Author: scottybod
Reviews.Content: booked it online, for over $200 per night. The place is near Times Square which is its only attribute. The lobby is grubby, the outside even worse. The hallways have wrinkled, old carpets and stained walls. The room I had looked onto another room less than 6 feet away. The carpet was VERY stained, the bed uncomfortable, the closet rickety and the bathroom needed upgraded. The TV set was old and tiny and there were few stations to watch. One complete wall was mirror to make the room look bigger and I walked straight into it in the middle of the night when I got up to go to the John as there was only two feet of space between the bottom of the bed and the mirror. The room safe did not work and it took two days to get it replaced When I tried to change rooms, I was told that I could not; reason unspecified.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Visitor”
Reviews.Author: Denise-Calgary
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Milford several times from 2003 to 2006 and very much enjoyed my time there. So...when I decided to take my Mom New York (1st time) for her 70th birthday, I obviously chose the Milford. Well - I was embarassed! The room was dirty / the air conditioner control was locked / charged $15 A DAY for wifi / carpet cleaned at 9 am and worst of all.......shut the hot water off long before checkout ! The doormen are fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay & would stay again”
Reviews.Author: marley74
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in a refrigerator, request in advance. There was a waiting list and we did not get one. Our bathroom was short on space,consider taking hang up bags for toliet articles, make-up Nice option--our bathroom had a mini clothes-line Elevator was fast Location and Price . Just can't beat. Safe as well

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sweetmil85
Reviews.Content: Great location in the city but that is the only positive about this hotel. Our "nonsmoking" room smelled like smoke and had holes in the sheets on the beds. We hasked to have our room switched and that room had holes in the sheets as well. There was hair on the floor in the bathroom, the curtain was dirty, and the vent in the bathroom had blue painter's tape on it so it can stick to the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravelGrl87
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night in July and had high hopes once I entered the lobby. The location is in the heart on Times Square which can be very appealing for leisure travelers. The lobby is promising, and they do have an advanced elevator system in which they assign specific elevators so that you're not stopping on every floor on your way up or down. The rooms however, are horribly disappointing. They are small, which isn't shocking as it's nyc. The issue is the clear lack of effort in furnishing and cleaning these rooms. The bed has one sheet and the box spring isn't even covered. There was an old desk with a stained chair that I wouldn't dare sit in. The TV was ancient and the mirrors along the wall were smudged and clearly dated. I felt like the room was very unsanitary and I left 30 minutes after stepping foot into the hotel. I am shocked that there are hotels in the poor of condition in nyc. They need a MAJOR renovation. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Retun”
Reviews.Author: jpirph
Reviews.Content: Stay far far away. Would not return. Check in then in 2 hours had to check out. next door room was using foul language,called security not once but 3 times to resolve. We had a 4y/o with us. Unprofessional front desk. Rooms dirty (found food on the floor) , outdated bath room. Not to clean when checked in. Would not return again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, nothing really good, nothing really bad”
Reviews.Author: prepchic
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this website I became skeptical about this hotel. I had read about dirty sheets and bed bugs but none of this was true. The hotel was actually very clean. The pictures taken by real people on trip advisor mainly tell it all. Overall, the whole hotel is average. Don't except too much. The hotel is undergoing renovations but you can only get a renovated room if you paid full price(about $300) which we did not. We paid $135 for 4 people which was well worth it compared to the high prices in Manhattan. Once they are fully renovated then anyone can have a renovated room. The location was great. We were right near time square and even saw the fourth of July fireworks from our room. We were on the 12th floor and able to get a city view room. When we arrived, the front desk staff nice except for one lady who was very rude with us and we weren't even speaking to her. Our hotel room was average. It was a dated room with two double beds with clean white sheets and no comforter. The room had a small tv and a tiny bathroom. The hallways had an older scent but not a strong scent that bothers you. We were fine with this because we were barely in the room. If three star is what you want, then three star is what you'll get. If you are on a budget you might want to go to travelzoo and book this hotel right now. If you are extremely picky, you may want to wait for the renovations in Fall 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away-- far far away.”
Reviews.Author: SLBuckley
Reviews.Content: Once you get past the lobby, you want to turn around and leave. Follow your instincts. The room, was NOT clean- no bedbugs though and the bed linens and towels were clean and fresh. That is all though. HOLY dust, look behind the furniture and see gifts of guests past. The shower-- would turn off, not lose pressure, but GO AWAY totally when someone else, presumably sharing the same plumbing would start to shower AND the scalding when someone in another room flushed a toilet. No fans in the bathroom, so it stayed crazy hot in there. The main light switch for the room, was also on the same circuit as the TV.... turn off the light-- lose the TV... dont turn on the light, you dont get the TV. It needed some serious cosmetic rehab, mold in the closet, peeling paint and stained walls. The room was small, but I expect that in NYC, so that was OK. The AC was a joke. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent service”
Reviews.Author: dbcme
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few nights with friends. Excellent value considering its location to Times Square. Check-in process was slow but the agents were reasonably personable and accomodating. Rooms were clean and free of critters and uninvited guests (with all the recent reports of Bed Bugs I looked!). Beds were of decent quality and room size is as expected for most NYC 2-3 star hotes. The small window looked into the next building over. It was not condusive of filtering outside air in the room. On top of that, the fan/ac in the room did not work. It made for a somewhat stagnent stay, but not unbearable - considering it was late March. In the summer it might have been aweful. Overall, considering the value I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very old and worn”
Reviews.Author: Aussieostraveller
Reviews.Content: We were shocked at how outdated this hotel was compared to web photos. Furniture was very old. Bathroom tiny and was not clean, hair still lying in shower! Beds were very comfy and clean. We renamed this hotel The Bates Motel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location a block from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: damianeile
Reviews.Content: Read previous travellers reviews and was anxious about booking the hotel but given its location which is super and price which was best around for location we booked. We found the hotel staff very friendly and the rooms were very adequate and clean. We were not disturbed by any noise and overall our experience was very good best elevators around a real customer experience!!! Damian Dublin Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Horrible is too nice of a word”
Reviews.Author: Justt728
Reviews.Content: This place was a total disappointment. The rooms are small and the hotel staff and management are rude and could care less about customer service. We were placed in a room next to some type of construction zone that workers were tossing drywall and concerete down at 730am in the morning. When we went to inform the staff we were told, "there is no such thing as a quiet room in the city." Really???????? The walls were sticky too! The whole experience was awful!!! Stay away from the Milford.

Reviews.Title: “They charged more than quoted”
Reviews.Author: xenon1234
Reviews.Content: I write using a hotel room internet service that was said to be included over the phone. Unfortunately, I was charged an extra $15 for the internet service. Not a big deal, but if the bill were simply $15 over the quoted price, that would indeed be a crime. Otherwise it was a perfectly mediocre stay. Rooms and hallways were clean but not fresh. Windows were dirty. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs modernising”
Reviews.Author: buglet2011
Reviews.Content: The location is great, one block from Times Square and lots of cafe's opposite and along the street for breakfast etc. The rooms are very dated, and very noisy. There was chewing gum stuck to the bathroom floor and the bathroom door wouldn't fit in the door frame! It wasn't all bad as we had clean towels every day, beds made every day, there was a safe and the beds were comfy. It also had air conditioning although it was quite noisy. Double glazing would help as all you hear all night is sirens and car horns. Would recommend it for location and if you dont mind dated decor and an old bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it"”
Reviews.Author: hubley00
Reviews.Content: We had read some poor reviews on this hotel, but decided to take a chance on it anyway. We were very happy with our stay. The rooms were clean, well kept, lots of hot water. We were especially impressed with the staff. Very pleasant, very, very helpful with directions and advice. The location was perfect. Would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid for Many Reasons”
Reviews.Author: smmbottl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many years in the past because of the location and price, and this year were looking forward to the advertised renovations of the hotel. We were shocked to find the interior in much worse shape than two years ago. The room had peeling paint and wallpaper, the rug was stained, and the bathroom was very small. Our room was so small we could barely set up the ironing board, and it did not have an in-room safe. Although we weren't in the room much, when we were there, construction noise was very disruptive. We were awakened at 7:30 AM with pounding and drilling. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: AnasRockworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed there just for 1 night because NYC was full of tourist and we had to go for business. As soon as we went inside of this place we were speechless ...not kidding. Wallpaper falling in to peaces, no A/C (outside was 36 degrees so imagine!!) crazy small room + bathroom. If you close your eyes and never open them while you are here, you may like the place a little bit. The only only good thing is the location. If you are a tourist this place is by all the theaters but you can find a better hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “RUN!!”
Reviews.Author: lynnPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: The only positive about this hotel is the awesome location. I had read the previous reviews but figured that I would only use the room to sleep and shower. Upon returning to my room at midnight, I found that the bathroom window was open. The room had knats and I killed a spider on the bed. The deadbolt lock would not turn and the tiny chain did not make me feel safe. The following morning I jumped into the shower, (eager to leave) and there was NO water pressure. When the shower finally "sprayed" the water was ice cold. No hot water in the sink either to even sponge bathe. The floor was filthy and the room smelled. I actually wished I had stayed in a bus terminal. I asked for a partial refund but was told that there was not a manager on duty for the day. Upon checking out I used the computer to book and print my bus reservations -- you are charged to use the computer. Upon completion of the reservation it was $3.00---surprise, surprise, there was no paper in the printer. It ended up costing me $20 by the time the staff located paper. Trust me, the location and "cheap price of $279 (yes, $279 for a closet with only one bed!!!) was NOT WORTH IT!!!! I needed to stay another night and went to the Hampton across the street for $199 and it was beautiful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location, given the high price of Manhattan rooms”
Reviews.Author: jollytrekker
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you want to save money on accommodation so that you can go to town on sights, shows and shopping. We could not find a cheaper en suite room in Manhattan with this central location and it was more important for us to be with in walking distance of the city's attractions. However, this is a impersonal hotel with zero customer service (we asked twice for the bath to be unblocked and nobody came by). The whole place is tatty, dated and scruffy and we found dust in our room. Having said that, we slept soundly in a comfy bed and were out each morning before 0900 so we didn't mind the cosmetic shortcomings as much as some travellers might. I'd like to hear from anyone who found a better, cheap en suite in Midtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not up to standards”
Reviews.Author: SLIIVI
Reviews.Content: My family and I had been staying at the Best Western President Hotel at Times Square for 3 nights when we fortunately, caught really good rates for those three nights. We were intending on prolonging our stay there, the hotel is beautiful, great location, amazing rooms but when we looked into the next three nights, the rates practically doubled! I was then forced to look into another hotel immediately as we didn't have that much time to really pick and choose. I went through expedia and found really good rates for Milford Plaza. I looked at the pictures they had on the site and read a few reviews and figured, why not. I was very wrong. We checked into the hotel and as convincing as the lobby is, the rooms are atrocious. They looked NOTHING like the pictures, were in desperate need of rennovation, was cramped beyond belief and all in all, just the worse hotel room I've ever had to stay in. We went to the front desk requesting for an upgrade even if it would cost us and they didn't even have room upgrades. Definite disappointment. Honestly, the only thing they have going for them is their location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but ongoing renovation is intrusive”
Reviews.Author: gpas
Reviews.Content: The Milford has an amazingly convenient location for The Theater District and Times Square. It is a great spot for launching your exploration of NYC. Sardi's is just around the corner on 44th. If you want excellent burgers, fries and shakes, don't miss The Shake Shack just across 8th Ave. Our room was plain and a bit tacky, but we weren't in Manhattan to hang out in a hotel room, so it was quite workable. Beds were comfortable and NO bedbugs. The only reason for our poor rating is that the Milford is open during an ongoing renovation which, even though the workers were very polite, was a bit of an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Jennychong
Reviews.Content: Value for money for its location! Clean room Convenient for shopping and other sites Near theatre street Friendly stuff

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - looking forward to the refurbishment to be completed”
Reviews.Author: Ireland1312
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin room that was tiny and in need of a facelift but for the price we paid it was more than adequete. The location of the Milford Plaza is really excellent being one street away from Times Square so as a shopping base it is really ideal. We had issue with noisy neighbours on one night but it was dealt with straight away by security and we had no other issues. We stayed on the 10th floor which has yet to be renovated but I really look forward to returning when it is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews, then look elsewhere....”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveler39
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC approximately 20 weeks a year for work. This was my first stay at the Milford and it will be my last. I'll try keep this brief, but there is a lot to describe: 1. Matress was just worn out. I could feel just about every spring. 2. Wallpaper peeling everywhere. 3. Furniture old, dated, and very worn out. This is stuff I'd expect to see at a tag sale or goodwill. 4. Carpet, hallways, worn and dated. 5. Lobby entrance very oddly laid out. 6. Nonexistent security. 7. Indifferent, weary staff. I expressed my dissatisfaction to several of them. They all apologized, but really couldnt offer any solution. One flat out told me that the hotel was not the nicest one around and that they wouldn't recommend it to their friends or family. That should tell you all you need to know! 8. WiFi is an additional $14.95 per day and the quality is poor at best. I tethered my laptop to my cell and the Internet connection speed was significantly faster. In NYC, in this day and age, this is an expected amenity for a business traveler, not a luxury. Extremely poor. 9. Tv is a 19" Zenith circa 1980??? WAY out of date. 10. AC unit could barely keep the room cool 11. Bathroom very dated and not clean. In defense of the cleaning staff, it seems as if they try, but like any older porcelain fixtures, these have reached a point where they can no longer be effectively cleaned. Grout lines in the tile are dirty, etc. It looks as if a renovation was tried at one point perhaps, but it was a half hearted job at best. 12. Paint work is terrible. Door trim has been recently painted perhaps, but they didn't bother to prep any of the surfaces. New paint was simply applied over old layers of peeling paint. 13. Only 3 outlets in the room. All behind furniture and low to the floor. 14. Convenience/gift shop in lobby closed at odd times with a be back later sign in the window. I know, I'm in NYC, I could get anything I wanted on the corner. However, sometimes I just want to get a diet coke or cup of coffee without going out in the rain. Also, the clerk couldn't take any cards because the cc printer was out of paper and there were no spares rolls in the store. This condition has been going on for two days. 15. Coffee. Really? No complimentary coffee? Anywhere? Makes me wonder if the management of this hotel has ever stayed in another hotel ever before? I'm sure there is something that I missed, but that should paint a good picture for you. Sorry to be so negative, but this is one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had. I travel for a living. I spend 200 nights a year in hotel rooms. This is hideous. Please stay away until the mgmt here rectifies these issues. Based upon other reviews here, the mgmt will likely respond with a canned letter below. I really don't expect anything else. For the record, my dates of stay were 6/9/11 to 6/12/11 in room 1630. My observations are based upon what I experienced in this room, but other guests expressed similar dissatisfaction with their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gina092
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 7 days at the Milford. I have no complaints... the location of this hotel is great. if you are using the double decker bus to sight see. it stops almost out front. we saw many broadway shows and all were 3-4 minute walk from this hotel. I could see Time square from the hotel window. we had a queen bed with two windows. the room was clean. The staff was helpful. this is a budget hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Bkwant
Reviews.Content: I, unfortunately, was booked into the Milford for a short business trip to NY. I can only say the experience was simply awful..The hotel is nowhere near expected basic standards in hygiene, general upkeep or facilities to warrant the room charge. I would suggest avoid the hotel at all costs. And if the management cared about the hotel's reputation during the, so called, expensive renovation, close the hotel until some level of acceptable standard of hygiene, cleanliness and acceptable decor can be reached. I am not planning to return anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational location, very average hotel at a rather high price”
Reviews.Author: Madcatty
Reviews.Content: We booked late and over a weekend so we copped it price wise when this was the only hotel available for less than $300 a night close to the action. They are refurbing slowly which will make a huge difference. The location is just perfect righ in the show area and right on times square, also right next to subway. Very small room with small double bed, rattly air con and below average bathroom. Corridors rather average and staff average as well. We had a brilliant time in new York city, and for somewhere to sleep this is fine, but not value for money for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC hotel if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: frenchy32034
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February and found it to be a great hotel for the budget minded traveler. I have stayed in New York City many times and know first hand that if you are on a budget, find a convenient, clean hotel can be a challenge. The location of Milford Plaza is right near Restaurant Row and is in the heart of the Broadway theatre district. The lobby is attractive and the staff were courteous and efficient. The room itself was small but very clean. The furnishings were clean but not brand new. There was a problem with the sink, but it was fixed after we called down to the front desk to report it. I got the impression that management was vigilant (I mean that in a good way) and for the few questions I had, there was always someone available to answer them. For the price we paid (less than $150 a night), it would be unreasonable to expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting room and shower”
Reviews.Author: Evaluated11
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in! The room smelled horrible, and the bathroom looked filthy. Everything had a damp feel to it. Room was by the elevator and very noisy. When I woke up from sleeping in what felt like a 100 year old bed, I found out the shower did not even work! I had to pack up my stuff, go to the lobby and demand a new room so that I could shower. The unfriendly staff sent me to a different one, and the water was only lukewarm. Even worse, the drain was clogged with what seemed to be hair and filled with water as I showered. Despite all the trouble, they wouldn't even give a 10% break on the price. I would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay for Price Paid”
Reviews.Author: Chuckalena
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milford Plaza while doing the Contiki New York-New York Tour. The Hotel is centrally located and is a short walk to Times Square and Central Park. The room I had was tiny, but I guess it would be average based on New York Hotel Standards. Bathroom and furniture were old, but I was fortunate to get a room with a great view of the lights of Times Square. If you were looking at budget but well located hotel - then I would recommend staying at the Milford Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “ultra convenient, pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: PattyIfftAnderson
Reviews.Content: After reading many bad reviews of the Milford Plaza, I was skeptical to stay there. Upon arrival, I was so relieved. The location was perfect, one block from Times Square, a walk across the street to a subway stop, it felt really safe. The elevators were fast, and the staff was very helpful. The room was small, but completely clean and adequate! It served my needs really well. Great hot water pressure, and sleeping was -eerily- quiet. I brought earplugs and never used them! I didn't need a restaurant on premises as there was plenty of food nearby. As a home base, a place to crash, it was great. I will definitely stay there again. I'm excited for them to finish their renovations, what I saw looked great!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Zac2011
Reviews.Content: The bed base and mattress were stained the wash basin did not retain the water the room was over looked and the curtains would not close the toilet area was dirty with a rusting radiator in it I under stand the hotel is beeing refurbished during 2011 I would recomned travelers to check they are getting a refurbished room or wait until 2012 to visit the Milford Plaza My wife and I have visited New York previously the Hotel rooms have been small but spotlessly clean

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not worth it -- no matter the price”
Reviews.Author: Chi_Road-Tripper
Reviews.Content: The loud, blasting club music in the lobby upon arrival ("for ambience") was the first sign that we had made a bad choice. When we got to our floor, "The Shining" came to mind -- old, filthy uneven carpet, doors with stripped wood, dirty walls. Thankfully, the horrible odor we expected in our room, based on the hallway, was absent and the bed sheets looked clean. But the carpet was awful and the "couch" was old and dirty and had both stains and a huge rip in it. When the manager was told, he refused to believe it. We had to send a picture to get a 50% refund on our next night -- as we were out of there. When we came back to the room to pack up and leave, we noticed that someone had flipped the suspect cushion and removed 1 pillow -- as if that addressed our concerns! We found a Holiday Inn in a less convenient location (Soho), but a train ride away from Times Square. Whatever you pay at the Milford, it's not worth it. The place is a dive.

Reviews.Title: “Run don't walk away from The Milford Palza”
Reviews.Author: SuperBeau
Reviews.Content: I was horrified at the condition of The Milford Plaza. Upon arriving they informed us their would be no water usage in our room from 10:00am-4:00pm. Upon openning the door to our room the smell was overwhemling of mold and chemicals. The TV was small, the carpet was very old, and furniture was falling apart. The walls were dirty and pealing paint. The bathroom was small, cracked tiles and very old tub. The hotel is in the middle of renovation. Did not even have a public restroom in the hotel to use. They did not offer any coffee n room or out. We were never told about the renovation at time of booking. We paid top dollar to stay in this location. There are plenty of hotels around to choose from. Until they get this hotel up and running after the renovation do yourself a huge favor and stay away. It's a Dump!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice of hotels!”
Reviews.Author: mkozich
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Milford Plaza with three friends. We were very pleased at our choice of hotels. All of the staff, from the doorman to the conceirge, were extremely helpful. Our room was exact to our expectation and satisfaction. We were thrilled about the convenient location of the hotel to so many places we wanted to see. It was perfect! I know where I'll be staying on my next visit to The Big Apple - Milford Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, it's not the Ritz, but really!”
Reviews.Author: effieclyde
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times before, so I knew not to expect the Ritz. However, in my room I found: - no clock radio - no ironing board - no bedspread, only one thin blanket covered by a sheet - no washcloths - a moldy smell - a tiny red lace thong, on the floor at the foot of the bed I called, and Housekeeping brought me the radio, two washcloths, two blankets -- and the small fridge I'd asked for. No place to put the fridge except on the dresser that also held the TV. No desk or chair, just a small armoire and night stands. I was planning to ask for a better room the next day, but I discovered that this one was quiet and the shower worked very well, so I decided to stay put. There ensued a struggle over washcloths -- the used and unused ones both disappeared the next day, not to be replaced for two days, despite requests. When I did get one, I hid it in the armoire each day, and this took care of the problem. The moldy smell came and went. I bought some flowers, which helped. To the good: at very few hotels will the housekeeping staff actually let you alone when the Do Not Disturb sign is up, waiting until midday to clean your room. I appreciate that. The wi-fi worked well, no problems with the ancient TV. When I needed help printing out theater tickets, the desk staff did this for me without charge. The location can't be beat, if the reason you're in NY is to go to the theater. Also close to all subways, so Museum Mile is not far, nor is the Village, etc. To find places to eat, I suggest going to Open Table, asking for Theater District or Hell's Kitchen, choosing your price range, and taking it from there. Would I go back to the MP? Yes, but only with a renovated room. And I hope they bring back their Club Level, or whatever they called it. I loved having the lounge and snacks around. They do need more staff available, esp at night; to schedule a wake-up call, I had to go down to the front desk as that button on the phone didn't work -- nor did several others. And the tiny red thong? I left it in the room, for the next guest to contemplate.

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful joint, no regard for customer experience”
Reviews.Author: dkatz1
Reviews.Content: Tiny room, furnished with one hardbacked chair one lamp one bedside table and a useless dresser w/ 2 drawers. No hotel info, brochures, coffee pot. Ice bucket but no ice machine anywhere. Bloodstains on the ceiling.Well, could have been rust, coffee or snot. No faceplate to electrical outlet. One tiny glass shelf in bathroom designed so stuff falls through it into sink. Old TV w/ bad reception. Not even an attempt at Bad Hotel Art in the hall. No desk or table in the room. ONE HARDBACKED CHAIR and NO TABLE OR DESK !!! It boggles. This hotel isn't even phoning it in.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Deena_Deena
Reviews.Content: The room was sooo small that after bringing inside two suitcases we had no space at all, like could only walk two steps in our room and im not joking ! They didi clean sheets and room every day but bed sheets were so old that had permanent yellow stains on them... Stuff was helpful and nice , the location was good-just few blocks to Times Square but still I would never stay there again and im not a picky person.In general very uncomfortable and old hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzymt
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews before I went( from horrible to pretty good) so I had mixed expectations, but went anyways because it was a great price. The front desk was great- very helpful and very friendly. I say this because I had an issue with my credit card but they handled it very well. I had a corner room and it was a decent size. I was expecting something I could barely turn around in but that was not the case at all. The rooms were VERY clean! I made an immediate inspection of EVERYTHING- yes, including bed bugs (eeew!) but I found nothing. The bathrooms were spotless (I travelled with flip flops to wear in the shower just in case it was not up to my standards but I never had to use them once).
