Everyday housekeeping came and they did a great job. Now, yes the hotel looks outdated pretty much everywhere. They were doing some rennovations though. No, there are not the most modern things at every corner. But if you're looking for a great location, clean friendly comfortable hotel and a great price- I highly recommend this hotel. I was there for 7 days and never had an issue. I did not use their internet and I did not make any calls so I cannot say anything about that. NOTE: there was NOT an alarm clock in room. I ended up using my cell phone the whole time but it was fine. Also, there are not many drawers ( I had one unit with 2 small drawers) but there is a closet with hangers. There was also a nice sized desk that I used to put my stuff on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: joannesow
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and 2 children (aged 9 & 6) stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and we couldn't have been happier with our choice. It is literally around the corner from Times Square and sightseeing tour bus goes right by the hotel. The hotel is undergoing a bit of a facelift at the moment but we stayed in a room that had not been refurbished yet and it was still clean and tidy with maid service every day. Could not fault the hotel and the restaurant across the street, Charlie O's does a great steak! AVOID SMITHS BAR AND RESTAURANT LIKE THE PLAGUE - we had 1 meal there which we all left virtually untouched and we paid $70 for the priviledge! Will definately go back to the Milford Plaza again. TOP TIP - go to see Mary Poppins at the New Amsterdam theatre - we all loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we only stayed one night!”
Reviews.Author: Em_J4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milford Plaza for one night prior to visiting family elsewhere in New York. Thank goodness we were only here for one night! Other than the great location, there was a long list of why I would not return to this hotel. When we arrived, we found the staff quite abrupt and unhelpful. It was quite busy in reception so maybe this is why they hurried to check us in and give us a key - no mention of where our room or the lifts were located or how to use the unique lift system (meaning that we went up and down twice before getting to our floor). The room was an OK size with 2 double beds which were fairly comfy, however, within 5 minutes I had scraped my leg on one of four metal bars which were sticking out the side of my bed! Surely that is unsafe and would not be allowed in the UK! A child could easily injure themselves badly. I just had a bruise! Other issues we faced included no batteries in the TV remote control! Shower worked on and off. Safe would also not work. No additional bedding was available and we found the thin duvet quite cold in the night. Generally, the room was very old and felt quite dirty with mould in various places. The corridors and public areas were pretty much the same and in serious need for renovation. The ice machine for our floor was also out of order! Overall, we felt that we had paid more than we should for this, even given the great location. This hotel needs some serious work and investment!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelonholiday
Reviews.Content: The alarm bells starting ringing when I checked in when I was told my entire stayed will be charged right there and then. I was not informed of this policy when I made the reservation. Anyhow, went up to the room on the 18th floor, first impressions was that this hotel is stuck in the early 1980s. Furnishing very dated, especially the bathroom. Also, there seems to be a problem with the bath tub hot water tap. It heats up within seconds, and I found it very dangerous to touch especially when turning off the water tap after a shower. There was also hot water leaking from the tap while it is in use. The bath room also looked like it needed a good scrub. TV was fuzzy and only had a few TV channels. The only good thing going for this hotel was there the housekeeping staff does a great job, the rooms are always clean, and the bed sheets had no bedbugs. However, I can’t say the same for the porter service. When I was ready to check out, I called the front desk for luggage assistance, but after ten minutes nobody came. So, in the end, I just rolled my luggage to the lobby level by myself. Quite troublesome, as I had three large suitcases. (I was travelling with one other person) The in-room Internet access charges were about US15 per day but as I did not expect to be in the room for most of the day I decided go without internet access. However, this hotel also has desktop computers with internet access going at a rate of $0.25 a minute, minimum $5 in the hotel lobby. I did use this to check my emails every other day. While doing my research for this hotel, I found out that they plan to rent out their renovated rooms in Jun 2011. However, when I checked out of this hotel in the first week of May 2011, it looked as though no renovation work had been done. Personally, I would not stay at this hotel again even though the rates are comparatively cheaper then other hotels in the area. Also, based on the fact that this hotel charged my credit card for the entire stay upon check-in, without prior warning and that this hotel is just sooooo old. One final note, if you do decide to stay in this hotel, avoid making calls using the room’s telephone. I made 3 local calls, each lasting no more than 60 seconds, and was charged US$3.75 when I checked out. This may be the standard rate of all NY hotels. I don’t know.

Reviews.Title: “Good on price but not much else”
Reviews.Author: HDC83
Reviews.Content: Things I liked about the hotel: it was affordable, central and had all the basics - clean (but small) beds, a decent shower and a working TV (which looked about 20 years old). I wanted somewhere convenient which would leave me enough money to enjoy the city, so this suited my needs. Having said that, next time I would shop around and try and get somewhere a bit quieter. We were in a room that adjoined (via a locked door) another room, and we could clearly hear everything they said to each other, even though they were talking at a normal volume. When guests are flying in from all over the place and suffering from jetlag, this is a problem - the couple next door woke up at 5am and unfortunately that meant that we did too. The soundproofing was so bad, they could have been in the room with us. Our safe didn't work, but a nice member of staff came and fixed it for us. The furniture was very basic and rather old, and there was mould on the bathroom ceiling. I don't regret my stay there, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who's a light sleeper - or anyone who wants more of a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good value”
Reviews.Author: erikpvd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through the Air Canada website in order to get Aeroplan points. Actually, this hotel wasn't, but the Hotel Thirty Thirty was. We arrived in New York and went to the Hotel Thirty Thirty in order to check-in. When we got there, everything seemed normal through the first couple of questions until the reception agent told us that due to renovations they didn't have a room for us. As a result, they'd be giving us a letter to another hotel for us to go to for accommodations. That hotel was the Milford Plaza. The Thirty Thirty gave us $10 for a cab but we pocketed the cash and walked the several blocks to the new hotel. Upon arrival, the staff were friendly and amiable. It took a few minutes to get our reservation made up, during which the staff chatted us up. We were promised "the best room they had", but I think that's just a standard line. The Room: "Cozy" would be the best euphemism to describe this room. "European" would be another. It was perfectly apportioned to hold the TV and stand, bedside table, armoire and double bed. A larger bed would have made the room unworkable. Also, the "best room" didn't really have much of a view, though a look out to the side showed the buildings around Times Square. I had heard that the hotel was undergoing renovations and, based on what I could see in other rooms, it was clear that this was the case. Ours, however, had not been redone. The bathroom, vis-à-vis the rest of the room was small but decent. A full-sized tub and shower, along with sink, toilet and radiator, as well as a window were fit nicely in there. Amenities: A kind of strange twist to the atmosphere was the techno music piped into the lobby. I believe the eventual goal with the reno is to have a more trendy hotel and bar (that had yet to open). The elevators were kinda cool with the new system whereby you press your desired floor and it tells you which elevator to go to. Kinda takes the guesswork out as to which one will open when there are 8 elevators. Also, it means that rarely are you on an elevator with anyone else. There were two computers near the reception desk with internet access for a fee (25¢/min with a $5 minimum), however the ability to use the computers to check-in for your flight online was provided for free. Location: At 8th Ave and W 44th St. Extremely close to Times Square (though, unless you love crowds, I'm not sure why you'd go there). A subway stop is literally across the street serving the A, C and E lines and several others are only a block away. The PA Bus Terminal is two blocks south and Penn Station/MSG is about 10 blocks to the south, with Amtrak and NJ Transit connections to Newark Airport. As for anything else, you're in Manhattan. Anything you want is nearby. Summary: We got the Thirty Thirty for a pretty good rate (around $200) for the night. That looked to have been a nicer room so I wouldn't pay that much to stay at the Milford, at least in the room we got. But, it is Manhattan and anywhere is going to be somewhat pricey. A small room and a springy bed and only one pillow each left me with a desire for a bit more than what we got. However, if your purpose is to spend as little time in the room as possible, it's probably a decent value. Just don't bring any large suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, shame about the hotel !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: seasider050
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a brilliant location just off time square, (saw Mr Big from sex in the city he is in the theater just around the corner) hotel is very outdated and has building works ongoing inside and outside the hotel, go in with a open mind and you wont be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: letbob
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by stating that the location is great for access to Times Square, great restaurants and theatre district. Cannot choose a better home base. If you want anything in a room, forget this place. Long check in, A/C didn't work, rooms that were so small we could hardly find a place to drop the luggage. That's NYC on an average budget, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mamamia810
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milford Plaza for 6 nights with my children, 8 and 10. Really loved the hotel. Best location, rooms were older, but clean, staff was very nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: DavoandLoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights of a 4 night NY trip - so close to Time Square and we got rooms cheap (compared to the rest of NYC) through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Awesone location but average hotel...”
Reviews.Author: misstbk
Reviews.Content: I just got back from NYC for the Easter weekend and some friends and I have stayed at the Milford for 5 nights. We were on the 5th floor. Here's my review: Hotel: The location is great!! Just a block away from Times Square. I loved the look of the hotel... Vintage style, great lounge/house music playing in the lobby (too bad the lobby bar was still not opened yet). The hotel was still in reparations... Room: Clean, but very small... We had two full size beds. I peaked into other rooms with single beds and it was twice as small as ours... The shower worked fine but we had issues if someone from an adjacent room used theirs at the same time. Bring ear plugs if you have a light sleep because 8th Ave is a very busy street and the windows are not really soundproof. Service/staff: Nothing to complain, it was really fine. Overall: Good hotel but not the best. I would go back for 2 nights max. The location is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “basic with no thrills”
Reviews.Author: CatmanLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid March for 5 nights on a New York stop over, I wanted a hotel close to Times Square and near a subway station for a decent price. Not planning to spend much time in the hotel apart from taking showers and sleeping so the Milford Plaza was right for me. I was allocated a room on the 16th floor with a queen bed ,and although the room was a bit tatty the bed was comfortable, the sheets clean, and the shower hot. Didn't see much in the way of renovation taking place but the frontage on 8th avenue had scaffolding around it. All in all after reading other reviews prior to staying I wasn't expecting much but my stay there met my expectations without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory base - no frills but adequate”
Reviews.Author: mddicks0n
Reviews.Content: We were only in the rooms to sleep in and the beds were clean and comfortable. The service was pleasant too at both reception and concierge. Had we stayed longer, or wanted 'down time' in the hotel this might have dampened our satisfaction - the noise is unrelenting in NYC and this didn't feel too different in rooms - from the streets, the room next door, the corridor etc. The bathrooms were disappointing, being very tired and the with fixtures and fittings the worse for wear. Overall though - we wanted to pay a low price for the City and the Milford Plaza is reasonable and the location is perfect. As long as your expectations are appropriate this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Old but sufficient.”
Reviews.Author: dwalton9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old (as is much of New York) but the location was perfect for us. The price was comparable to others like it. The bed was comfy and clean and the pillows were good too. Once we understood how the shower worked it was good too. The staff was very friendly and we always felt safe. It was close to Broadway and Times Square which is what we were looking for. If you want a place to sleep and are not looking for anything more this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH IT AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Tochesjoe
Reviews.Content: It is too expensive for the money, it is like a cheap motel outside any town, does not even offers shampoo in the bathroom, and the beds ( if you can call those beds) are more like cod beds. In one word, the rooms are in very poor, dirty and in cheap conditions. We were planning to stay a week because we saw pictures of the hotel and the outside of it with the lobby looks nice plus the location is good, but after seeing the room and staying one night, we move to the New yorker which is same price but no comparison at all, that's where your money is worth for.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the location, nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Rwhitman05
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel in April 2011 for a vacation after a stressful winter, and this hotel had done nothing to alleviate it. Albeit, check in was quick, but since it was a gift, our four night hotel stay, we had to jump through hurdles, and hoops to find out what we had to do to get a hold (which the card used was not ours but a friend's) off of our credit card. We then get to our small room and there's a rank smell of mold in our room, we tell the hotel staff, and nothing was done by the time we left. Shower was alright at best, the housekeeping staff came in at 7am everyday, didn't knock, nothing. The Internet was 15 dollars per 24 hours. Times Square has free Internet and we basically went there all the time. Buyer beware, of the Milford Plaza NYC.

Reviews.Title: “It's an OK Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Fernandez
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 days I think, then I moved to another one. It's an OK hotel (for the price), you get what you pay for. Very Friendly Staff. Beds and pillows are ok. Quite a mess in the morning - too busy. You need to pay to use the internet service! I've stayed at so many hotels and this is the first one who charges me to use the internet and it's quite expensive. Bathroom are just horrible! The shower does not work properly at all, it's really annoying trying to get a good shower after a busy day, I don't know if they are working on it but I've stayed at two different rooms at this hotel, and the same problem. Not a good place to have a quite sleep after all, you can hear everything @ your next door! I was up the 20th floor and I could listen to people arguing and having sex and the tv. For the money, you get what you pay for and you stay more time outside than inside, still you always want a nice and quite night/morning after a busy /party day. Just don't expect too much for this hotel. The location is fantastic, but if you are able to pay a little bit more I would definitely try to find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff goes Above and Beyond to Please”
Reviews.Author: GailandBob
Reviews.Content: We were unhappy, at first, with our room and were changed to a larger and more comfortable area. Deficiencies in the room were corrected by a polite, supportive and knowledgeable engineering staff. Manager and parking staff were also pleasant and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Barely worth the prime location”
Reviews.Author: mcbeatzthebopit
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. There is no doubt about it. It's right around the corner from the heart of Times Square, only a few blocks from Madison Square Garden/Penn Station, which was great because we came in on the train from Philly, and it was only a 10 minute walk from our destination (Terminal 5). However, from the moment I checked in, nearly every moment I spent in the hotel was awful. Check in was quick, but then I got to the room. I had read these rooms were small, but I had no idea what i was in for. Barely room to walk. The clock had not been adjusted to account for daylight savings time, which had switched almost a month prior. The beds and pillows were extremely uncomfortable. Not only did I get a terrible night of sleep because of the beds, but at about 7 am, workers resumed the loud, unrelenting renovation work they were doing down the hall. I woke up to take a shower after I finally couldn't take the noise anymore, and the water pressure was like a fire hose. I never thought I'd ever complain about a hotel shower having TOO much water pressure. I was wrong. The second night wasn't much better, although the renovation work didn't start till 9 the next morning. However, a member of the cleaning crew came into our room at 7:30 without knocking to clean, and when she saw we were still in bed, just shut the door without saying a word. I have had bigger, nicer rooms with more comfortable beds and better service at Super 8 motels. I strongly advise against this hotel, despite it's great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not renovated yet!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaMom42
Reviews.Content: Just stayed on the 18th floor at Milford Plaza in March 2011. Read reviews from others stating wonderful renovations. The entire hotel has not been renovated. We heard the 18th floor was closed after we left to begin the process but you need to call and check before making your reservation. You DO NOT want to stay on a floor like the 18th. Let's just say Shame on MP for renting those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “okey place, rather small and old-fashioned rooms”
Reviews.Author: FreddyandPam
Reviews.Content: the only selling point for this place is probably its price and location, we got 30% off for 5+ nights.. the nights are rather loud from other toilets and street-noise and the rooms are everything but fancy..but it's still okey for a small budget and the location rocks.

Reviews.Title: “If the only thing you care about is location, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Andteach
Reviews.Content: After closing for a year long renovation, the Milford Plaza reopened. I had stayed here several times in the past and knew the rooms to be small and the bathrooms barely adequate, but I expected the "new" Milford Plaza to be different. It wasn't. It was even seedier. The security was gone, the side door entrance closed, but otherwise I could see no difference anywhere. The bathrooms had only one small shelf, missing tiles, dripping faucets and very little water pressure. The mattresses were so bad that when you sat on them, they compressed to a couple of inches. The single electrical outlet in the bedroom was only accessible by moving the bed. Nevertheless, the location is phenomenal. I got a special deal and the rooms were only $130/night. I certainly would have been upset had I shelled out the $250/night going rate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location with room upgrade for free...”
Reviews.Author: markyandliza
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Milford Plaza for 3 nights. We got the room for $111.00 per night which was an amazing deal. When we checked in they upgraded us from a double to a queen for free... The best part it was a corner room with view of 8th and 44th street right on the corner... Some may say to loud with traffic but what is NYC all about :) First time at this hotel in NYC but will be back for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: graingern
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milford for 8 nights over St. Patrick's Day in New York. The room standard double room was small but spotless. Room service came everyday. All the staff were very friendly. The location was not bad either only two blocks from Times Square and there is a subway station nearby. Also the Port Authority subway and bus station is only down the street so you have access to buses to Washington Boston etc. (If buying tickets from the gray hound kiosk make sure you confirm the correct gate as the gate on your printed ticket may be different to the actual gate your bus goes from). There is a little deli on the same ave. just one street over think its called "off Broadway deli". Three pancakes for breakfast for $2.95 nice. If you like to walk just rob a map off the guys selling the double decker bus tours and take the subway to all the sights its a lot cheaper and subway is very easy to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading advertisement and untruthful service.”
Reviews.Author: Kc287
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in the Milford Plaza in Times Square. I had called in and upgraded from two twin beds to two double beds and requested an updated room. Upon check in they gave us an oudated room that is horribly small. We had walked past a room that was being cleaned that had an updated tv and was a bigger room. I then went down to the front desk and asked if I could have a room like I had requested two months prior. I was basically told that requests don't matter and I'm stuck. I also have tried to call down to the front desk for assistance, even trying to call from my cell phone and received no answer. If their management reads this you should be ashamed of how your hotel is run. I will not stay here again due to their dishonesty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, would stay there again...!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_B_Mc
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself said here for 6 nights during the end of February. The hotel is under refurbishment, which I was aware of when making the booking. This work did not in any way impact our stay, noise was minimal (if any) and the areas of the hotel under going works was blocked off anyway. This is our fifth stay at this hotel (first time 1999), the location and value are superb. If you want 5 star luxury this is not for you, if you want a good location, friendly staff, clean bedding & bathroom and don't mind some old decor (until the refurb is complete) then this is the place to stay. For breakfast I can recommend turing right out of the hotel and walking a few blocks to 'Cosmic Dinner', great omelets and friendly atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “What a 50th birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: angelefc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at milford plaza for my 50th birthday treat. Had read some unfavourable reports and how wrong they were the hotel is old world but the standard was very good and the staff were very friendly and helpful.The hotel is currently getting upgraded and you would not be aware the work was being doneThe hotel is very close to theatres and times square is around the corner ideal for everything and a brilliant diner called Europlan would be had to beat.The red bus that tours the city is great but get the two day pass which you allows to hop on and off at will also the statten island ferry is free and passes by the statue of liberty for great photographs. When going back to new york I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned, but very nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: SULHANSOL
Reviews.Content: Above all it was a pleasant stay... Check-in was quick. Just arrived at the room and see the sink was not working, full of dirty water, called the staff that arrived within a minute and solved the problem. Cleanliness of the room was imaculatte (sheets and towels changed every day) .. great room maid. Much better than the last stay, 6 years ago. Location is the best, as Times Square is around the corner. The price was a fantastic Trip Advisor offer. Work is in progress but no noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Milford Plaza during my spring break. I needed a hotel close enough to the theatre I was seeing a show at, the Al Hirschfeld theatre, and the location and price of this hotel was perfect. I reserved my room via their website and got a rate at about $113 a night, not bad at all. When I first arrived, I was super early, about 8am, and check in wasn't until 4pm. The front desk told me that the room was ready and I could go up. First the key didn't work and I had to get someone with the master key to come up and check it, but his keys didn't work. So, with no problem, they switched my room right away. It was quick and they were really polite. The room was great. It had two windows over looking the city. It was a big room with a double bed, two side tables, a TV, a closet and a desk. The bathroom was a little on the small side, but it wasn't bad. One complaint is that the water didn't get hot. It was a warm/cool shower, but it was bearable. The bed was fluffy and very comfortable. The concierge was very helpful with directions. I checked out and had to leave my bag behind because my bus wasn't scheduled to leave until 9pm and they held my bag there with no problem. This is a great hotel with a friendly staff. I would, and probably will, definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Milford Plaza”
Reviews.Author: red83mick
Reviews.Content: milford plaza great stay location superb stayed there for 5 nights nice friendley staff very helpfull clean rooms clean bedding and towels evry day security on entrance of the night checked ur evry one that came in make sure they were staying in the hotel construction work going on never heard a thing . so much for paper thin walls never heard a thing .gym and ice machine on 3rd floor that all can use free of charge great stay

Reviews.Title: “dont worry boss hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1969blueboy
Reviews.Content: just back from the milford we can only describe our experiance but what i have read on here gives it a bad press stayed in room 1049 on tenth floor facing 8th avenue the room was clean bed changed every day had to tell maid not to clean it 1 day, never heard any noise day and or night, staff were very polite and helpful had mix up from our agent about room it got change there and then ps that room was gr8 to, got asked for key by security every time we came in late, the front desk helpful this hotel is getting unfair press ok bit worn but what are people are after?, i have just recomended to family plus am going back next year, ps there is an ice machine on 3rd floor take a bag or bucket use a duane reede bag use as fridge for cans in bath. if your landing in newark airport take the Free tram form airport to NJ Transit then take the subway to Penn Station cost $12.50 1 way the hotel is 10 blocks walk up 8th avenue or jump a cab at Penn Station save yourself a few quid. over all this was a great stay. and a stones throw from Times Square. ps little pub 2 blocks away called the mean fiddle is a nice pint and great grub and nice staff chilled there after long days out

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: mpongs
Reviews.Content: I had a little problem with my bathtub and the engineer of the milford plaza, Mr Jesus Nunez, made a really great job till i had a working bathtub even that i could change the room it was all his merit Thanks a lot Mr nunez !!! The Hotel is best located 8av 45th str in the middle of theater district with nice restaurants in the 44th or 46th str between 8av and 9av martin pongs

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS, poor service, dirty old rooms, no wiFi”
Reviews.Author: pab3925
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't cheap, at 160$ a night for the two of us, but it was in a Manhattan prime location. Fortunately, my friend checked the bed. Lifting just a corner of the mattress we found several bedbugs crawling to hide. I caught one for evidence while she screamed and ran to the reception. Even with the irrefutable evidence, the concierge was unhelpful and rude, and reluctant to give us another choice. If we had not paid in advance we would have risked the cold night for a more suitable stay. Even bone tired of walking all over New York we couldn't help but notice the unclean rooms, the leaky bathtub and the hammering noises of repairs made at night. A service we've come to expect from all decent locations, that is FREE WiFi, was charged 15$. The calls I made to my son in California were charged at a very high rate (a fact we weren't warned of). Of the 5 hotels we stayed in in USA, this was by FAR the worst. It was so bad I took the time to write this review to warn any other tourist who intends to go to this hole.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! cant beat the location”
Reviews.Author: loveswhiskey
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! Really can't beat the price for where it's located. Hotel itself is under going renovations but that didn't really interfer in our stay at all. Room was good size, comfortable, clean (our maid didnt come in one of the days, but wasn't too big of a deal as there was a ton of clean towels provided). There are a couple little things like that and the fact that the maids fixed our sink with one of our q-tips (the drain wouldnt stay up so they propped it up with it lol) but other than that we were very pleased with the hotel itself and service. Basically for the price you pay to stay here it really was a most pleasant comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: sasha51
Reviews.Content: I lucked into a fantastic weekday rate end of January here at $75/night and the room was modestly sized but adequate, clean and good beds. Location couldn't be beat - allowed me to walk to my broadway show and business meetings. I was only there at night and it was quiet, so can't say much about the daytime construction. However, when I thought to come back on a March weekend the prices had jumped to $177-$197 not a price I would think worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - can walk to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: 28970Jen
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the location, in the heart of Times Square! Spent three days there, in a double bed room, great view of the city, clean - EVEN A NEW MATTRESS! No hint of bed bugs! Very tidy room (and we're picky). Very safe area, even at night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice nights, noisy days”
Reviews.Author: xv144
Reviews.Content: We were in room 2838. A large room by NYC standards. It was a conner room with a nice view of the river and 8th ave. Clean. Great location. My wife forgot her wallet in the gift shop. It was returned with every penny. Friendly and honest staff! Construction is happening! 20 feet down the hall contruction started at 8AM Saturday with a sledge hammer pounding concrete as we were leaving for a walk of the town. They were still yelling and making construction noise up until 6:30PM, which I thought was a bit late. We thought the klunk-klunk-ka-klunk every time the heater started was charming---did not wake us at night. We got the room at an $89/night deal, so no complaints from us. Would go back if rates were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to ruin Valentine's Day!!!”
Reviews.Author: stjsnews
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza advertises their reopening and renovations all over their website and on the outside of the building. They should be fined for false advertising. We were so appalled by the first room we were given that we asked to be moved. The second room was just as bad. The wallpaper was peeling, the dresser drawers broken, the sheets had holes in them and the drapes didn't close so that you were assaulted with the neon lights of Times Square all night long. The "queen size" bed we requested was no bigger than a double. The front desk confirmed that this was their "definition" of queen size. The closet was about 5 inches deep. You could not hang clothes and shut the door. We tried calling the front desk several times but no one ever answered. When I asked about the "renovations" the hotel staff had no idea what I was talking about. The only pro for this hotel is the location. That said, there are many other hotels in the area that have been updated since the 1900's!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay at NYC”
Reviews.Author: ricardomassis
Reviews.Content: I do recommend the Milford Plaza in NYC. The hotel is not a five star hotel, nor does it claim to be. It's an old place that is in process of renovating. The room, although small, was clean. Elevators are quick. The staff seems very helpful with the guests (with special thanks to: Mr. Marcelo (Brazil), Radji (India) and Mr. Alcerbiades,. Location is wonderful. You are just 1 block from the Times Square. The only question is about the price of the internet access: R$ 14.10 for each device (notebook, iphone, etc..). And enjoy the good music ("soundtrack") located at the lobby. Very nice!! We do 100% recommend!

Reviews.Title: “New York Charm”
Reviews.Author: luvz2travl
Reviews.Content: The Milford Plaza is a great place to stay, if you want to experience old New York charm! Back in 1928 this was the largest hotel in New York City, and it still holds its own against the newer, more modern hotels in the city. I've stayed at several others in the city, and always come back to the Milford Plaza. Sure, our room was small, and that's what makes it so special! The location is great - just steps away from Time Square, Broadway Theaters, great restaurants, and the metro. Security is in place, and the staff is friendly and courteous. I'll return to the Milford Plaza in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location. Recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Edinburger19
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, lovely clean and comfortable rooms and nice staff. I would definitely recommend this for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Internet rippoff”
Reviews.Author: markmcdonnell
Reviews.Content: The milford plaza hotel charged me $14.10 per device connected to the Internet per day. That's $42.30 per day for 1 person in a single room with an ipad, laptop and iphone. The connection was so slow that i had to connect my ipad to read mails while i was waiting for mails on my laptop to send. I also connected my phone once per evening to skype my family which was a waste of time as it kept cutting out. What a disgusting blatent rippoff. I'm furious. I expressed my discust at reception and the best they would do is remove a total of $28.20 from my bill. While i fought my corner at reception a guy beside me that stayed 2 nights was being charged for 4 days internet connection. The manager would not come to the desk to speak to us despite our continued requests and instead left the girl on reception to deal with all of the unhappy customers that were waiting. They need to be exposed for this blatent and criminal rippoff!! Ps: the rooms are tiny and grubby with hair all over the sheets and toilet floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great price in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: StatenIsland333
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is not a five star hotel, nor does it claim to be. This is an old hotel that is in process of renovating. Our room, although small , was clean. The elevators are quick. The staff seem eager to please. Location is wonderful. You are steps from the heart of Times Square. I do wish though that there was more obvious security and monitoring as to who goes in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andre_BR_11
Reviews.Content: Don't get fooled by their website. The rooms are ridiculously small, almost no space for your luggage. Furniture is old, heavy, looks like grampa's house. My bedsheets had holes on it. Hot water is almost at room temperature. Little sound isolation from the corridor, you hear every door closing, every conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, not so fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojotn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Milford many times over the years and this is the first time I've been dissatisfied. Supposedly the hotel had been "renovated" over the last year (it's been closed for a year) and recently re-opened. I was traveling with my adult daughter and we had many laughs over the size of the room (yes, NYC rooms are tiny, but this one was the tiniest I've ever seen), the bathroom that you could barely turn around in and a tub that wouldn't drain and a shower with no water pressure, the paper-thin walls, and the mirrored wall to make the room look bigger. It was really cold when we were there, and every time the heat came on it went clunkclunk, clunkclunkclunk, CLUNK CLUNK CLUNK!!!!, but then it quieted down once it got going. So...the redeeming value? The location and the price. $119 per room (that's the "Renovation Special"). Would I recommend the hotel and/or stay there again myself? At that price, YES. Just be aware that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: sacman43
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive when I read that the hotel had been sold and that the total renovation had not been completed. I wasn't sure if any work had been done or if the Milford was just reopening with new owners. Well I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was wonderful and the staff enthusiastic and very helpful. We stayed here four years ago and our room this time was definitely nicer. There were some issues with the shower working intermittently and the room had been smoked in, but overall it was a wonderful experience. The location can't be beat if you are going to the theater. I would recommend the "new" Milford to anyone. Thanks for 5 wonderful nights in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and top location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahr89
Reviews.Content: I was anxious staying here after reading all the negative feedback about this on trip advisor. All the staff are friendly and extremely helpful. It is just off Times Square and while it doesnt have its own restaurand it is surrounded by many that you can take your pick from. Our room was lovely and clean. It was cleaned every day and we had fresh bedlinen each night. The bathroom was spotless and very clean and we were given a large amount of fresh towels each night. The room was nice and warm and the beds were lovely and comfortable. Renovations are still ongoing but you would would hardly be aware of this as there is no high noise levels. I would recommend this hotel to my friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, Pleasant & helpful staff, 24 hr deli across street”
Reviews.Author: Theresmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milford just a week ago in January. I had my car parked - valet was helpful and timely, I checked in asked for a room with a front view - got it immediately, the valet helped me with a few restaurants close by. The room was comfortable -very clean with a clean bed and bathroom. I wasnt in it much but was impressed with the cleanliness of the room in general. Theres alot of renovation going on and the upper levels are aged but being renovated. I like the old elevators - the deco look is fun. A good clean place in a great location. Your in Manhattan paying squat for a room -all in all this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, comfortable bed and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lomcovaks
Reviews.Content: The Milford's being upgraded at the moment with lots of building work going on but the room was perfectly adequate with comfortable bed. Lack of drawers may annoy some people but I'm a guy - can live out of a suitcase no problem. Breakfast isn't included but hey, for their prices in downtown Manhattan who's complaining with the number of eating places right on the street? In fact, Starbucks double up as breakfast joint and free wi-fi access to circumvent the Milford's rather extortionate $14.50 per 24hrs internet charge. No, it's not the Novotel but then it's a fraction of the price. One tip - the lifts don't have a normal 'call' button and then you select your floor in the elevator. You punch in the floor number in the keypad at the lobby and the display indicates which elevator to get ie. A, B, C, D etc. You just walk into the right on and off you go.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Five Star But Clean And What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: stratcat45
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milford in 2007 before the renovation closing. It's in a good location and clean. There aren't any ammenities but I only wanted a clean place to sleep. Went back after the renovations this month (01/11) and nothing has really changed. Not quite sure what they renovated, but I had the same as before, which is fine. Someone else's reviewed complained about tipping - who were you tipping? I didn't tip anyone. There's complaints that the hotel has no room service or restuarant - hmmmmm...maybe you should of read up on the hotel before booking (they don't claim they have them). There are several nice places to eat directly across the street. I'd stay here again - clean and affordable. I'm in NY there's more to do then sit in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is absolutely fine if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: sarahbboston
Reviews.Content: I always find the star-rating system confusing. One person's four-star experience is not the same as another's. That's because one rates one's experience not against some generic rubric, but against one's own expectations. This hotel earns four stars from us not because it was anything spectacular, but because it met our expectations: Here's what we were expecting and what we got: - it is right in the theater district and one block from a show we were seeing, so the location was right for us - the price was very reasonable: we received the 30% rate which is part of the grand reopening promo, which meant we got two rooms with two double beds for around $200, including taxes. Hard to beat. - The rooms were just fine. The sheets were clean and cozy white cotton, the mattresses and pillows perfectly nice. The temperature was fine, the shower was hot, and there was no visable grime/mildew, etc - we had a pretty few of the city, not of an air shaft (which I have sometimes had at a much higher price) BUT the hotel rooms are old and tired and would do well to be renovated, which I guess is underway: our rooms were certainly not yet renovated. The wood trim around the bathroom doors has been painted a million times, and the heater rattled somewhat. The walls must be fairly thin so we could hear our next-door neighbors very faintly (luckily, they were our family). The hotel does not have a restuarant, room service, a pool or a ... well I guess anyting else. Ther are no coffee pots, but we didn't care because we left at 5am. A note about the service: everyone was perfectly polite and pleasant to deal with. We did not test the problem-solving abilities of the staff because we didn't bring anything to their attention. So the bottom line is that if you need a decent place to sleep, shower and hang your clothes, this is pretty darn great. If you are expecting a full-service luxurious resort-type hotel, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: rldavis82
Reviews.Content: The place is very tiny, but not bad at all. The walls are thin, but I was very surprised b/c overall I didn't hear too much from neighbors. The room was clean and neat, and that's all I could ask for. The price was great for a clean room in the heart of Manhattan! Close to everything! If you're looking for a simple clean room that's close to everything, I would reccomend Milford Plaza. We had fun!

Reviews.Title: “Location fine.. Hotel, room, and everything else sux.”
Reviews.Author: ginoue
Reviews.Content: No-where to eat. No service (though cleaning moderate.) Bathroom and room faling apart. Water presure and hot water going up and down all the time. A small store where you could buy turist stuff high-end price. No service, the New york tip also an issue here.. tip doorman, tip again suitecase carried 5 meters from street into the orther side of front door, etc.. ( EAT at 9th avenue much lower price and better food. ) No breakfast, no room service no nothing.. ( two twin beds ) .. should be one or two stars lower than rated out there. (Perhaps once it was 3-4 stars today one (or max 2 if you compare to a motel - but only location of hotel is ok. nothing else.)

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: GoJints
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the beginning of January - my clients put me up here. I had stayed here in the mid-80s. The rooms were tiny then, and haven't really changed that much this time around. I know they are renovating, but I don't believe either room I had was one of the 'newer' rooms. I ended up changing rooms as someone was smoking in the room near me, even though it is a non-smoking hotel. The front desk staff was very helpful and changed my room right away when I called down to complain. They were also helpful when I had some problems connecting to the wireless so I could work in my room. There were issues with the tv not working (the cable was out throughout the hotel) and a major leak in the lobby, but then I wasn't in the hotel for anything but sleeping at night. Minor complaints - no restaurant in the hotel. To get breakfast, I had to go across the street to the deli. Dinner was any of the many wonderful restaurants in the area (Restaurant Row is just down the street.) It would have been nice to have a coffee maker in the room so I could get my morning coffee while I was dressing to go out. Another complaint - the cost of the wireless was $14.10/24 hour period. Seems a bit high for a hotel in the midst of renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value for money,you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Sunseekertam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after we had just moved up from wall street in which we stayed for 2 nights in a brand new doubletree hotel so first impressions of the room and hotel were 'god this is very dated' but i was prepared for that as i had read reviews and after the first night and impression it was absolute fine we settled in and had a great time.Location fantastic close to everything and the lobby was lovely.Lift system was the best we have ever experienced we never had to share one with anybody,never had to wait or stop at every floor... its like your own personal elevator very advanced.The corridoors are horrible quite scary but just need new carpets and wallpaper and thats it so can see past it.Room 844 was a corner room,it was cleaned every day and didnt see one bug.Had a flat screen tv and the channels were sufficient as we were out all day and night so only had it on for backround noise.We did have an interconnecting room which was quite noisy but we did ask if we could change and that would have been no problem but decided to stay put as we only had 2 more nights.A coffee making machine would make a welcome accompainment to the rooms and a new shower head.The safe wasnt attached to anything so wasnt really safe but we just took our personal belongings with us every day anyway.We left ipods and spare change on the side and was never touched so is a safe enviroment.You have to remember how much you pay though,we paid 60 pounds a night which for times square location is amazing,we could have paid more if we had wanted to (last year we did and thought what a waste as we never used the hotel facilities) but whats the point when really you are hardly in there to sleep and wash!!! The business centre was lovely and you can see on that floor how it will look once refurbished and its so much more welcoming.The manager was very helpful as I had a couple of queries and was always on hand and pleasant. To sum up if you want to go to new york to explore,shop and eat and drink then stay here as its location is perfect but just be prepared for a hotel in which is a little dated but is great to just crash,I love my modern hotels and luxuries but prefered to save my money to spend over there rather than on a hotel.Its a great base and will be absolutly ideal once it is finished,but is great value in the meantime.

Reviews.Title: “Milford Plaza”
Reviews.Author: MarciaZ3
Reviews.Content: Awesome location in the heart of the city....good value, typical NYC size room, but clean and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure it's worth the sacrifice for price alone”
Reviews.Author: tourster
Reviews.Content: So we found a cheap deal online for the Milford Plaza, claiming it was newly renovated. Although the lobby might have been more recently renovated, the rooms were anything but. Apparently there are renovations being undertaken for rooms there, but none of those were ready for occupation yet. So we were left in one of the old run-down ones. Granted, I never expect much for space in NYC, but the room barely accomodated the 2 double beds let alone our luggage. It was a bit of a shuffle with 3 people in the room trying to clamor over each other. But being cheap (or lazy) we stuck it out for 3 nights, surprisingly. A couple of us have lived in NYC before, so we were okay with getting over the space issue. But the cleanliness factor definitely left something to be desired. The worst, though, was the banging of the room heater which kept us up all night. I would periodically have to switch off the heater at night for some quiet, but turn it on once the room was back to freezing. We asked the front desk to look into this and the maintenance guy they sent up unhelpfully said that it was the steam coming through the pipes and there was nothing he could do. Which meant 3 sleepless nights. Thankfully, the location on 8th avenue b/w 44th and 45th led us to a lot of coffee shops nearby (and some cute diners in HK just a short walk away) that kept us caffeine-fueled for the stay. But suffice to say, I definitely would search for another hotel in a similar (or higher) price range before subjecting myself to a stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “first and last time i would stop here.”
Reviews.Author: jandvclemo
Reviews.Content: after going in are first room the bed was so small then we got another room as soon as we got of the lift this smell hit you and the room was like someone left a pair of 3 year old socks in there. we then changed again on the 25th floor there was no smell and the bed was a good size but the rooms are well worn in this hotel. however the staff was good and location great. put next time i would stop some wear els.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: joanrob2
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I've ever been to. I felt like I had been banished to one of the smallest, dirtiest rooms I've ever seen. We switched rooms twice, the first one smelled so bad we couldn't even stay in the room to call downstairs. Awful bed (small queen), no closet, one side table, old tv, run down bathroom, looking at another building. When we complained they gave us the same size room, with a view of the street. It was worth losing $175 just to get out of there. They said they wouldn't even consider a refund even though we weren't in either room for 5 minutes. Don't even consider this hotel. We moved to the Park Central which was cheaper and had a wonderful room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No Services”
Reviews.Author: Drox0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine if you just want a place to sleep. There is no restaurant, no coffee, not even maid service while we were there for two nights and three days. Great location on 8th Ave. Walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Subway. Across the street from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. Just don't expect anything more than a bed to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: bakersdaytona
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights and was able to check in early. This is where my satisfaction with the Milford began & ended. The room was small w/queen bed 2 flat sheets on the bed, no blanket or comforter and there were visible stains on the boxspring. The TV was one of the old ones with the huge back and was on a cracked TV stand. The bathroom was small, smelly and had mold in the bathtub. The hallway to my room was a maze and the carpeting in the halls was rippled, stained and extremely dated. Not to mention the DANGER ASBESTOS signs posted along the hallway to my room. Although this is all unsettling, when I made the reservation I was told I would have a renovated room. Fortunately, I went to the business center at the Milford and got a great deal on Priceline at a 4 star hotel for $140.00 a night. While in the business center, 3 other people were looking for different accommodations. One young couple had booked 16 nights and were from South Africa. I hope they were able to find a different place. The location for the Milford is great, but until they truly renovate, I would stear clear of this place. By the way, in the evening, the Milford Plaza neon signs reads, "MILFO PLA"

Reviews.Title: “Location and good rates”
Reviews.Author: DaniDionello
Reviews.Content: Loacation is perfect for everything you want to do. There is a subway station in the next block. The room was a litlle dated...but it was clean, and the bathroom too. We were out the entire day, so we just need a good rest, and it was. I´d be there again.

Reviews.Title: “poor service and rude”
Reviews.Author: pcmusnret
Reviews.Content: had resv. for a month and finally arrived at 6:30 pm, room not ready. the room had been vacant since noon. told it would be 45 minutes. came back 1 1/2hrs later room still not ready and sink clogged. 1 hr later @ little after 9pm able to go into room. very small w/ a 27in tv. are we not in the 21st century? don't waste your money here. no food or beverage area for a cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sufficiently clean room”
Reviews.Author: sbartus
Reviews.Content: The primary advantages of this hotel are the location and price. The room was sufficiently clean, comfortable and without bedbugs. On the whole, though, the Milford Plaza remains on the old side. It's the sort of place you go to sleep at night, not spend your day.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of NYC history that we could afford”
Reviews.Author: citylover039
Reviews.Content: We decided on The Milford Plaza for my birthday weekend and we were very happy with the decision. I had stayed there nearly 20 years ago in the middle of a totally different Times Square. It's going through some renovations and will spruce up nicely but I hope the old charm stays. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable. We had a wonderful night's sleep. The elevators were amazing - like having your own personal elevator! The location could not be beat. Great quality at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “location and service both great”
Reviews.Author: Kaye255068
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that is undergoing renovations. The rooms were small but really clean and warm. We were on the 12th floor so there was no trouble sleeping and the beds were really clean and comfy. NO bedbugs, cleaners paid attention to detail, linen changed each day and hot water was hot and good pressure. Staff couldn't do enough to help us and late night check in and afternoon check out was really a bonus. They stored our bags without a fuss at the end of the stay and found us cabs when we needed them. It is old and tired but we quite liked that - a bit of old NYC and that's what we came for. Location cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Don’t Even THINK About Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: verypikytraveler123
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I have EVER stayed at. We checked in on a Saturday and were SUPOSE to stay for 2 nights. Our room was ready around 4.00 on Saturday. As soon as we walked off the elevator there was plastic covering all the floors. We were told over the phone that the rooms were newly renovated. The pictures online were COMPLETY different from the room. The room was old mildew in the shower, stains all over the bed sheets, and crumbs all over the floor. When we called to see if they had any nicer rooms the lady started yelling us and had the nerve to tell us to go check out also she had the nerve to say this was the nicest hotel in New York when I asked her if she was kidding she went off on me and went on and on about how nice this hotel was. The shower had an "Anti scalding device" there fir it would turn off after it reached a certain temperature. The only problem with this is that the temperature that it turned off was Luke warm at best. We must have turned on and off the shower every 2 minutes. When we came back from our show around 11 we took a shower and it would not shut off. We had to WLAK down to the front desk since they would not answer there phone and tell them what was going on. It took the guy an hour to fix the shower it was 11.45. The next morning at 4.30 AM we all broke out in a swea. We had it at that point and the next morning we called the Stay Bridge Suites which was actually chipper and 100 time nicer then this dump. Thankfully they did allow us to check out early and gave us our money back for the second night. We did encounter 1 nice staff meeker and her name was Lori (I think) and she was the housekeeping manager. She was a very nice lady. Also the hotel was in a good location and the Elevators were very fast, that the only good thing about the hotel. The rest of it was AWFULL. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, very old hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaryninSeattle
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing! You are literally two blocks from Times Square, right next to the Subway Station, right on the street with quite a few play houses & really right in the center of it all. We felt very safe returning to our hotel at night. The room itself was very clean and well kepy. But, it is very tiny- just fit a small desk, night stand, tv & bed. We had a corner room which seemed to make the space larger. The closet is very tiny- maybe 3 feet long. It is a very old room, with old ammenities. The radiator (which we kept on as it was 22 degrees) was very loud, and woke us up a few times during the night when it was turning on. The walls are thin & we could hear our neighbors watching TV during the night. The hallways/ lobby are in the process of a remodel, which makes for an intersting situation. A few days we were waiting for the elevator while construction workers were working right next to us. One was about 5 inches from hitting my face with a large metal beem as he walked by. The website says grand re-opening which leads one to believe it has just been remodled- this is not the case. It was just closed & is now opening again after a year. I would stay here if you don't care what your room looks like, but want something comfortable & with a great location. Also, they do have a very basic business center. You can print a boarding pass for free, but you will be charged for internet if you need it for anything other than a boarding pass.
